## FSL Frequently Asked Questions
We Have Answers!
What are the requirements to join?  How much does joining FSL cost?  What about meals?  What about moving into the chapter house?  Who do I turn to if I have a concern?  More questions? 
What are the requirements to join? 
Each fraternity and sorority has different membership criteria. Oftentimes, these include some sort of GPA minimum requirement or academic expectation. Students are encouraged to speak with members about these requirements during the recruitment process.
[FSL Requirements ](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/parents/faq.html "View FSL requirements")
The financial commitment for joining a fraternity or sorority varies depending on each chapter and council. The fraternities and sororities each have their own dues, ranging from $100.00 to $5,500.00 a semester. It is helpful to note that the first semester of membership tends to be the most expensive.
[COST](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/parents/faq.html "Learn more about the cost of FSL")
If your chapter is housed and has a kitchen, after recruitment you will have the opportunity to alter your meal plan with Residence Life and Dining. Depending on the chapter, meals may be provided daily or weekly. If you live in the house in the future, meals are included as part of the fees.
[MEALS & DUES INFORMATION](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/parents/faq.html "View meals and dues information")
Not all chapters are housed. But, if your fraternity or sorority is housed, students generally do not move in immediately. Members will still participate in all events and be fully included in FSL activities but will live in the dorms or their previous living arrangements. Members can move into the chapter house in their second year.
[FSL Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/aboutus/housing.html "Learn more about FSL housing")
The FSL community works hard to make sure each member feels safe and supported. Please, reach out with any concerns if you feel this is not the case. Concerns can be reported via a UW Cares form. These reports are not intended for emergencies but can be filled out by students or parents who would like to express a concern. These forms are looked over and addressed by a multidisciplinary UW team.
[UW Cares Form](https://cm.maxient.com/reportingform.php?UnivofWyoming&layout_id=5 "Link to the UW Cares Form")
Explore our full FAQ page to get all your questions answered!
[FSL FAQs](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/parents/faq.html "View more F.A.Q.'s")
What are the requirements to join? 
### We Have Answers!
What are the requirements to join?  How much does joining FSL cost?  What about meals?  What about moving into the chapter house?  Who do I turn to if I have a concern?  More questions? 
## Become a Part of FSL
### Join a Fraternity
Learn all you need to know about joining a fraternity at UW! Look over the requirements and recruitment process.
[How To Join](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/how-to-join/join-fraternity.html "Learn how to join a fraternity")
### Join a Sorority
Joining a sorority is an exciting step in your college journey! Take a look at the process and requirements to get started.
[How To Join](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/how-to-join/join-sorority.html "Learn how to join a sorority")
### Explore Your Options
Take a closer look at the fraternities and sororities that are at UW. Find the chapter that feels like your perfect fit!
[CHAPTERS](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/aboutus/chapter-page/index.html "Explore our chapters")
### Philanthropy
Participating in a wide array of philanthropic opportunities is one of the most rewarding experiences of being part of a fraternity or sorority. Whether you're taking part in lively fundraising events, organizing drives or getting your hands dirty with community clean-up efforts, there's always a chance to make a real difference! These activities not only give back to the community, but they also help FSL members gain a deeper appreciation for helping others while developing valuable skills in leadership, teamwork and organization. It's a fulfilling way to leave a positive mark on your chapter, UW and the surrounding community.
[FSL FUNDRAISERS](https://uwyo.crowdchange.co/ "Learn more about FSL fundraisers")
## Annual FSL Events
[Homecoming](https://www.pokes.org/homecoming "Learn more about homecoming")
UW fraternities and sororities play a key role in hosting and supporting Homecoming events!
[Greek Week](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/calendar/index.html "Learn more about Greek Week")
Each spring, the FSL community at UW gathers for a week of fun, competition and camaraderie.
[Community Service](https://uwyo.crowdchange.co/ "Learn more about FSL community service")
Through fundraisers and service projects, our FSL members are able to make a BIG impact.
### Building Leadership Skills With FSL
FSL provides unmatched opportunities to develop and refine your leadership skills. Whether you run for a position on the [governing councils](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/aboutus/councils.html "Learn more about governing councils"), participate in leadership training and workshops or take on a chapter leadership role, there are countless ways to grow as a leader. Each experience offers valuable insight and the chance to make a meaningful impact on your community. These opportunities help you build confidence and gain essential skills for your time in FSL and at UW, as well as far beyond!
[Leadership Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/programs/leadership.html "Learn more about leadership events")
## Lasting Connections
The list of reasons to join a fraternity or sorority can go on and on and on, but when speaking to FSL alumni, one theme stands out above all: the connections. FSL members create a strong, supportive community that lasts a lifetime, offering lifelong friendships, professional networks and personal growth opportunities.
## FSL by the Numbers
Our FSL council members are committed to upholding the highest standards while fostering growth within our chapters. By organizing a variety of fraternity and sorority events, we are able to engage the UW and the surrounding community, creating opportunities to make a lasting and positive impact on a larger scale.
16
number of FSL chapters at UW
436
number of FSL members at UW—and we’re still growing!
$60000
average amount raised for philanthropy, per year. We are always aiming higher!
[Donate to FSL](https://give.uwyo.edu/schools/UniversityofWyoming/giving-day-2024/pages/fraternity-and-sorority-life "Link to donate to FSL")
Looking to support FSL? We greatly appreciate any donations that help fund a variety of programs, events and initiatives. Your generosity allows us to continue building a stronger, more connected community!
[Report a Concern](https://cm.maxient.com/reportingform.php?UnivofWyoming&layout_id=5 "Link to report a concern")
If there is a non-emergency concern that you need to report, you can fill out this form with all pertinent details. Your referral will be reviewed and the proper steps will be taken to address any concerns.
[Alumni Connect](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/parents/alumni-connect.html "Learn how to connect with alumni")
Alumni Connect helps you reconnect with former fraternity brothers or sorority sisters and stay updated on alumni events and FSL news (Trust us: much easier than sifting through endless social media profiles.)
[Standards of Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/programs/soe.html "View our Standards of Excellence")
To guide and assist UW fraternities and sororities to uphold our founding principles and serve as beacons for the university, many FSL chapters choose to follow and adhere to the Standards of Excellence. 
FSL is Calling Your Name!
Build lifelong connections, give back to your community and have an unforgettable experience—discover your place in the UW community today by joining FSL!
[Join FSL](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsl/how-to-join/index.html "Learn how to join FSL")

  * Laramie, WY 82071
  * Dept. 3265
  * Email: fsl@uwyo.edu
  * Phone: [(307) 766-6306](tel:307-766-6306)

# UW Summer Camps and Programs
## Exciting Learning Opportunities for K-12 Students!
The University of Wyoming offers a wide variety of summer camps and programs designed for students from elementary through high school, as well as opportunities for educators. From exploring the arts through music and textiles to diving into STEM fields and athletic skills, there’s something for everyone. Our camps provide hands-on experiences, expert instruction and a chance to explore new interests or strengthen existing talents. Whether you’re looking to ignite a passion for science, improve athletic abilities, or express creativity, UW’s summer programs offer the perfect environment for learning and growth.

## Events for PROSPECTIVE students
If you're a high school junior or senior interested in learning more about the University of Wyoming, we invite you to explore our upcoming admission events! These events are a great opportunity to dive into the admissions process, discover what UW has to offer and get a feel for campus life. You'll have the chance to tour our beautiful campus, meet current students and hear from admissions staff—all in a fun and informative setting. Whether you’re already thinking about applying or just curious to learn more, these events are designed to help you make an informed decision about your future at UW.
[Admissions Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)

# University of Wyoming Admissions
The University of Wyoming welcomes students to experience a one-of-a-kind education in the heart of the Mountain West. With our dedication to academic excellence and student-focused education, UW provides an environment where students can thrive both academically and personally. Admission to the University of Wyoming is just the first step to achieving your dreams.

## Why The University of Wyoming?
###  Strong Academics 
The University of Wyoming offers more than 200 areas of study, giving students the opportunity to explore diverse fields and discover their true passions. At UW, we believe in empowering students to pursue their interests with purpose and dedication. Our university's size allows for unique advantages, including more opportunities for hands-on learning, in-depth research experiences and closer connections with faculty members. This student-centered approach to education is a cornerstone of UW. It empowers our students to prepare for success and make an impact that extends far beyond our campus.
[Explore Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)  
  

[Student Success Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html)
Explore resources to support your academic journey.
###  Affordable 
“We value access to an affordable, high-quality education.” This is the very first line of our [Values and Propositions](https://www.uwyo.edu/strategic-plan/value-statements.html) because we wholeheartedly stand by this sentiment. We know that Wyoming is full of hardworking and driven individuals who can have an immense impact on making their community, their state, and the world a far better place. At UW, we are committed to breaking down financial barriers by offering competitive tuition rates, generous scholarships and financial aid options.
[Explore Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
[Estimate Your Cost of Attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)
We factor it all in to give you peace of mind.
###  No Place Like UW 
The University of Wyoming campus and surrounding community is simply unmatched. Your UW experience goes far beyond the classroom—think hiking, skiing, fishing and camping in [world-class outdoor spaces](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/student-life/top-10-laramie.html). And when it’s time to unwind, you’ll find [one of the best downtowns](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html) in the country (seriously—Laramie’s award-winning Main Street Alliance proves it).
[Explore UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/index.html)
Visit UW for Yourself
[Schedule a Weekday Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/index.html)[Learn About Walk-In Tours](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)[Experience our Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)[Join us for an Event](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
[Plan Your UW Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)   

From parking to lodging partners, everything you need for a great visit. 
## Discover the Full UW Experience
Admission to the University of Wyoming opens doors academically and beyond. Choosing the right university is a big decision and our admissions office is here to provide all the information you need to feel confident in choosing UW!
Hear from UW Students 
UW [Student Blogs](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/index.html) are your way to get firsthand insight into campus life at the University of Wyoming. Hear from your peers and learn about all UW has to offer.
Explore Success Resources 
Discover the many ways UW [supports students](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html), from academic resources to personal wellness resources. We're committed to helping you thrive both in and out of the classroom!
Browse UW's Colleges & Schools 
Get to know the Colleges and Schools that shape the University of Wyoming. [Explore the full list](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/colleges.html) to see how each one contributes to UW's academic community and student experience. 
### The World Needs More Cowboys!
At the UW, our students embody Poke Pride and what it means to be a Cowboy. UW is a symbol of leadership, innovation and determination. In the classroom, on the field or in the community, UW students are shaping the future and making an impact. Cowboys are; leaders in their field, problem solvers, innovators, changemakers in their communities, builders of the future and dedicated to excellence.
Welcome the next generation of Cowboys to UW!
[Explore Cowboy Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/areas-of-excellence.html)
## Your Path to the University of Wyoming
Select Your Student Type
First-Year Students  Transfer Students  Graduate Students  International Students  Additional Student Categories 
First-Year Students 
Starting at the University of Wyoming is an exciting experience! With exceptional academic programs and a vibrant, welcoming community, students are drawn to UW. Our admissions team is here to guide you every step of the way, ensuring you have everything you need for a smooth and successful transition to campus life.
[First-Year Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html)
Transferring to the University of Wyoming is an exciting step forward in your academic journey! At UW, transfer students are not only welcomed but also set up for success. The UW admissions team can help you transition smoothly, providing guidance through the entire admissions process. Whether you’re bringing in credits from another school or changing direction, our team is here to help.
[Transfer Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/index.html)
UW offers a diverse range of prestigious graduate programs, and we're excited to guide students through the admissions process. While there are general requirements for all grad students, each program has its own specific criteria. Fortunately, our UW admissions team has the resources and has expert staff to support you every step of the way.
[Graduate Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)
Navigating the admissions process as an international student can feel daunting, but we’re here to make it easier! From ensuring you have the right documentation to connecting you with expert advisors, our team is dedicated to supporting you every step of the way. At UW, you’ll always have the help you need to make your transition smooth and successful.
[International Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/index.html)
From military veterans to non-degree-seeking students, there’s a path for everyone at UW. Our team is here to support your unique journey and connect you with the resources you need to succeed. No matter your background or goals, you’ll find the guidance and community to help you thrive.
[ADDITIONAL STUDENT CATEGORIES](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/index.html)

### Scholarships

Accessing the financial aid that is available to you is a key step in your admissions process. This support allows you to shift your focus from finances to academic success!

### Admissions Representatives
UW's Admission Reps are here to help you navigate the world of college admissions! It can feel like a lot, but we are here to help.  
  

[Make an Appointment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html)
### See What UW is All About
From your first campus tour to confirming your enrollment, UW offers admissions events tailored to every step of the college search. Whether you're just starting to explore through our Campus Pass program or joining us for a New Student Day as a future Cowboy or Cowgirl, you’ll get a genuine look at what makes the University of Wyoming unique. We also host virtual sessions and webinars—so no matter where you are, you can connect with us and get your questions answered.
[ADMISSIONS EVENTS](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
## Contact the Admissions Team!
Have questions or need help navigating your next steps? The Office of Admissions is here to support you. Whether you're curious about programs, application details or campus life, we're just a message or call away. [Reach out](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)—we're ready to help you move forward with confidence.
[Admission Requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html#requirements)
Step 1:
Check UW’s admissions requirements. Being prepared will relieve some stress and help ensure a smooth application process.
[Online Application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Step 2:
Complete UW’s online application or the Common Application to get the admissions process started. This is a quick and easy application that takes just a few minutes to fill in.
[Submit Transcripts](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html#requirements)
Step 3:
Submit your official high school transcripts. Your official transcripts will be submitted from your current school to UW Admissions. Be sure to contact your school to inform them of this crucial step.
[Start Dreaming of UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html)
Step 4:
From exploring UW’s course catalog to daydreaming about cheering on the Cowboys at War Memorial Stadium, give yourself plenty of time to get excited about what the future will bring!
Apply to UW
Choosing the University of Wyoming is an exciting step for your future. The World Needs More Cowboys and you are stepping up to take the reins!
[Apply Now!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)

# Daily Walk-In Tours at UW
## Explore UW with a Flexible Walk-In Tour
If you're looking for a more flexible visit to the University of Wyoming, our daily walk-in tours are a great option. These tours are available Monday through Friday at 2PM and do not require the one-week notice that scheduled visits need. While the walk-in tours do not include academic appointments, they still offer a great chance to explore campus, ask questions and get a feel for student life. Simply let us know when you’ll be arriving, and we’ll be ready to show you around.
[Tour Sign Up](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/EventListing/)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Walk-In Tours ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)
[Group Visits](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/group-visits.html)
## Scheduled Visits: A More In-Depth Experience
While our walk-in tours offer flexibility, a scheduled weekday visit may include meeting with specific departments, faculty and staff (pending availability), giving you a better understanding of your academic interests. If you’re looking for a personalized experience, we recommend reserving a spot for a scheduled visit at least a week in advance.
[Schedule a Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/index.html)
## Everything you need to know for your visit
Planning your visit to UW is easy! Below you'll find helpful information about parking, lodging, the Laramie area, and more to make your visit seamless. and ensure you're well-prepared for your tour.
Parking Information 
[Parking for campus tours ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html#parking)is located west of Hoyt Hall, north of E. Ivinson and between S. 11th and 12th Streets, in the "[Future Cowboy Parking](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Hoyt+Hall/@41.3117801,-105.5818919,206m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x876890175d359f17:0xf6f25e2128f9acfa!8m2!3d41.3117801!4d-105.5818919!16s%2Fg%2F11b6t0lrkq?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkxNy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)" area. Upon arrival, check-in with the Campus Visitor Center in Ross Hall to obtain your parking permit and place it on the dashboard of your vehicle to avoid a ticket.
Lodging Options in Laramie 
Laramie offers a range of lodging options, from budget motels to charming bed and breakfasts. [Explore options ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html#hotels)and find the best place for your family. 
Things to Do in Laramie 
[Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html) is full of charm with many outdoor activities to enjoy, including hiking, skiing in the winter and exploring nearby trails. Downtown Laramie offers museums, galleries and local shops. Don’t forget to check out the iconic UW campus landmarks!
What to Bring to Your Visit 
For your walk-in tour, wear comfortable shoes as you will be walking around campus. Be sure to bring any questions you have about UW's programs, admissions process, or student life. The weather in Laramie can change quickly, so make sure to layer and bring a coat just in case!

# Wondering about Laramie, Wyoming?
## The Heart of the Mountain West
A place that balances affordability, outdoor activities, great food and culture is not easy to find. Laramie is surrounded by beautiful plains and mountains, providing easy access to mountain biking, rock climbing, winter sports and other outdoor adventures. Downtown Laramie and the central campus of UW offer endless access to culture and events comparable to what you would find in larger college towns, but with a lower than average cost of living. For those looking for even bigger adventure or entertainment events, Laramie's residents can find it only a few hours away.
> [Outside Magazine](https://www.outsideonline.com/adventure-travel/destinations/north-america/most-affordable-mountain-town/ "Open the Most Affordable Mountain town article from Outside Magazine.") calls Laramie, Wyoming "a combination of adventure, culture, and affordability."
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw)
[About Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html)
[Areas of Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/areas-of-excellence.html)
### One of the best downtowns in the country.
[Named one of the nation's top 3 main streets in 2022 Great American Main Street Award (GAMSA)](https://www.mainstreet.org/mainstreetamerica/mainstreetawards/gamsa/gamsa2022/laramie "Go to the Main Street page."), Laramie has something for everyone! Laramie is known for quaint, small town vibes, while still offering diverse options for many lifestyles. Looking for a unique or artisinal gift or a new pair of cowboy boots? Want to relax for an hour in a local cafe or have a week filled with international cuisines? Then visit [downtown Laramie](https://www.visitlaramie.org/things-to-do/arts-and-culture/historic-downtown/ "Go to the Visit Laramie page.")! 
## Around Laramie
### Shop & Eat Local
Laramie has numerous[shops](https://www.visitlaramie.org/things-to-do/shopping/ "Go to the Visit Laramie shopping guide page.")[restaurants](https://www.visitlaramie.org/restaurants/ "Go to the Visit Laramie restaurants guide page.")[downtown](https://www.visitlaramie.org/things-to-do/arts-and-culture/historic-downtown/ "Go to the Visit Laramie page.")[public art](https://www.visitlaramie.org/things-to-do/arts-and-culture/ "Go to the Visit Laramie arts page.")
  * [Visit Laramie Wyoming](https://www.visitlaramie.org/ "Go to the Visit Laramie Wyoming website.")
  * [Downtown Laramie](https://laramiemainstreet.org/ "Go to the Downtown Laramie website.")
  * Laramie Public Art Coalition
  * [Laramie Plains Civic Center](http://lpccwy.org/ "Go to the Laramie Plains Civic Center website.")


### Travel Through Time and Space
You don't have to live in a big city to have access to the world. The[University of Wyoming Art Museum](https://www.uwyo.edu/artmuseum/index.html "Go to the University of Wyoming Art Museum page.")[Buchanan Center for the Performing Arts](https://www.uwyo.edu/boxoffice/index.html "Go to the Buchanan Center for the Performing Arts Box Office page.")[Laramie Plains Civic Center](http://lpccwy.org/ "Go to the Laramie Plains Civic Center website.")
  * [Laramie Plains Museum](https://www.laramiemuseum.org/ "Go to the Laramie Plains Museum website.")
  * [Territorial Prison State Historic Site](https://historicwyoming.org/profiles/wyoming-territorial-prison-state-historic-site/ "Go to the Territorial Prison State Historic Site website.")
  * [Laramie Railroad Depot](https://www.laramiedepot.org/ "Go to the Laramie Railroad Depot website.")
  * [University of Wyoming Geological Museum](https://www.uwyo.edu/geomuseum/index.html "Go to the University of Wyoming Geological Museum home page.")
  * [University of Wyoming Planetarium](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/planetarium/index.html "Go to the University of Wyoming Planetarium page.")


### Make Transportation Easy
Laramie is easily navigable in comparison to many larger cities. Having your own vehicle is useful if you want to travel outside Laramie, but if you're staying mostly in town it isn't entirely necessary. Many of Laramie's citizens find that they prefer to travel by bicycle around town. There are[paratransit](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/transit/paratransit.html "Go to the UW Paratransit Service page.")[SafeRide](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/transit/saferide.html "Go to the UW SafeRide page.")[University of Wyoming Transit & Parking Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/index.html "Go to the UW Transit & Parking Services home page.")
  * [Laramie Bike Map](https://www.uwyo.edu/rec/outdoor-program/_files/docs/laramie-bike-map.pdf "Download the Laramie Bike Map \[PDF\].")
  * [UWYO Roundup: University of Wyoming Transit System](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/transit/index.html "Go to the UW Transit System page.")
  * [Laramie Regional Airport](https://www.flylaramie.com/ "Go to the Laramie Regional Airport website.")


### Options for travel into Laramie
If you don't have your own vehicle, the most direct route to get to Laramie is to fly in to[Laramie Regional Airport](https://www.flylaramie.com/ "Go to the Laramie Regional Airport website."). A flight from Denver International Airport to Laramie takes around 40 minutes and the Laramie Regional Airport is approximately 6 miles or 10 km from the UW campus. After arriving at the Laramie Regional Airport, you can have a friend drive you to campus or contact other[alternative transportation](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/transit/airport.html "Go to the Alternative Transportation page.")[SafeRide](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/transit/saferide.html "Go to the UW SafeRide page.")
If you have time for a more scenic route to Laramie, another popular option when traveling to Laramie from Denver International Airport is to use the[Groome Transportation](https://groometransportation.com/wyoming/?sd_client_id=bb4d654c-c464-4db2-a5a8-b9076543f122&sd_client_id=bb4d654c-c464-4db2-a5a8-b9076543f122 "Go to the Groome Transportation Wyoming Shuttle website.")
## GET OUTSIDE!
The breathtaking landscape that surrounds Laramie provides endless outdoor activities for any adventurer. Whether you are interested in hiking, mountain climbing, camping or skiing, there is no shortage of amusements. Even if you're not an outdoorsy athlete, there are endless activities for any nature lover. The summers in Laramie bring farmer's markets, [Jubilee Days](https://www.laramiejubileedays.org/ "Go to the Laramie Jubilee Days website.") celebrations and verdant green spaces to enjoy the sunshine and fresh air in any of Laramie's many parks. You can lend a hand at the [community gardens](https://www.feedinglaramievalley.org/community-gardens "Go to the Feeding Laramie Valley Community Gardens website."). For those interested in the local wildlife, you will want to participate in the UW Biodiversity Institute's [Moose Day](https://www.wyomingbiodiversity.org/index.php/community-science/bi-annual-moose-day "Go to the Biodiversity Institute Bi-Annual Moose Day page."), [Salamander Migration](https://www.wyomingbiodiversity.org/index.php/community-science/laramie-salamander-migration-initiative "Go to the Biodiversity Institute Laramie Salamander Migration Initiative page.") or [Christmas Bird Count](https://www.wyomingbiodiversity.org/index.php/research-grants/wyoming-biodiversity-minute/episode-12-christmas-bird-count "Go to the Biodiversity Institute Christmas Bird Count page.").
  * [Laramie Parks & Recreation](https://www.cityoflaramie.org/96/Parks-Recreation "Go to the Laramie Parks & Recreation website.")
  * [Vedauwoo](https://www.vedauwoo.org/about-vedauwoo/ "Go to the Vedauwoo website.")
  * [Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest & Thunder Basin National Grassland](https://www.fs.usda.gov/mbr "Go to the US Forest Service Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest & Thunder Basin National Grassland website.")
  * [Snowy Range Ski Area](https://snowyrangeski.com/ "Go to the Snowy Range Ski Area website.")


### Find Adventure at UW
UW is ranked 3rd for the best outdoor schools in the nation. With outstanding courses, clubs and campus resources based around making the most of this beautiful landscape, UW is an outdoor enthusiast's dream. Find adventure all year round at UW and be sure to take advantage of all the area has to offer during your next visit!
[UW OUTDOOR PROGRAM](https://www.uwyo.edu/rec/outdoor-program/index.html "Go to the Campus Recreation Outdoor Program page.")
## WEATHER & SEASONS IN LARAMIE
Laramie's longest season is winter, with an average of 48 inches of snowfall annually. Even with all that snow, Laramie still averages 233 sunny days per year. The summers in Laramie are known for warm days with cool evenings. With low light-pollution and so few cloudy nights, Laramie skies are perfect for viewing the Milky Way galaxy and the Perseid meteor shower every summer!
## Quick Facts about Laramie
Students, faculty and staff at the University of Wyoming come from 51 US states and territories and from 73 countries around the world. Laramie is nestled on a high plain between two mountain ranges. The high-elevation terrain surrounding Laramie is the perfect playground for adventure-seekers! If you are not used to high altitudes, it can take some adjustment to avoid altitude sickness. You'll also need to make adjustments to your baking recipes!
32,000+
Population of Laramie.
10,800+
Number of enrolled students at the University of Wyoming.
7,220ft
Elevation above sea level.
[Things to do in Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/student-life/top-10-laramie.html "Go to the Things to do in Laramie page.")Check out this student blog of the Top 10 Things to do in Laramie.
[About UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/index.html "Go to the About UW page.")Learn more about what the University of Wyoming has for you.
[Start a Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html "Go to the UW Virtual Tour page.")This virtual tour will give you a 360-degree view of the facilities and spaces on the UW campus.
[Plan a Campus Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html "Go to the Campus Visit page.")Take a virtual tour, view campus maps, watch campus tour videos or learn about in-person tours here.
Where is Laramie, Wyoming?
Wyoming is the 10th largest state in the country by area and also the least populated state. If you enjoy a cozy, college town, then you will love Laramie. If you're looking for a brief change of scenery, Laramie is just 50 miles west of the Wyoming state capital, Cheyenne, and 130 miles north of Denver, Colorado. 
[SEE LARAMIE ON A MAP](https://goo.gl/maps/9fjcLWvQbqna6B5m9 "Go to Laramie on the Google Maps website.")
## Some Historic Facts about laramie
The Laramie settlement was founded in 1868, as a stop on the Union Pacific Railroad. What started as a lawless Old West type of town named after a French fur trapper that disappeared in the mountains, it is now the home of numerous sites included in the National Register of Historic Places. UW was founded in 1886, before the territory of Wyoming became a state in 1890.
Wyoming is known as the Equality State, allowing women to legally vote and hold office in 1869, before it was officially a state. Laramie is known as the Gem City of the Plains, or "Laradise," and is located in Albany County in the state of Wyoming. 
## Contact Us

  * Laramie, WY 82071

# University of Wyoming Privacy Notice
The University of Wyoming (UW) understands that privacy is important to you. UW values your privacy and is committed to maintaining your trust. Therefore, we provide this Privacy Notice explaining how your information may be processed, managed and protected by us. This Privacy Notice describes how UW may collect, use, and share information you directly and indirectly provide when using UW websites.
This Policy Notice does not cover the practices of our third-party partners (e.g., vendors), nor does it apply to Personally Identifiable Information (PII) that we collect from or about our employees, vendors, consultants, or contractors. Additionally, some UW websites may deviate from this notice. In these cases, we encourage you to read page-specific notices to ensure you understand the applicable privacy policies and practices.
By using UW websites, you agree to the Terms and Conditions of this Privacy Notice and to our processing of personal information for the purposes stated below. If you do not agree to the Terms and Conditions of the Privacy Statements, please do not use the site or the mobile applications.  
  

**International Visitors  
** UW is located in the United States (State of Wyoming). By providing information to UW, you are transferring your personal data to the United States. If you are providing personal information and are not a resident of the United States, your country’s laws governing data collection and use may differ from those in the United States. The United States has not sought nor received a finding of “adequacy” from the European Union under Article 45 of the GDPR, and UW relies on derogations for specific situations as set forth in Article 49 of the GDPR.  
  

**What Information We Collect  
** UW collects personal information about you when you voluntarily provide it. Other services may require additional information through an account in order to access certain features; an account, created for you to authenticate into a system or service, includes personal information identifying you for the sake of the service.
"Personal information" is any information that can be used to identify you or that may be linked to you. This information is commonly limited to the information found in a public directory, such as first name, last name, postal address, email address, and phone number.  
  

**Websites  
** When you visit University of Wyoming websites, we collect and use information provided to us by your browser, IP, site requests, etc. to customize your experience. Other examples of how we may use this data include (1) to deliver the content of our websites correctly, (2) optimize user experience, (3) receive and provide marketing feedback, and (4) deter and prevent abuse of our sites.
For you knowledge, the data we collect may include the following information provided by your browser, ISP, and operating system. 
  * The public Internet Protocol (IP) address of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the website from which a device reaches a UW website (called a referrer), typically by following a link.
  * The webpages requested from the UW websites.
  * The Date and Time of Access.
  * The Operating System of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Browser Type and Version, the Monitor Screen Size and Color Depth and other plugin and program information as sent by your browser.
  * Similar data and information that may be used in the event of attacks on our information technology (IT) systems


**  
Web Analytics  
** UW websites use analytical tools provided by other companies, such as Google Analytics, a service provided by Google, Inc. We use this data to determine the number of people using our site, their journey through the websites, as well as how they find and use our web pages. These companies may separately record data such as your geographical location, device type, internet browser, operating system, your IP address, and associated information. To opt out of these services, you will need to modify your settings with them directly. To opt out of the Google Analytics advertising features outlined above, [follow Google's opt out instructions](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout).
**  
Cookies and Tracking  
** UW may also collect certain information passively, such as collecting online, non-identifying information through the use of cookies technology and/or Internet Protocol (“IP”) address tracking. Through the use of cookies, UW provides more user-friendly services. Non-personal identification information might include the browser used by you, the type of computer, the operating systems, the Internet service providers, and other similar information. The UW system also automatically gathers information about the areas you visit on the websites and about the links you may select from within the site to other sites. Most browsers are set to accept cookies. You can set yours to refuse cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent; however, if you disable cookies, the full functionality of some our sites may not be available to you.
Please note that we do not currently respond to web browser “do not track” signals or other mechanisms that may allow you to opt out of the collection of information across networks of websites and online services as there is no standard for how online services should respond to such signals. As standards develop, we may develop policies for responding to do-not-track signals that we will describe in this Privacy Notice.
**  
Other Sources  
** UW may receive information about you from other sources, including third parties that help us update, expand, and analyze our records, identify new customers, or prevent or detect fraud. UW may also receive information about you from social media platforms, including but not limited to, when you access our social media content or interact with us on these platforms. The information we may receive is governed by the privacy settings, policies, and/or procedures of the applicable social media platform; therefore, we encourage you to review them.
**  
Children  
** UW does not believe our websites are appealing to children, nor are they directed to children under 13. UW does not knowingly collect personally identifiable data from persons under the age of 13, and strives to comply with the provisions of COPPA (The Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act). If you are a parent of a child under 13, and you believe that your child has provided us with information about him or herself, please contact us our General Counsel office by phone or email.
**  
How We Use Collected Information  
** UW may use the information we collect:
  * To respond to your inquiries
  * To provide services or materials you request
  * To operate and understand how services are utilized
  * To maintain our contact list
  * To provide business services for which the information is intended
  * To assess the effectiveness of our events, campaigns, and publications
  * For information processing that is reasonably appropriate or necessary within our legal obligations


As a responsible organization, we do not use automatic decision-making or profiling. Moreover, your personal information will not be used in ways unrelated to the ones described without a clear notice and without providing an opportunity to opt-out or otherwise prohibit unrelated uses.
**  
How We Share Collected Information  
** UW may share collected information with third parties and other University parties for legitimate business purposes without your consent, including but not limited to, the following reasons or in the following circumstances:
  * As necessary to complete a transaction for you.
  * To vendors or third-parties who deliver or provide goods and services or otherwise act on behalf of or at the direction of UW, such as exam testing agencies and partners, product-fulfillment companies, third-party event hosts, other third parties who may provide services on websites that are accessible from links on one of our sites, and credit card companies processing payment;
  * To UW administration;
  * To investigate potentially fraudulent or questionable activities;
  * To cooperate with law enforcement or in response to a government or regulatory request, including if specifically requested or required, as otherwise permitted by law, and for other valid UW business purposes.
  * Required by law or by an order of a court, regulatory bodies, or governmental authority.
  * As we deem necessary to protect the rights, safety, or property of UW.


  
UW also may use your profile information on an aggregate basis – without personal identifiers – to provide the University administration and third parties with information, such as developing new features and content for the sites, and providing sponsors and others with aggregate information about our users and the usage patterns of the sites.
**  
How We Protect Collected Information  
** UW uses reasonable measures to safeguard personal information collected on its sites depending on its sensitivity. In order to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure, we have suitable physical, technical, and managerial controls and procedures to safeguard the information we collect online. Our measures follow applicable laws regarding the safeguarding of information under our control. However, no information system can be 100 percent secure.
UW is not responsible for the security of information you transmit to us over networks that we do not control, including the Internet, email systems, and wireless networks. Moreover, you are responsible for protecting your username and password and for selecting strong passwords.
We retain the information we collect online no longer than as reasonably necessary to fulfill the purposes for which we collect the information and to comply with our legal obligations.
**  
How to Contact UW  
** Subject to local law, you may have certain rights regarding information that we have collected and that is related to you. We encourage you to contact us to update or correct your information if it changes or if you believe that any information that we have collected about you is inaccurate.
To help us keep your personal information up-to-date or if you no longer wish to receive communications from us, please login to the UW website that collected your data and update your information. For general inquiries, please contact our UW’s Privacy Office below for further information.
Robert Aylward  
Vice President  
Office of the CIO  
(307) 766-4860  
raylward@uwyo.edu
**  
Privacy Notice Changes  
** UW may update this Privacy Notice as the need arises, so we encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Notice. If we make any material changes in the way we collect, use, and/or share the personal information that you have provided, we will post notice of the changes in a clear and conspicuous manner on the UW websites.
The Privacy Notice is effective as of August 20th, 2020.  
  

## Equal Opportunity Clause
Persons seeking admission, employment or access to programs of the University of Wyoming shall be considered without regard to race, sex, gender, color, religion, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, political belief or other status protected by state and federal statutes or University Regulations.
## Copyright Information
The contents of this Web site are copyright protected. Any commercial use requires permission from the University of Wyoming.

# UW Signing Day
## May 1, 2026
Signing Day is a special celebration for high school seniors planning to attend UW this fall. Whether in person or virtually, we’re making it easy to commemorate your decision. Originally for student-athletes, this tradition now celebrates all students. It's UW’s way of showing pride in your hard work and excitement for your future here.
**Haven’t confirmed your enrollment yet?**  
Confirm enrollment by May 1 to be eligible for financial awards in the upcoming fall semester.
[Confirm Enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html#confirm)

# Meet Your Admissions Representative
## Your First Stop for Guidance & Support
Our admissions representatives are here to help guide you through every step of your college journey. Whether you're just starting your search or ready to apply, this team is your go-to resource for questions about the University of Wyoming, the application process, scholarships and more.
Ready to chat? You can reach your representative by email, phone or virtual appointment—whatever works best for you. We're here to answer questions, help with applications and make your transition to UW as smooth as possible. Don’t hesitate to reach out!

# New Student Days
## A Special & Free Event for Students Admitted to UW
Admitted to the University of Wyoming? New Student Days is your chance to get a head start! This one-day event, offered on multiple dates each spring, allows you to explore campus, connect with future classmates and meet with academic advisors to prepare for fall course registration.
Choose the date that works best for you and register early to secure your spot!
[Get Prepared](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html#checklist)

### What to Expect at New Student Day
New Student Days is designed to help you prepare for your first semester at UW. During the event, you'll meet with academic advisors, register for classes and get valuable insights into campus life.
Expect an engaging day filled with opportunities to explore the campus, learn about university resources and connect with other incoming students. You’ll also receive important information on what to do before the semester starts.
[Schedule Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html)
## Planning your visit to UW
We’re excited to welcome you to Laramie for New Student Days! To make your visit as smooth as possible, be sure to review our helpful resources on parking, lodging and things to do in the area. Whether you're staying overnight or just visiting for the day, we’ve got everything you need to plan your trip.
[Plan Your Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)
## New Student Day Checklist 
To ensure you’re fully prepared for New Student Days, follow this checklist and complete each task before attending. Remember you must register for a New Student Day date in advance! 
Confirm Your Enrollment 
[Confirm your enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html#confirm) before attending New Student Days to ensure you're able to meet with academic advisors and register for your fall classes. If UW is your #1 choice, we encourage you to confirm as soon as possible so you can complete your registration during the event.
Verify Your Major 
You can view your major under your name when you initially log in to your WyoRecords checklist. Contact admissions at least a week before your New Student Day event if you need to update your major. If you are interested in double majoring or adding a minor, you do not need to do anything now. You can discuss this with your advisor this summer or fall.
Take the Math Placement Exam 
If you have not taken the ACT/SAT, we recommend taking the [Math Placement Exam](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/math-placement/index.html) at least four days prior to your New Student Day event to help your advisor recommend an appropriate math class.
Look to your WyoWeb checklist to determine your status 
  * Red exclamation mark - we need you to take the exam.
  * Green check mark - you do not need to take the placement exam.
  * Yellow triangle - you should discuss with your advisor the options for your math course.


Submit Your ACT/SAT Scores to Admissions 
Even though ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission, they are helpful for math class placement. If you haven't yet sent us your ACT/SAT results, please have them sent to UW Admissions through your testing agency. You can also email a copy of your ACT/SAT score report to UW Admissions. Please be sure it has your first and last name on it, includes the test date, and the score breakdown for each exam section.
Submit Proof of MMR Immunization 
[Submit proof of your MMR immunizations](https://www.uwyo.edu/shser/mmr-requirement.html) (measles, mumps, rubella) through the Student Health Service Online Patient Portal. This step must be completed before you can register for classes. Make sure to submit your records as soon as possible to avoid any delays.
Complete Your Housing Application 
Fill out your housing application through your WyoRecords account, including your [Living Learning Community (LLC)](https://www.uwyo.edu/figs/index.html) interest and select your meal plan.
Complete the Prepare for Registration Checklist 
Complete the [Prepare for Registration checklist](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/_files/docs/events/new-student-day/prepare-registratoin-checklist-instructions.pdf) through your WyoRecords account by clicking on Register for Classes on the first two screens and complete all steps with a yellow triangle. 
NOTE: This is different than your WyoWeb checklist when you initially login. This includes the following:
  * Opting in/out of UW health insurance coverage
  * Providing a UW Alert Cell Phone number
  * Updating contact information
  * Completing the Student Financial Responsibility Agreement


Check your UW Email Regularly 
Please check your email regularly (including spam/junk/clutter folders) for important information about not only New Student Day but other important things leading up to your start at UW this fall.
If you initially applied to UW with your high school email address, please let us know a personal email (Gmail, Yahoo, etc.) so we can update your account. We don’t want you to miss important emails that get caught in the spam filter or when your email gets shut off after graduation.
Download the Navigate Student App 
Download the [Navigate Student app](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html) by EAB Global and use your UW login information to access your account.

# Schedule Your Weekday Visit to UW
## Plan Ahead to get the Most Our of Your Visit
Welcome to the University of Wyoming! We’re excited to offer weekday visits where you can explore our campus, meet with staff and learn about academic opportunities.
You can schedule a visit at either 9:00 a.m. or 12:00 p.m., based on availability. If a session is listed on the calendar, it’s available for that date and time. If not, it’s either full or unavailable. Your visit to UW will typically last about four hours, depending on the appointments you choose and staff availability. To make sure you secure your spot, please request your visit at least one week in advance. 
[Reserve Your Visit](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/EventListing/)

### Admissions Events
In addition to regular visits, we host several special events throughout the year for prospective students. Admitted high school seniors can attend New Student Day events in March and April to meet advisors, residence life staff and other admitted students. We also offer Discovery Days for students still exploring their options, where you can dive deeper into what UW has to offer. Check out all available events and find one that fits your schedule. Click below for more details and to register for an upcoming event!
[Explore Upcoming Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
## Important Visit info
Visits with less than a week’s notice will only include a campus tour and an admissions information session, lasting about two hours. We recommend scheduling early to make sure you get the most out of your visit, including academic appointments with faculty members. During special times like Spring Break, the campus may be quieter, but we still offer campus tours and admissions sessions.
[Plan Your Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)

# Plan Your Visit to Laramie
## Experience all the University of Wyoming has to offer!
There’s nothing quite like the University of Wyoming. We are proud of our facilities, our staff and our thriving campus life, and the best way to experience it all is firsthand! Visiting campus allows you to explore our state-of-the-art facilities and meet with faculty who can provide valuable insights into the academic programs you're most excited about. You can walk Prexy’s Pasture, chat with an admissions representative and plan your fastest route from the Classroom Building to War Memorial Stadium. All essential steps to becoming a UW Poke!
[Schedule a Campus Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
Weekday Visits
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/index.html)[Walk-In Tours ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)[Group Visits](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/group-visits.html)
Admissions Events
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)[New Student Days](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html)[Campus Pass](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/campus-pass.html)[Discovery Day](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/discovery-days.html)[UW Showcase](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/uw-showcase.html)[Signing Day](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/signing-day.html)[Transfer 101 Virtual Event](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/transfer-101.html)[Summer Webinar Series](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/summer-webinar.html)[Cowboy Webinar Series](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/cowboy-webinars.html)
[Take a Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)
[Plan Your Visit to Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)
[K-12 Camps](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/camps.html)
[Future Cowboy Parking](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Hoyt+Hall/@41.3117801,-105.5818919,206m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x876890175d359f17:0xf6f25e2128f9acfa!8m2!3d41.3117801!4d-105.5818919!16s%2Fg%2F11b6t0lrkq?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkxNy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Weekday visit and tour parking is available West of Hoyt Hall. From there, you can follow [directions to the Campus Visitor Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/_files/docs/visit/cowboy-parking-to-visitor-center.pdf) in Ross Hall
[Ivinson Parking Garage](https://www.google.com/maps/place/1010+E+Ivinson+Ave,+Laramie,+WY+82070/@41.3112305,-105.5838761,1758m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x87689019c11cba2d:0x8d869bb88fa9f0cc!8m2!3d41.3112305!4d-105.5838761!16s%2Fg%2F11sw49dpz3?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDMyNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Overflow parking for weekday campus visits (Campus Visitor Center permit required), free for weekend events, and hourly parking available on the top floor during weekdays.
[Ford Stadium Lot](https://www.google.com/maps/place/War+Memorial+Stadium/@41.3117075,-105.5708596,1758m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x8768906af75cad67:0x514f3c033c29d196!8m2!3d41.3117035!4d-105.5682847!16zL20vMDYzNzE3?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDMyNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Free parking behind the Marian H. Rochelle Gateway Center available anytime besides game day. Use any unmarked spot. No permit is needed. 
### Visitor Parking Information
**For weekday visits and tours** , park in the "Future Cowboy" spots just West of Hoyt Hall. After arrival, check in at the Campus Visitor Center inside Ross Hall, where you'll receive a parking permit. If you have a handicap placard, feel free to use any accessible spot.
  

**On weekends or during special events** , permits aren’t required unless marked “Enforced 24 Hours.” Explore our parking options and be aware that athletic events may affect availability. Watch your email for additional parking details if you've registered for an event.
_*UW Admissions is not responsible for any parking citations._
[Parking Map](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/_files/parking/docs/parkingmap.pdf)

### Make the Most of Your Visit!
The University of Wyoming is located in Laramie, Wyoming. Our campus is tucked right in at the base of the Snowy Mountains and is full of exciting things to do! Of course, we recommend grabbing a beverage or snack at our [on-campus coffee shops](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/dining/dining-hours.html) or playing a game of billiards at the [Pokes Pub & Gameroom](https://www.uwyo.edu/union/pokes-pub-and-gameroom/index.html), but Laramie has so much to offer!  
  
Be sure to explore our bustling downtown ([voted one of the top 3 main streets in the nation!](https://mainstreet.org/our-network/awards-and-recognition/great-american-main-street-awards/laramie-wyoming)) and maybe even get in a little outdoor recreation at our many nearby forest and mountain areas. Discover all the reasons the locals call Laramie, Laradise.
[Visit Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html)
## What to Bring for Your Visit to Laramie
[Laramie weather](https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/b5f629e4a418e4bb39b77f5f1206ae1a2c0748e25d00b770198262f0d75f415e) can be a bit unpredictable, so it’s best to dress in layers. In winter, be ready for snow, while summer is likely to bring some sun—don’t forget sunscreen and a water bottle! Comfortable shoes are a must, especially for walking around campus. It’s always a good idea to check the weather the day before your visit so you can pack accordingly and make the most of your time on campus.
[Laramie Conditions](https://wyoroad.info/pls/Browse/WRR.TownResults?SelectedTown=Laramie)

# University of Wyoming Virtual Tour
## Explore UW from right where you are!
Take a stroll through the stunning University of Wyoming campus without leaving your home! Our interactive virtual tour lets you explore campus with ease, offering an accessible and immersive experience. You can explore Half Acre Recreation & Wellness Center, see what’s happening at Wyoming Union or simply take in the beauty of Prexy’s Pasture.   
  
From our iconic landmarks to our state-of-the-art facilities, you can get a sneak peek into UW campus life. Ready to explore? Start the virtual tour now!

# Research and Economic Development Division
## _Wyoming Relevant, Nationally Competitive,  
Globally Preeminent_
The University of Wyoming Research and Economic Development Division (REDD) advances research, service and innovation through interdisciplinary collaboration. By supporting faculty and student research, REDD drives economic growth and positions UW as a center of research excellence and real-world impact.
[ About Us ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/index.html)[ Resources ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/index.html)
[FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/fundingupdates/index.html "FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES")
Guidance and FAQs. 
## Research & Economic Development at UW:
###  For Researchers & Faculty 
  

UW is proud to work alongside some of the nation’s most accomplished researchers and faculty. As a faculty member, graduate researcher or postdoc the Research and Economic Development Division provides you with the resources, guidance and support to secure funding and launch impactful research. 
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/researchers-and-faculty.html)
Explore
  * [EPSCoR and IDeA Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/index.html)
  * [Research Development Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/grant-submissions/index.html "Research Development Office")
  * [PreAward Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/preaward-services.html "PreAward Services")
  * [Integrity & Compliance](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/research-compliance/index.html)
  * [Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation](https://www.uwyo.edu/innovation/index.html)
  * [Tech Transfer Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/technology-transfer-office/index.html)
  * [Economic Development Units](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/index.html)
  * [WYNDD](https://uwyo.edu/wyndd)
  * [WYSAC](https://wysac.uwyo.edu/wysac/)


  
Find training opportunities:
  * [Training Calendar](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/training-calendars.html)


###  For Students 
Undergraduate and graduate students at UW can access our strong network of support to help you succeed in your research journey. The Research and Economic Development Division offers a wide range of resources, guidance and funding opportunities to help you develop your ideas, secure support and bring your research project to life.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/students.html)
Explore
  * [Research Development](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/grant-submissions/index.html)

  * [Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation](https://www.uwyo.edu/innovation/index.html)
  * [Research Centers & Institutes](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/index.html)
  * [Tech Transfer Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/technology-transfer-office/index.html)
  * [Economic Development Units](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/index.html)


###  Community & Partnerships 
UW is a key driver of workforce development and economic growth across Wyoming. Our faculty, students and partners contribute research, innovation and talent to meet real-world needs. We build strong partnerships with industry, public institutions and communities to create jobs, grow industries and support statewide prosperity.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/community.html)
Find information on our partnerships:

### UW Named Top 5% Research University
The Research and Economic Development Division at UW proudly drives innovation, research and service, enriching student experiences and fueling statewide economic growth. Now a Carnegie R1 institution, UW ranks among the nation’s top research universities.   
  

“R1 status boosts the value of a UW degree, strengthens recruitment, supports Wyoming’s economy and deepens student engagement,” says President Ed Seidel.  
  

With $166M in annual research funding, UW faculty lead advances in energy, AI, agriculture, biomedicine and beyond. UW students and faculty are making an impact!
[UW’s R1 Status](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/uwyo-r1-info.html)
## Federal Funding Updates
Stay informed about federal funding opportunities and any policy changes by visiting our [Federal Funding Updates](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/federal-funding-updates.html) page. You can also find updates on agency-specific policies and archived communications to help navigate the evolving funding landscape.

# Discovery Day
## April 11, 2026
Discovery Day offers prospective students a chance to explore the University of Wyoming, experience campus life and learn about academic programs, resources and admissions. This event is designed for high school students and their families to engage with faculty, staff and current students in a fun and informative environment. Whether you're just beginning your college search or have already decided on UW, Discovery Day will help you take the next step in your journey.
[REGISTER NOW](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/EventListing/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Discovery%20Day%20Registration&eventId=701Vm00000hLKz9IAG)
### What to Expect at Discovery Day
You’ll have the chance to speak with representatives from academic colleges, campus organizations and admissions to learn more about the programs and resources that interest you. Families can take a tour of Prexy’s Pasture and a residence hall to get a feel for campus life. Lunch will be provided at UW's Dining Center at North Hall, giving you a taste of campus dining. This event is designed to give you an authentic experience of UW and help you make informed decisions about your future.
[View Schedule](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/_files/docs/events/discovery-day/2026-discovery-schedule.pdf)

# Group Campus Tours
## Plan Your Group Visit to UW
At the University of Wyoming, we welcome group visits from schools, organizations and other groups looking to explore our campus. Available Monday through Friday, group visits are a great way to experience UW, with tours and presentations tailored to meet the needs of your group. Please request your group visit at least 3 weeks in advance to ensure availability. Our team will work with you to customize your visit, including providing information on academic programs, campus life and more.
[Request a Group Visit](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_cHlUz61ZOYfYhls)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Walk-In Tours ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)
[Group Visits](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/group-visits.html)
## Tailored Group Experience
We understand that each group has unique needs and we’re happy to tailor your visit to best fit your group’s interests. Whether you're bringing high school students, community organizations, or prospective students, we can customize the tour to focus on academic programs, student life, or other areas of interest. Once scheduled, please complete and return your student information packet to us within a week of your visit date to ensure we provide the most relevant information to your group.
## HElpful TIps for a Successful Group Visit
Make the most of your group visit with these helpful tips. Below you’ll find information about planning and what to expect during your tour. Review the details to ensure your group’s visit runs smoothly!
What time do group tours start? 
We plan your visit schedule based on your stated arrival and departure times along with the availability of our students, faculty, staff and facilities. If you are running late or your schedule changes, please let us know as soon as possible so we can adjust or abbreviate your visit schedule as needed. 
Can special accommodations be made? 
Yes! Please let us know of any special accommodations that are needed at least two weeks in advance of your visit. This will help ensure the best visit experience possible. 
How many participants and/or chaperones can join a group visit? 
We do not require a specific student-to-chaperone ratio, but do require at least one chaperone per tour group. Please ensure chaperones are familiar with your visit schedule and are actively involved during the visit. We will do our best to accommodate your group. Please let us know your final guest and chaperone counts at least three days before your visit to ensure we are well prepared. 
What should we bring to our group visit? 
Our campus tours are outside, walking tours. Please ensure guests wear weather appropriate clothing and comfortable walking shoes. 
Are cell phones allowed on tours? 
Students are welcome to bring cell phones to campus and we encourage them to take pictures. We recommend that phones be on silent during the tour, admission presentations, and other planned activities to ensure students get the most out of their visit. 
Is there time for questions? 
Yes! We encourage questions throughout the visit. Some groups opt to have student prepare questions in advance to enhance students experiences. 
Additional policies 
We welcome guests on campus, however, we reserve the right to stop tours and other activities if student behavior is not appropriate.

# Summer Webinar Series
## 2026 Events Coming Soon
As part of your onboarding to the University of Wyoming, the Summer Webinar Series offers short virtual sessions for admitted students, designed to help you prepare for your first semester. These webinars cover key topics like scholarships, financial aid, housing, parking what to expect at Saddle Up and more giving you and your family a chance to plan and ask questions.
A Zoom to the series will be provided upon registration. 
[Registration COMING SOON](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/summer-webinar.html)
## Summer Webinar Series Topics
### June 10, 2025
**Scholarships & Financial Aid**  
Learn how to fund your education at UW. This session will cover scholarships, grants, loans and payment options, providing guidance on navigating the financial aid process and managing your student account. Ideal for students and families preparing for the upcoming academic year.
[Watch recording](https://uwyo.video.yuja.com/V/Video?v=13261101&a=50129222)
### July 8, 2025
**Parking, Transportation & Housing  
**Get the latest information on campus living and commuting. This webinar will discuss on-campus housing options, parking permits, shuttle services and tips for navigating campus. A must-attend for students planning their move to UW this fall.
[Watch Recording](https://uwyo.video.yuja.com/V/Video?v=13425025&a=87444172)
### August 5, 2025
**Saddle Up Preview**  
Discover what to expect during Saddle Up, UW’s required first-year college introduction course. This session will provide an overview of the schedule, activities and how Saddle Up prepares you for a successful start to your college journey.
[Watch recording](https://uwyo.video.yuja.com/V/Video?v=13594090&a=16033578)
### Get Ready for What's Next
The Summer Webinar Series is just one part of your onboarding journey at UW. Up next: Saddle Up, our required college introductory course that helps you transition to college life, meet new friends and get set for academic success. Visit the onboarding page to see all the steps that will help you prepare.
[Explore Onboarding](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/onboarding.html)
## Explore Your New home at UW
While the Summer Webinar Series is fully virtual, we’d love to welcome you to campus in person! Visiting is a great way to explore your new home at UW. Can’t make it in person? Check out our virtual tour to get a feel for life in Laramie and start picturing yourself as a Cowboy.
[Visit Us](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)

# Transfer 101 Virtual Event
## 2026 Dates Coming Soon
Join us for Transfer 101, a virtual session designed to help you navigate the transfer process at UW. You’ll hear from representatives in Admissions, Transfer Relations, Scholarships & Financial Aid and Housing, gaining insight into pre-transfer credit evaluations, financial aid and campus life. This is also a great opportunity to ask questions and learn what to expect as a transfer student.
A Zoom link to the event will be provided upon registration.
[Registration Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/transfer-101.html)
### Explore Your Transfer Pathway
Pre‑Transfer Credit Evaluation at UW offers prospective undergraduates a preliminary review of transfer course equivalencies using unofficial transcripts. It helps you assess how credits apply, plan your path, explore coursework to take before transferring and connect with key admission resources. Official review follows after acceptance and receipt of official transcripts.
[Credit Evaluations](https://www.uwyo.edu/transfer/evaluation-tools/index.html)
## Visiting Campus
While this event is virtual, you can still get to know UW! You’re welcome to visit campus in person or take a virtual tour to explore all we have to offer. Either way, we’re excited to help you get familiar with your future home at UW.

# Campus Pass
## 2026 event announcement coming this summer
Campus Pass offers a great introduction to the University of Wyoming. During this event, you'll get a taste of campus life, explore what UW has to offer and experience the excitement of a Cowboys football game. It’s the perfect way to see the campus, hear about the university's programs and feel the energy of the school spirit. Whether you’re already admitted or just curious about UW, Campus Pass is an exciting way to get to know the university and its vibrant community.
[Registration Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/campus-pass.html)
### What to Expect at Campus Pass
Campus Pass is your chance to experience game day in Laramie. You'll kick off the day exploring campus and learning about academic programs, then head to War Memorial Stadium to cheer on the Cowboys in a packed, high-energy football game. It’s a full schedule of events that combines college spirit, campus life and plenty of UW pride—all in one unforgettable day.
[SCHEDULE Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/campus-pass.html)
## Plan Your Visit
To make the most of your day at Campus Pass, be sure to plan ahead! Find more information about game day parking options around campus all within walking distance of main campus and War Memorial Stadium. If you're coming from out of town, check out our lodging and hotel discounts. Be sure to arrive early to ensure you have plenty of time to explore Laramie and enjoy the day.
[Get Planning](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)

# UW Showcase
## 2026 Dates Coming Soon
UW Showcase is the perfect opportunity for prospective students to experience all that the University of Wyoming has to offer. Meet faculty, staff and current students while learning about academic programs, student organizations, admissions and more. Whether you’re just starting your college search or ready to apply, this event will help you make an informed decision about your future. You’ll also enjoy a campus tour, learn about UW resources and get an inside look at student life.
[Registration Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/uw-showcase.html)
## Participating Colleges & Schools

The Haub School offers programs focused on environmental issues, sustainability and resource management. Explore the interdisciplinary approach to environmental education.

### What to expect at UW Showcase
At UW Showcase, you'll have the chance to engage with faculty, staff and current students while exploring academic programs and campus life. The event features a Resource Fair with representatives from academic colleges, campus departments, student organizations and admissions. You’ll also enjoy a residence hall tour to experience student living. Academic Connect Sessions will help you learn more about your academic interests and meet faculty. Lunch is provided at UW's Dining Center at North Hall, where you can connect with fellow students.
[Schedule Coming Soon](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/uw-showcase.html)
## Get ready for your visit
Make the most of your day at UW Showcase by planning ahead. Visitor parking is available near the event venue and more detailed information will be provided via email leading up to the event. If you're coming from out of town, consider staying at nearby hotels. Lunch will be provided at Washakie Dining Center the day of the event, but additional food options are also available on campus and in Laramie.
[Plan Your Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)

# Interactive Campus Map
## Find a Location at the University of Wyoming
The University of Wyoming is located in Laramie, Wyoming and home to around 12,000 students from around the world. Our students redefine what it means to be a Cowboy and their unshakeable determination helps forge the path forward for generations who will change the world. The UW campus has [so much to offer](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/index.html) so whether you're a returning or new student, we invite you to explore our incredible facilities with dozens of state-of-the-art buildings, performance and athletic centers and much more.
[Map Downloads](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/maps/index.html#downloads)

### Campus Map
