### Get the Facts
Explore our downloadable viewbook brochures to get an in-depth look at life at the University of Wyoming. We’ve created brochures tailored to first-year, transfer, international and graduate students. These brochures provide essential facts, academic insights, student life details and a breakdown of the programs and resources available to help you succeed. Whether you’re just starting your college journey or continuing your education, these resources are designed to give you all the information you need to make an informed decision.
## Request Your Personalized UW Info
### Undergraduate Students
Request information about becoming a first-year or transfer student at UW, including admissions, academic programs and campus life. Fill out the form to receive detailed information.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Undergraduate&UW=UG)
### Graduate Students
Fill out the form to request information about UW’s graduate programs, application processes and resources available to support your academic journey.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Graduate&UW=Grad)
### Online & Continuing Education
Complete the form to learn more about UW’s online programs and continuing education options tailored to working professionals.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=UWOnline&uw=online)
### Explore Over 200 Degree Programs
With more than 200 undergraduate and graduate programs, UW offers a diverse range of academic opportunities. Students benefit from close faculty interaction, hands-on learning and research experiences both in state-of-the-art facilities and the vast Wyoming landscape. Many programs also provide options for study abroad and undergraduate research, helping you build real-world skills for your future. Discover the right path for you by exploring our degree and program finder.
[Explore Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
## Experience UW For yourself
Visiting campus is the best way to see if UW is the right fit for you! Whether you explore in person or virtually, we offer multiple ways to connect. Take a guided campus tour, set up a one-on-one meeting with an admissions representative, or explore campus through our virtual tour. Located in the heart of the Mountain West, UW offers a welcoming environment and breathtaking surroundings. Discover what makes our university special and start planning your visit today!
[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)

# Artificially Intelligent Manufacturing (AIM)
Advanced materials and manufacturing are important pillars and drivers of today’s economy. They have made consumer devices like TVs and computers ubiquitous by enabling cheap mass production of reliable products, and enabled industrial applications on a scale not seen before. However, designing new materials is a slow and laborious process, requiring significant investments in capital and labor.
Recent advances in artificial intelligence allow to improve and speed up this process. In particular, machine learning techniques can replace expensive and time-consuming laboratory processes and computational simulations to quickly and reliably predict how to create materials with desired properties and how materials will behave in specific circumstances. So-called surrogate models learn how properties of materials and experimental parameters relate to experimental results.
AIM applies these techniques to materials engineering and manufacturing to reduce cost and improve performance. The center merges synergistic expertise at the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences in materials development, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, and computer science for the development of powerful methods to design and model the behavior of advanced materials and manufacture advanced devices.
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps)
[Funding Opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/engineering-initiative-funding-opportunities.html)
[Undergrad Engineering Scholars ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/undergraduate-scholars.html)
[Research Centers of Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/research-centers-of-excellence.html)
[Artificially Intelligent Manufacturing](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/aim.html)
[Our Facilities](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/facilities.html)
## Projects
### Graphene Oxide Film Graphitization via Laser Patterning
Graphene oxide can be treated with lasers to create patterns of conducting carbon within a surrounding environment of insulating materials. This allows to create nano-scale circuits in thin sheets of materials, enabling next-generation devices. Laser patterning is a complex process that requires precise real-time control to achieve the desired results. We apply techniques from artificial intelligence to achieve the necessary precise control.
Composite Failure Prediction
Determining the limits of forces that can be applied to composite materials before they break is an important problem in engineering and manufacturing. The field has developed a number of failure criteria, which allow to describe those limits in a closed functional form, so called failure envelopes. However, these functional forms are not very flexible, and require significant experimentation with new materials to be determined. We apply machine learning techniques for more flexible failure envelopes and to predict them based on very little data for new materials.
Nature-Inspired Impact-Resistant Materials
Composite microstructures observed in nature serve as templates for the development of new synthetic materials. However, it has proven difficult to reproduce the properties found in natural materials due to the interaction of intricate structures at varying length scales. Rather than attempting to replicate these materials (biomimetics), the focus of this work is to use a bio-inspired pattern generation algorithm (the Gray-Scott model), optimized by Bayesian methods from Artificial Intelligence, to design new materials with high energy absorption properties.
Activites
AIM Center Awarded NASA Grant for Manufacturing Flexible Electronics
Center PIs Johnson, Kotthoff, and Aidhy have been awarded a $750,000 grant from NASA EPSCoR to investigate ways of manufacturing flexbile electronics in space. The grant builds on expertise developed in the center on combining machine learning with advanced materials and manufacturing and will see the PIs collaborate with researchers at NASA Ames over three years to develop approaches for manufacturing electronics with low power and resource requirements that can be used for example aboard the International Space Station.
More information is available in a UW press release. The grant was also covered in an NPR news item.
AIM workshop at Materials Science and Engineering Symposium
The AIM center organized a workshop on AI and advanced manufacturing, co-located with the 2019 University of Wyoming Materials Science and Engineering Symposium. Invited speakers included David Estrada (Boise State University) and Kamal Choudhary (National Institute of Standards and Technology). In addition, AIM PIs and associated researchers presented the latest results on applying state-of-the-art AI to laser-induced graphene production, atomistic modeling, and porous media modeling.
The workshop featured a hands-on session where participants were able to use state-of-the-art machine learning modeling to optimize manufacturing processes themselves, based on real data and approaches developed by the center PIs. This was the first exposure to AI techniques for many of the approximately 25 participants, giving them an idea of the power of the approach and how to apply it in their own research.

# University of Wyoming Privacy Notice
The University of Wyoming (UW) understands that privacy is important to you. UW values your privacy and is committed to maintaining your trust. Therefore, we provide this Privacy Notice explaining how your information may be processed, managed and protected by us. This Privacy Notice describes how UW may collect, use, and share information you directly and indirectly provide when using UW websites.
This Policy Notice does not cover the practices of our third-party partners (e.g., vendors), nor does it apply to Personally Identifiable Information (PII) that we collect from or about our employees, vendors, consultants, or contractors. Additionally, some UW websites may deviate from this notice. In these cases, we encourage you to read page-specific notices to ensure you understand the applicable privacy policies and practices.
By using UW websites, you agree to the Terms and Conditions of this Privacy Notice and to our processing of personal information for the purposes stated below. If you do not agree to the Terms and Conditions of the Privacy Statements, please do not use the site or the mobile applications.  
  

**International Visitors  
** UW is located in the United States (State of Wyoming). By providing information to UW, you are transferring your personal data to the United States. If you are providing personal information and are not a resident of the United States, your country’s laws governing data collection and use may differ from those in the United States. The United States has not sought nor received a finding of “adequacy” from the European Union under Article 45 of the GDPR, and UW relies on derogations for specific situations as set forth in Article 49 of the GDPR.  
  

**What Information We Collect  
** UW collects personal information about you when you voluntarily provide it. Other services may require additional information through an account in order to access certain features; an account, created for you to authenticate into a system or service, includes personal information identifying you for the sake of the service.
"Personal information" is any information that can be used to identify you or that may be linked to you. This information is commonly limited to the information found in a public directory, such as first name, last name, postal address, email address, and phone number.  
  

**Websites  
** When you visit University of Wyoming websites, we collect and use information provided to us by your browser, IP, site requests, etc. to customize your experience. Other examples of how we may use this data include (1) to deliver the content of our websites correctly, (2) optimize user experience, (3) receive and provide marketing feedback, and (4) deter and prevent abuse of our sites.
For you knowledge, the data we collect may include the following information provided by your browser, ISP, and operating system. 
  * The public Internet Protocol (IP) address of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the website from which a device reaches a UW website (called a referrer), typically by following a link.
  * The webpages requested from the UW websites.
  * The Date and Time of Access.
  * The Operating System of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Browser Type and Version, the Monitor Screen Size and Color Depth and other plugin and program information as sent by your browser.
  * Similar data and information that may be used in the event of attacks on our information technology (IT) systems


**  
Web Analytics  
** UW websites use analytical tools provided by other companies, such as Google Analytics, a service provided by Google, Inc. We use this data to determine the number of people using our site, their journey through the websites, as well as how they find and use our web pages. These companies may separately record data such as your geographical location, device type, internet browser, operating system, your IP address, and associated information. To opt out of these services, you will need to modify your settings with them directly. To opt out of the Google Analytics advertising features outlined above, [follow Google's opt out instructions](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout).
**  
Cookies and Tracking  
** UW may also collect certain information passively, such as collecting online, non-identifying information through the use of cookies technology and/or Internet Protocol (“IP”) address tracking. Through the use of cookies, UW provides more user-friendly services. Non-personal identification information might include the browser used by you, the type of computer, the operating systems, the Internet service providers, and other similar information. The UW system also automatically gathers information about the areas you visit on the websites and about the links you may select from within the site to other sites. Most browsers are set to accept cookies. You can set yours to refuse cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent; however, if you disable cookies, the full functionality of some our sites may not be available to you.
Please note that we do not currently respond to web browser “do not track” signals or other mechanisms that may allow you to opt out of the collection of information across networks of websites and online services as there is no standard for how online services should respond to such signals. As standards develop, we may develop policies for responding to do-not-track signals that we will describe in this Privacy Notice.
**  
Other Sources  
** UW may receive information about you from other sources, including third parties that help us update, expand, and analyze our records, identify new customers, or prevent or detect fraud. UW may also receive information about you from social media platforms, including but not limited to, when you access our social media content or interact with us on these platforms. The information we may receive is governed by the privacy settings, policies, and/or procedures of the applicable social media platform; therefore, we encourage you to review them.
**  
Children  
** UW does not believe our websites are appealing to children, nor are they directed to children under 13. UW does not knowingly collect personally identifiable data from persons under the age of 13, and strives to comply with the provisions of COPPA (The Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act). If you are a parent of a child under 13, and you believe that your child has provided us with information about him or herself, please contact us our General Counsel office by phone or email.
**  
How We Use Collected Information  
** UW may use the information we collect:
  * To respond to your inquiries
  * To provide services or materials you request
  * To operate and understand how services are utilized
  * To maintain our contact list
  * To provide business services for which the information is intended
  * To assess the effectiveness of our events, campaigns, and publications
  * For information processing that is reasonably appropriate or necessary within our legal obligations


As a responsible organization, we do not use automatic decision-making or profiling. Moreover, your personal information will not be used in ways unrelated to the ones described without a clear notice and without providing an opportunity to opt-out or otherwise prohibit unrelated uses.
**  
How We Share Collected Information  
** UW may share collected information with third parties and other University parties for legitimate business purposes without your consent, including but not limited to, the following reasons or in the following circumstances:
  * As necessary to complete a transaction for you.
  * To vendors or third-parties who deliver or provide goods and services or otherwise act on behalf of or at the direction of UW, such as exam testing agencies and partners, product-fulfillment companies, third-party event hosts, other third parties who may provide services on websites that are accessible from links on one of our sites, and credit card companies processing payment;
  * To UW administration;
  * To investigate potentially fraudulent or questionable activities;
  * To cooperate with law enforcement or in response to a government or regulatory request, including if specifically requested or required, as otherwise permitted by law, and for other valid UW business purposes.
  * Required by law or by an order of a court, regulatory bodies, or governmental authority.
  * As we deem necessary to protect the rights, safety, or property of UW.


  
UW also may use your profile information on an aggregate basis – without personal identifiers – to provide the University administration and third parties with information, such as developing new features and content for the sites, and providing sponsors and others with aggregate information about our users and the usage patterns of the sites.
**  
How We Protect Collected Information  
** UW uses reasonable measures to safeguard personal information collected on its sites depending on its sensitivity. In order to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure, we have suitable physical, technical, and managerial controls and procedures to safeguard the information we collect online. Our measures follow applicable laws regarding the safeguarding of information under our control. However, no information system can be 100 percent secure.
UW is not responsible for the security of information you transmit to us over networks that we do not control, including the Internet, email systems, and wireless networks. Moreover, you are responsible for protecting your username and password and for selecting strong passwords.
We retain the information we collect online no longer than as reasonably necessary to fulfill the purposes for which we collect the information and to comply with our legal obligations.
**  
How to Contact UW  
** Subject to local law, you may have certain rights regarding information that we have collected and that is related to you. We encourage you to contact us to update or correct your information if it changes or if you believe that any information that we have collected about you is inaccurate.
To help us keep your personal information up-to-date or if you no longer wish to receive communications from us, please login to the UW website that collected your data and update your information. For general inquiries, please contact our UW’s Privacy Office below for further information.
Robert Aylward  
Vice President  
Office of the CIO  
(307) 766-4860  
raylward@uwyo.edu
**  
Privacy Notice Changes  
** UW may update this Privacy Notice as the need arises, so we encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Notice. If we make any material changes in the way we collect, use, and/or share the personal information that you have provided, we will post notice of the changes in a clear and conspicuous manner on the UW websites.
The Privacy Notice is effective as of August 20th, 2020.  
  

## Equal Opportunity Clause
Persons seeking admission, employment or access to programs of the University of Wyoming shall be considered without regard to race, sex, gender, color, religion, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, political belief or other status protected by state and federal statutes or University Regulations.

The contents of this Web site are copyright protected. Any commercial use requires permission from the University of Wyoming.

# Student Organizations
## Find Your UW Community
Your University of Wyoming experience extends far beyond the classroom. While, of course, our high-quality academic programs are essential, there are countless opportunities to enrich your time here. UW student organizations play a key role in helping you build lasting connections and develop valuable life skills. From networking opportunities to fostering a strong sense of community and belonging, the benefits of joining a student organization are endless. Getting involved allows you to grow both personally and professionally, elevating your overall college experience!

## How to Get Involved
### Upcoming Events
Stay informed about upcoming CSIL and student organization events to ensure you never miss out on exciting opportunities, activities and experiences on campus!
[View Calendar](https://uwyo.presence.io/events "View our events calendar")
### Explore Cowbell
Take a look at the full list of student organizations and explore the wide variety of options available to find the one that’s the best fit for you.
[STUDENT ORGS](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View student organizations")
### Start an Organization
You may just be the perfect person to start a new student organization to fill a gap in the University of Wyoming community. Here's how to get started!
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/forming-student-orgs.html "Learn more about how to start a student organization")
### Center for Student Involvement & Leadership
The Center for Student Involvement and Leadership plays a vital role in fostering a vibrant campus community by supporting the wide range of student organizations UW is able to offer. Beyond just assisting student groups, CSIL offers numerous opportunities for students to engage in leadership development, connect with others and expand their networks. Whether you're interested in learning about leadership opportunities, accessing valuable resources or want to stay in the know about upcoming exciting campus-wide events, CSIL is your go-to resource for making the most of your time at UW.
[Check Out CSIL](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/index.html "Learn more about CSIL")
## Finding or Building Your Community
UW’s student organizations are made possible because of you. These organizations are driven by student needs and desires. Whether you are looking through all of the available options and finding your perfect match, or you decide to create a new organization to fill a need, you are a key part of this process.
Existing Student Organizations
UW boasts over 250 diverse student organizations, each offering its own unique purpose, culture and opportunities. Whether you’re looking to get involved in academics, service, recreation or anything in between, there’s a likely group waiting for you! Explore our [complete list of student organizations](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View the complete list of student organizations") to find one that excites you and aligns with your personal interests. This is your chance to connect, grow and make a lasting impact!
Creating a Student Organization
If the student organization of your dreams doesn’t already exist, you may be interested in [forming a new student org](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/forming-student-orgs.html "Learn how to form a new student organization"). Be sure to look over the [Student Organization Constitution](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/_files/student-organizations/student-orgs-constitution-template.pdf "View the Student Organization Constitution") and requirements, and consider the organization’s purpose. Feeling excited and ready to move forward? It’s time to fill out the New [Student Org Application](https://uwyo.presence.io/form/organization-registration "Link to the Student Org Application"). Once approved, you’re all set to begin planning events and moving forward with your initiatives!

### Making the Most of Your UW Experience
Getting involved in student organizations and clubs is one of the most rewarding ways to add to your college experience. And you don’t just have to take our word for it, many and many UW grads before you share that sentiment. At the University of Wyoming, we boast over 250 student organizations and clubs! This means there are plenty of opportunities to explore your interests and connect with like-minded individuals. Take the time to explore your options, learn more about different organizations and make the most out of your time at UW!

# Cost of Attendance
The University of Wyoming (UW) consistently ranks among the best values in the country with low and cost-effective tuition for both resident and non-resident students. Cost of Attendance (COA is not a bill but is an estimate of school-related expenses a full-time student can expect to have for an academic year, and it can help a student estimate their overall out-of-pocket costs when attending UW.

## COA includes direct expenses (billed by the university) and indirect expenses, and it considers a student's residency status, living arrangements and, in some cases, the student's major. The following components are included in in COA as required by federal law and will be used to determine financial aid.
Direct Expenses
  * Tuition
  * Fees
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if on-campus


Indirect Expenses
  * Books, Course Materials, Supplies, and Equipment
  * Transportation
  * Miscellaneous Personal Expenses
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if off-campus or at home

## UW Admissions Requirements
###  First-Year Students 
UW welcomes all first-time students to apply and considers each applicant based on academic achievement and completion of the High School Success Curriculum. Students with a cumulative, unweighted high school GPA of 3.00–4.00 (on a 4.0 scale) are assured admission, while those with a GPA of 2.50–2.99 are [admitted with support](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/admission-with-support.html).  
  

**High School Success Curriculum:**
  * 4 years English
  * 4 years Math
  * 4 years Science
  * 3 years Social Sciences
  * 4 years additional coursework


[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html)
[International First Year Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-first-year.html)
Learn more about the international first-year student admissions process. 
###  Transfer Students 
Transfer students thrive at the University of Wyoming! Transfer students who have obtained at least 12 post-high school transfer credits are eligible for UW's [transfer commitments](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html)!  
  

**Transfer Students Admissions Requirements:**
  * Cumulative 2.0 GPA (on an unweighted 4.0 scale)
  * 12 transferable credit hours
  * *If less than 12 transferable credit hours, a high school transcript is required and ACT or SAT score is required if the student is less than 21 years of age.


[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/index.html)
[International Transfer Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-transfer.html)
Learn more about the international transfer student admissions process. 
###  Graduate Students 
Prospective graduate students are encouraged to consult with their respective[academic departments](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)regarding the admission process before making a formal UW application as graduate requirements can differ by program.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)
[International Graduate Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html)
Learn more about the international graduate student admissions process. 
## UW Admissions FAQs
We want applying to UW to be simple and stress-free. This is an exciting step and it doesn’t have to be complicated! Below are some frequently asked questions to help guide you as you begin your UW admissions process.
What materials should I have to apply? 
The most important item to have on hand is your official high school transcripts. [Transcripts will be sent to UW with your application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html#steps). Beyond that, you’ll want any ACT or SAT scores and documentation of any previous college credits, if applicable.
Is an ACT or SAT score required? 
Currently, an ACT or SAT score is not part of the admissions requirements for the University of Wyoming. However, these scores can help you to earn more [financial assistance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html).
Does applying to UW cost money? 
Yes, there is a non-refundable $40 application fee that is processed when you submit your application.
Who can I contact for further help? 
Us! Contacting the friendly and helpful UW admissions team is quite simple. You can quickly chat with us via [UW Answers](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html#answers). You can also call us at (307) 766-5160 or email us at admissions@uwyo.edu.
### Applying takes less than 10 minutes!
Applying to the University of Wyoming is easy and straightforward. Our simple, user-friendly online application, ensures the process only takes a few steps and just about 10 minutes. Of course, if you do run into any questions [UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html) is here to help you every step of the way. Whether you're a first-year, transfer or returning student, UW makes it easy to take the first step toward your future. Apply today and get started!
[Start Your Application!](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Register)
## Additional Student Categories
Select Your Student Type
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students  Veteran Students  Returning Students  Non-Degree Seeking Students  UW Casper Students  Online Students  High School Guest Students 
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students 
If you have already received a bachelor’s degree from the University of Wyoming and are interested in pursuing a second, your path to UW admissions looks a bit different. Our goal is to streamline this process, so you can quickly return to your academic goals. Our admissions team is here to help each step of the way.
[Second Bachelor’s Degree Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/second-bachelors.html)
UW is proud to welcome and support our military and veteran students! Our admissions team is here to help you navigate the application process and connect with the resources you need. There are several student groups and programs on campus to help military and veteran students succeed both academically and personally!
[Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)
Welcome back to UW! Whether you have taken a quick academic break, or have stepped away for a longer period of time, we are here to help ensure a smooth re-enrollment to the University of Wyoming. There are different steps that need to be taken depending on your specific circumstances, and our team is here to provide all the assistance you need.
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
The University of Wyoming offers a non-degree admission status for students who wish to take courses without pursuing a degree. This flexible option allows you to explore interests and learn more about your passions. Applying for this path looks a little different, but is still straightforward and you have access to our admissions team for any guidance you may need.
[Non-Degree Seeking Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)
The University of Wyoming Casper is a unique partnership between UW and Casper College. Students from UW Casper that wish to attend the University of Wyoming in Laramie can work with admissions teams at both locations to help ensure a seamless transition.
[Students from UW Casper](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwcasper/index.html)
UW Online Education brings the University of Wyoming’s academic programs to learners across Wyoming and beyond through innovative distance learning. We offer flexible learning opportunities to allow for more students of all backgrounds and locations to access UW world-class education! Applying to be an online UW student is quick and easy.
[Online Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/index.html)
UW offers the unique opportunity for current juniors and seniors to take classes and earn credits while still in high school. Eligible students can apply to UW as dual-enrollment students and get a jumpstart on pursuing their academic goals!
[High School Guest Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students

## Apply to UW in 3 Steps
### Step 1
Fill out UW’s online application or the Common Application to get the admissions process started. The application can be completed in just a few minutes.
[Online Application](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Register)
### Step 2
Submit additional materials to UW Admissions, including official high school transcripts. You may also submit standardized test scores, AP scores, or CLEP scores, if applicable.
[Submit Your Materials](https://www.uwyo.edu/registrar/undergraduate-students/credit.html)
### Step 3
Once you have applied and submitted all your necessary materials, you can check the status of your UW application.
[Check Application Status](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Login)
### Scholarships and Financial Aid Available
The University of Wyoming is committed to enhancing the lives of our students and strengthening our communities by making higher education accessible. This commitment begins with an easy and straightforward application process, ensuring that all students can take the first step toward their academic journey without unnecessary barriers. Beyond admissions, UW provides unparalleled access to a wide range of scholarships and financial aid opportunities, designed to support students from all backgrounds. Whether you’re pursuing an undergraduate degree or advanced studies, we are dedicated to helping you achieve your educational goals with financial support and guidance every step of the way.
[Explore Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
## Cost of Attendance
The University of Wyoming is proud to consistently rank as one of the most cost-effective universities in the nation. for both resident and non-resident students. With competitive tuition rates and generous financial aid opportunities, UW offers affordable, high-quality education. You can easily estimate your [cost of attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html) using our online tools, helping you plan and prepare for your college journey.
[Tour UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
Visiting and taking a tour of our campus is a great way to get a taste of the UW experience! Can’t visit in-person? You can take a [virtual tour](https://www.youvisit.com/tour/uwyo/139452?pl=v&m_prompt=1) from wherever you are.
[Scholarship Opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
UW offers financial aid and scholarship opportunities in order to make higher education more accessible. Be sure to take a close look at the opportunities that are available to you!
[Check Application Status](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Login)
Use our easy login portal to complete your application or check the status of an application that has already been submitted.
[Find an Admissions Rep](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html)
UW admissions representatives can help guide you through the application, share insights on life at UW and answer all your questions one-on-one.
Get in Touch with UW Admissions
Applying is a big step, but you’re not alone. Our knowledgeable UW staff is here to answer any questions you may have!
[Contact us!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
## Next Steps
[Explore Over 200 Majors](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
Take some time to look over all the areas of education you can dive into at the University of Wyoming.
[Check Out Campus Life](https://www.uwyo.edu/fye/campus-life.html)
There’s always something happening on campus at UW! Take a look at upcoming events.
[UW Dining & Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html)
Explore UW’s on-campus dining and residence halls to see what’s the best fit for you!

# Computer Engineering
## Bachelor of Science (B.S.)
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
## Earn a Computer Engineering Degree at UW
Computer engineers are essential to the rapidly advancing technological world around us. UW is here to help you become one! With specialty research facilities, opportunities to design your own machines and work with notable faculty — UW ensures graduates leave with marketable skills and experience.
[ Request Info ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/request-information/index.html)
This program is currently offered in   
the following locations: 
Laramie Campus
## About the Computer Engineering Major
###  Program Overview 
If advanced technologies, robotics and computing interest you, consider a computer engineering degree. UW’s computer engineering program combines the latest teachings in electrical engineering and computer science to prepare students for careers working with cutting-edge technologies. Students gain experience in robotics, autonomous systems, computer vision, machine learning and more!
**_UW’s computer engineering program is accredited by[ABET](https://www.abet.org/ "Learn more about ABET"), an organization that validates engineering, technology and applied science programs worldwide for their quality._**
###  Noteworthy Faculty 
Our [computer engineering faculty](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/faculty-staff/index.html "Learn more about computer engineering faculty") are highly skilled and excited to help you further your education. Here are a few noteworthy faculty members and their specialties:
  * [Suresh Muknahallipatna](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/faculty-staff/faculty/Suresh-Muknahallipatna/index.html "Learn more about Suresh Muknahallipatna") (quantum information science and engineering, high-performance computing, Internet of Things, machine learning)
  * [Chao Jiang](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/faculty-staff/faculty/chao-jiang/index.html "Learn more about Chao Jiang") (robotics, Internet of Things, reinforcement learning)
  * [John McInroy](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/faculty-staff/faculty/John-McInroy/index.html "Learn more about John McInroy") (computer vision, robotics)
  * Shivanand Sheshappanvar (computer vision)
  * [Zejian Zhou](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/faculty-staff/faculty/zejian-zhou/index.html "Learn more about Zejian Zhou") (robotics, swarms, machine learning)


###  Courses & Curriculum 
## Computer Engineering, B.S.
Provides knowledge to be able to design, analyze, and develop computer systems including processors, memory, embedded devices, and data communication systems for a wide range of application domains.
### Accreditation
**The Computer Engineering Program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET,[https://www.abet.org](https://www.abet.org/), under the General Criteria and the Computer and Similarly Named Engineering Program Criteria.**
### Degree Requirements
The degree requires **128** credits, **42** of which must be upper-division. 
### University Studies Program
This degree requires that [The University Studies Program 2015](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/content.php?catoid=16&navoid=1470) requirements are met before graduation. Some of the courses required for this major fulfill USP requirements, but not all. Students should check their degree evaluations and consult with their assigned academic advisor to discuss their specific course plan.
  * [C 1 - Communication 1 (U5C1) (COM1) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173259)
  * [C 2 - Communication 2 (U5C2) (COM2) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173260)
  * [C 3 - Communication 3 (U5C3) (COM3) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173261)

### General Elective

### Additional Requirements/Program Information
1 PHYS 1210: no credit can be earned in [PHYS 1210](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=171690) if taken after [ES 2120](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172863). While [PHYS 1220](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=171691) is not a prerequisite for [ES 2210](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172864), it is recommended that [PHYS 1220](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=171691) should be taken before or concurrently with [ES 2210](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172864).
2 One course from the ECE Math/Science Elective List. ABET requires a minimum of 30 hours of Math/Science courses.
3See approved ES/EE/BE ≥ 2000 elective list. [ES 2280](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173180) is recommended as one of the electives.
4 To meet the COM3 requirement with [EE 4820](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172815) and [EE 4830](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172816) the COM2 course must be taken before [EE 4820](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172815). Also, [EE 4820](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172815) and [EE 4830](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172816) must be taken in sequence. COM 2 grade of C or better is required.
5 Network Congestion Control can also be taken to fulfill the CPEN network course requirement.
  * Online courses taken outside of the Wyoming system will not be considered for preapproved transfer.
  * Students must have a minimum cumulative GPA 2.000 in all Engineering courses for graduation.
  * A grade of C or better is required for all prerequisite courses. 
    * A grade of D is allowed for corequisite courses (prerequisite courses that can be taken concurrently)
  * Students must also achieve a grade of C or better in all required mathematics courses.
  * Students must complete a minimum of 42 hours of upper division coursework, 30 of which must be from the University of Wyoming.
  * All undergraduate engineering students are required to take the Fundamentals of Engineering Exam with a good faith effort within one year prior to their expected graduation for program assessment purposes.


### Computer Engineering Program Educational Objectives
Graduates of the University of Wyoming Computer Engineering Program will:
  * Be able to successfully practice the profession of Computer Engineering.
  * Be prepared and motivated to accept challenging assignments and responsibilities and be productive members of society.
  * Demonstrate successful career growth (e.g., professional registration, graduate school, promotion and advancement, patents, publications).


### Computer Engineering - Student Learning Outcomes
All Computer Engineering graduates shall demonstrate:
  1. an ability to identify, formulate, and solve complex engineering problems by applying principles of engineering, science, and mathematics
  2. an ability to apply engineering design to produce solutions that meet specified needs with consideration of public health, safety, and welfare, as well as global, cultural, social, environmental, and economic factors
  3. an ability to communicate effectively with a range of audiences
  4. an ability to recognize ethical and professional responsibilities in engineering situations and make informed judgments, which must consider the impact of engineering solutions in global, economic, environmental, and societal contexts
  5. an ability to function effectively on a team whose members together provide leadership, create a collaborative and inclusive environment, establish goals, plan tasks, and meet objectives
  6. an ability to develop and conduct appropriate experimentation, analyze and interpret data, and use engineering judgment to draw conclusions
  7. an ability to acquire and apply new knowledge as needed, using appropriate learning strategies.


## Computer Engineering Minor
Enhance your major with essential skills in designing, analyzing and developing computer systems for a variety of applications by adding a minor in computer engineering!
[Learn More](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17369&returnto=1485 "Learn more about the Computer Engineering Minor")
## Computer Engineering Program Highlights
Select a Highlight
Job Marketability  Access to Research Facilities  Hands-On Experience 
Job Marketability 
Computer engineers are key to today's and tomorrow’s technological advances. That’s why UW equips students with marketable skills and hands-on experience before graduation. Computer engineering majors are encouraged to complete projects, work with notable faculty and spend time in research labs during their education.
At UW, we believe hands-on experience is the best way to learn. That’s why computer engineering students are given access to these specialty facilities to develop their skills.
  * Computer Networks and Networking Lab
  * Computer Vision Lab
  * Distributed Computing Lab
  * Multi-agent systems, AI security and robotics lab


Computer engineering students are given the opportunity to put their education to the test throughout their education. How? Labs where students use the latest technologies and make their own devices. Part-time research opportunities. And a year-long senior design course where students work with their peers to address an engineering or societal issue.
Job Marketability 
### Select a Highlight
Job Marketability  Access to Research Facilities  Hands-On Experience 
## What Can You Do With a Computer Engineering Bachelor’s Degree?
With a bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, you’ll be equipped to design, build and optimize both hardware and software systems—opening the door to a wide range of high-tech careers. Graduates often work in industries like electronics, aerospace, robotics, cybersecurity, telecommunications and software development.
What computer engineering careers are available? 
Common computer engineering jobs include:
  * Hardware engineer
  * Embedded systems developer
  * Software engineer
  * Firmware developer
  * Systems architect
  * Network engineer
  * Robotics engineer
  * Cybersecurity analyst
  * AI or machine learning engineer
  * IoT (Internet of Things) developer  
  



This degree also provides a strong foundation for graduate study in computer engineering, electrical engineering or computer science.
What jobs do UW's computer engineering alumni have? 
Here are some of the computer engineering job titles that graduates have held:
  * Software engineer
  * UX design engineer
  * Software development manager
  * Web developer
  * Professor of computer engineering


Where do alumni work? 
Notable computer engineering alumni employers:
  * OpenAI
  * Nvidia
  * National Center for Atmospheric Research
  * MIT Lincoln Labs
  * Uplink Robotics
  * Simbex


Where do UW alumni go for graduate school? 
Many computer engineering students go on to receive additional education and/or teach. Here are a few of the places recent graduates were accepted:
  * University of Notre Dame
  * Dartmouth University
  * Indiana University


### Tour computer engineering facilities
Take a look around UW's electrical and computer engineering building. You'll find teaching spaces, cutting-edge labs and innovative equipment that you'll use in your coursework and research. As you'll see, our spaces were designed to enable interactive classes and advanced research. We can't wait to welcome you inside!
Did you know The Weather Channel uses GPU-algorithms developed by UW students to be able to provide minute-by-minute updates to local weather?

### Related Programs
Interested in a B.S. in computer engineering? These programs may also be of interest to you:
  * [B.S. in Computer Science](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-science-bachelors.html "More information about the B.S. in Computer Science")

# Want to Learn More About UW?
## Get the Details You Need to Make an Informed Decision
By requesting more information, you'll gain access to essential details about admissions, academic programs, student life and campus resources. Whether you're a first-year, transfer, international, or graduate student, we have tailored materials to help you explore your options. You can also download our viewbooks for an in-depth look at what UW has to offer. Fill out the request form to receive personalized information and take the next step toward becoming a Cowboy!

### Get the Facts
Explore our downloadable viewbook brochures to get an in-depth look at life at the University of Wyoming. We’ve created brochures tailored to first-year, transfer, international and graduate students. These brochures provide essential facts, academic insights, student life details and a breakdown of the programs and resources available to help you succeed. Whether you’re just starting your college journey or continuing your education, these resources are designed to give you all the information you need to make an informed decision.
## Request Your Personalized UW Info
### Undergraduate Students
Request information about becoming a first-year or transfer student at UW, including admissions, academic programs and campus life. Fill out the form to receive detailed information.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Undergraduate&UW=UG)
### Graduate Students
Fill out the form to request information about UW’s graduate programs, application processes and resources available to support your academic journey.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Graduate&UW=Grad)
### Online & Continuing Education
Complete the form to learn more about UW’s online programs and continuing education options tailored to working professionals.
[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=UWOnline&uw=online)
### Explore Over 200 Degree Programs
With more than 200 undergraduate and graduate programs, UW offers a diverse range of academic opportunities. Students benefit from close faculty interaction, hands-on learning and research experiences both in state-of-the-art facilities and the vast Wyoming landscape. Many programs also provide options for study abroad and undergraduate research, helping you build real-world skills for your future. Discover the right path for you by exploring our degree and program finder.
[Explore Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
## Experience UW For yourself
Visiting campus is the best way to see if UW is the right fit for you! Whether you explore in person or virtually, we offer multiple ways to connect. Take a guided campus tour, set up a one-on-one meeting with an admissions representative, or explore campus through our virtual tour. Located in the heart of the Mountain West, UW offers a welcoming environment and breathtaking surroundings. Discover what makes our university special and start planning your visit today!
[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)

## Begin Your Journey With Us
###  Degrees & Programs 
At the University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences, students are taught by a dedicated community of academic leaders who believe that interdisciplinary, diverse and inclusive education and research are all critical to our success in overcoming the challenges facing today’s world. The need for individuals within the STEM industries has never been greater and the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences is the right place at the right time for you to make a difference.
[Find Your Degree](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
[ABET Accreditation ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/dean/Accreditation/index.html)   

Learn how accreditation ensures quality and career readiness.
###  Admissions & Scholarships 
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences offers 275+ scholarships yearly. Undergrads are admitted on a rolling basis; grad requirements vary by program. With low tuition and 55% graduating debt-free, UW is a top-value choice for an engineering or physical sciences degree.
[Request Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/request-information.html)
Get Started at UW
[UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/index.html)[Engineering Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/scholarships/index.html)[Financial Aid](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)[Cost of Attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)[Graduate Requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)[Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)
[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)   

Explore all that UW has to offer!
###  Who We Are 
At the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences, we’re driven by innovation, discovery and a commitment to shaping future leaders in science and engineering. Under the leadership of Carrell Family Dean, the Dean’s Office is dedicated to supporting students, faculty and staff across the University of Wyoming. 
[Our Mission](https://wwwnew.uwyo.edu/ceps/dean/Mission-Statement.html)
Learn More
[Dean's Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/dean/index.html)[Faculty & Staff Directory](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/directory.html)
[Tier-1 Initiative ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/)

Interested in an internship or job? Start your search with our Career Services team! 
[Study & Tutoring Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/current-students/tutoring.html)
Get the help you need to succeed in even the toughest of classes. 
[Academic Advising](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/index.html)
Set up a time with your academic advisor to stay on track with your degree. 
### Where Student Success Matters
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences is dedicated to helping you succeed academically and professionally. Our personalized advising ensures you’re on track to meet your goals. Career services assist with job searches, internships, resume reviews and networking, connecting you to opportunities within the STEM field.
The College also offers tutoring services to support you in challenging courses. With these resources, we aim to provide comprehensive support for your academic and professional growth. Explore more at the Susan McCormack Center for Student Success.
[Student SUCCESS CENTER](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/index.html)

## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences Departments
Browse by Department
Atmospheric Science  Chemical and Biomedical Engineering  Chemistry  Civil and Architectural Engineering & Construction Management  Electrical Engineering and Computer Science  Energy and Petroleum Engineering  Geology and Geophysics  Mathematics and Statistics  Mechanical and Energy Systems Engineering  Physics and Astronomy  School of Computing 
Atmospheric Science 
Explore the science behind weather, climate and atmospheric phenomena. Students and researchers in this department use cutting-edge tools to study and model atmospheric systems that impact our life on Earth.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/atsc/index.html)
This department prepares students to innovate in chemical processes, biotechnology and biomedical devices. With strong industry ties and research opportunities, its where chemistry meets real-world problem-solving.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/index.html)
From materials and energy to health and the environment, the Department of Chemistry is a hub for hands-on discovery. Students gain practical lab experience while working alongside expert faculty. 
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemistry/index.html)
Build your future with programs in civil engineering, architectural systems and construction management. This department focuses on infrastructure sustainability and project leadership.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/index.html)
Design the future with skills in circuits, AI, cybersecurity, and software development. Students in this department tackle modern challenges through theory, lab work and innovation.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/index.html)
Focused on efficient, sustainable resource extraction and energy systems, this department blends geoscience, engineering and technology to address global energy needs.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/petroleum/index.html)
Study Earth from core to crust with faculty-led research in natural resources, tectonics, seismology and more. Fieldwork and lab experience prepare students for geoscience careers.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/geolgeophys/index.html)
Solve real-world problems through advanced mathematics and data analysis. Students learn critical thinking, modeling and computational skills essential in research and industry.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/index.html)
From robotics to renewable energy, this department equips students to design, test and innovate mechanical and energy systems for today’s and tomorrow’s challenges.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/mechanical/index.html)
Dive into the fundamental laws of nature and the mysteries of the universe. Students explore everything from quantum mechanics to galaxies through hands-on experiments and research.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/index.html)
This interdisciplinary hub fosters innovation in computing, data science and digital systems. Students gain in-demand skills through applied projects and cross-campus collaboration.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/soc/index.html)
Atmospheric Science

### World Class Facilities
The Engineering Education and Research Building at the University of Wyoming is a state-of-the-art facility designed to foster innovation, collaboration and hands-on learning. As part of the Tier-1 Engineering Initiative, it supports workforce development and research tied to Wyoming’s economic future. Inside, you’ll find flexible labs, project spaces, active-learning classrooms, a drilling simulator and more—built for next-level engineering education.
[Explore Facilities ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/facilities.html)

# University of Wyoming Privacy Notice
The University of Wyoming (UW) understands that privacy is important to you. UW values your privacy and is committed to maintaining your trust. Therefore, we provide this Privacy Notice explaining how your information may be processed, managed and protected by us. This Privacy Notice describes how UW may collect, use, and share information you directly and indirectly provide when using UW websites.
This Policy Notice does not cover the practices of our third-party partners (e.g., vendors), nor does it apply to Personally Identifiable Information (PII) that we collect from or about our employees, vendors, consultants, or contractors. Additionally, some UW websites may deviate from this notice. In these cases, we encourage you to read page-specific notices to ensure you understand the applicable privacy policies and practices.
By using UW websites, you agree to the Terms and Conditions of this Privacy Notice and to our processing of personal information for the purposes stated below. If you do not agree to the Terms and Conditions of the Privacy Statements, please do not use the site or the mobile applications.  
  

**International Visitors  
** UW is located in the United States (State of Wyoming). By providing information to UW, you are transferring your personal data to the United States. If you are providing personal information and are not a resident of the United States, your country’s laws governing data collection and use may differ from those in the United States. The United States has not sought nor received a finding of “adequacy” from the European Union under Article 45 of the GDPR, and UW relies on derogations for specific situations as set forth in Article 49 of the GDPR.  
  

**What Information We Collect  
** UW collects personal information about you when you voluntarily provide it. Other services may require additional information through an account in order to access certain features; an account, created for you to authenticate into a system or service, includes personal information identifying you for the sake of the service.
"Personal information" is any information that can be used to identify you or that may be linked to you. This information is commonly limited to the information found in a public directory, such as first name, last name, postal address, email address, and phone number.  
  

**Websites  
** When you visit University of Wyoming websites, we collect and use information provided to us by your browser, IP, site requests, etc. to customize your experience. Other examples of how we may use this data include (1) to deliver the content of our websites correctly, (2) optimize user experience, (3) receive and provide marketing feedback, and (4) deter and prevent abuse of our sites.
For you knowledge, the data we collect may include the following information provided by your browser, ISP, and operating system. 
  * The public Internet Protocol (IP) address of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the website from which a device reaches a UW website (called a referrer), typically by following a link.
  * The webpages requested from the UW websites.
  * The Date and Time of Access.
  * The Operating System of the device through which you access UW websites.
  * The Browser Type and Version, the Monitor Screen Size and Color Depth and other plugin and program information as sent by your browser.
  * Similar data and information that may be used in the event of attacks on our information technology (IT) systems


**  
Web Analytics  
** UW websites use analytical tools provided by other companies, such as Google Analytics, a service provided by Google, Inc. We use this data to determine the number of people using our site, their journey through the websites, as well as how they find and use our web pages. These companies may separately record data such as your geographical location, device type, internet browser, operating system, your IP address, and associated information. To opt out of these services, you will need to modify your settings with them directly. To opt out of the Google Analytics advertising features outlined above, [follow Google's opt out instructions](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout).
**  
Cookies and Tracking  
** UW may also collect certain information passively, such as collecting online, non-identifying information through the use of cookies technology and/or Internet Protocol (“IP”) address tracking. Through the use of cookies, UW provides more user-friendly services. Non-personal identification information might include the browser used by you, the type of computer, the operating systems, the Internet service providers, and other similar information. The UW system also automatically gathers information about the areas you visit on the websites and about the links you may select from within the site to other sites. Most browsers are set to accept cookies. You can set yours to refuse cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent; however, if you disable cookies, the full functionality of some our sites may not be available to you.
Please note that we do not currently respond to web browser “do not track” signals or other mechanisms that may allow you to opt out of the collection of information across networks of websites and online services as there is no standard for how online services should respond to such signals. As standards develop, we may develop policies for responding to do-not-track signals that we will describe in this Privacy Notice.
**  
Other Sources  
** UW may receive information about you from other sources, including third parties that help us update, expand, and analyze our records, identify new customers, or prevent or detect fraud. UW may also receive information about you from social media platforms, including but not limited to, when you access our social media content or interact with us on these platforms. The information we may receive is governed by the privacy settings, policies, and/or procedures of the applicable social media platform; therefore, we encourage you to review them.
**  
Children  
** UW does not believe our websites are appealing to children, nor are they directed to children under 13. UW does not knowingly collect personally identifiable data from persons under the age of 13, and strives to comply with the provisions of COPPA (The Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act). If you are a parent of a child under 13, and you believe that your child has provided us with information about him or herself, please contact us our General Counsel office by phone or email.
**  
How We Use Collected Information  
** UW may use the information we collect:
  * To respond to your inquiries
  * To provide services or materials you request
  * To operate and understand how services are utilized
  * To maintain our contact list
  * To provide business services for which the information is intended
  * To assess the effectiveness of our events, campaigns, and publications
  * For information processing that is reasonably appropriate or necessary within our legal obligations


As a responsible organization, we do not use automatic decision-making or profiling. Moreover, your personal information will not be used in ways unrelated to the ones described without a clear notice and without providing an opportunity to opt-out or otherwise prohibit unrelated uses.
**  
How We Share Collected Information  
** UW may share collected information with third parties and other University parties for legitimate business purposes without your consent, including but not limited to, the following reasons or in the following circumstances:
  * As necessary to complete a transaction for you.
  * To vendors or third-parties who deliver or provide goods and services or otherwise act on behalf of or at the direction of UW, such as exam testing agencies and partners, product-fulfillment companies, third-party event hosts, other third parties who may provide services on websites that are accessible from links on one of our sites, and credit card companies processing payment;
  * To UW administration;
  * To investigate potentially fraudulent or questionable activities;
  * To cooperate with law enforcement or in response to a government or regulatory request, including if specifically requested or required, as otherwise permitted by law, and for other valid UW business purposes.
  * Required by law or by an order of a court, regulatory bodies, or governmental authority.
  * As we deem necessary to protect the rights, safety, or property of UW.


  
UW also may use your profile information on an aggregate basis – without personal identifiers – to provide the University administration and third parties with information, such as developing new features and content for the sites, and providing sponsors and others with aggregate information about our users and the usage patterns of the sites.
**  
How We Protect Collected Information  
** UW uses reasonable measures to safeguard personal information collected on its sites depending on its sensitivity. In order to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure, we have suitable physical, technical, and managerial controls and procedures to safeguard the information we collect online. Our measures follow applicable laws regarding the safeguarding of information under our control. However, no information system can be 100 percent secure.
UW is not responsible for the security of information you transmit to us over networks that we do not control, including the Internet, email systems, and wireless networks. Moreover, you are responsible for protecting your username and password and for selecting strong passwords.
We retain the information we collect online no longer than as reasonably necessary to fulfill the purposes for which we collect the information and to comply with our legal obligations.
**  
How to Contact UW  
** Subject to local law, you may have certain rights regarding information that we have collected and that is related to you. We encourage you to contact us to update or correct your information if it changes or if you believe that any information that we have collected about you is inaccurate.
To help us keep your personal information up-to-date or if you no longer wish to receive communications from us, please login to the UW website that collected your data and update your information. For general inquiries, please contact our UW’s Privacy Office below for further information.
Robert Aylward  
Vice President  
Office of the CIO  
(307) 766-4860  
raylward@uwyo.edu
**  
Privacy Notice Changes  
** UW may update this Privacy Notice as the need arises, so we encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Notice. If we make any material changes in the way we collect, use, and/or share the personal information that you have provided, we will post notice of the changes in a clear and conspicuous manner on the UW websites.
The Privacy Notice is effective as of August 20th, 2020.  
  

## Equal Opportunity Clause
Persons seeking admission, employment or access to programs of the University of Wyoming shall be considered without regard to race, sex, gender, color, religion, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, political belief or other status protected by state and federal statutes or University Regulations.
## Copyright Information
The contents of this Web site are copyright protected. Any commercial use requires permission from the University of Wyoming.

# Cost of Attendance
The University of Wyoming (UW) consistently ranks among the best values in the country with low and cost-effective tuition for both resident and non-resident students. Cost of Attendance (COA is not a bill but is an estimate of school-related expenses a full-time student can expect to have for an academic year, and it can help a student estimate their overall out-of-pocket costs when attending UW.

## COA includes direct expenses (billed by the university) and indirect expenses, and it considers a student's residency status, living arrangements and, in some cases, the student's major. The following components are included in in COA as required by federal law and will be used to determine financial aid.
Direct Expenses
  * Tuition
  * Fees
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if on-campus


Indirect Expenses
  * Books, Course Materials, Supplies, and Equipment
  * Transportation
  * Miscellaneous Personal Expenses
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if off-campus or at home

# Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Electrical Engineering
Electrical engineers design control and communication systems, sensors, displays, machine learning , robots, instruments, speech recognition, computer vision, electronics, motors, power systems, the internet of things—the list goes on and on.
Computer Engineering
Computer engineering is a blend of computer science and electrical engineering. A computer engineering degree consists of both hardware and software courses.
Computer Science
Traditional areas of computer science, such as graphics, software engineering, networks, databases, multimedia, and artificial intelligence, remain strong, with job growth being driven by the fundamental impact of computer science in nearly every industry.
### About Our Department
The Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) Department is committed to excellence in teaching, research, and service. Distinguished faculty conduct world-class research and their instruction is recognized via numerous teaching awards. Rigorous instruction, small class sizes, and extremely competitive tuition guarantee an accessible, challenging, and rewarding experience in EECS.
EECS offers undergraduate degrees in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, and Computer Science. These programs include concentrations in big data, business applications, bio-engineering, and a K-12 endorsement and cybersecurity certificate. QuickStart programs allow top students to earn a MS and BS in a total of five years.
EECS offers MS and PhD programs in Electrical Engineering and in Computer Science. Areas of expertise in EE include: Bio-engineering, Controls, Electrical Energy Systems, Internet of Things, Robotics, Signal Processing and Computer Networks. Areas of expertise in CS include artificial intelligence, computational complexity, cybersecurity, formal methods and theorem proving, Human-centered computing and interactions, 3D User interfaces and graphics. 
_**At the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, we are proud to be a part of this college and University while helping mold the next generation of computer and electrical engineers and scientists.**_

# Computer Science
## Bachelor of Science (B.S.)
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
## Earn a Computer Science Degree at UW
You can get a computer science degree almost anywhere. So why not learn to sling code in the west? Where you can take classes on the frontiers of technology, and where you can get your hands on super computers and virtual reality systems and learn from faculty conducting ground-breaking research?
[ Request Info ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/request-information/index.html)
This program is currently offered in   
the following locations: 
Laramie Campus
## What is Computer Science?
###  Program Overview 
Computer science takes you behind the screens into the languages, ideas and processes that are driving cars, robots, websites, digital crime prevention, shopping, medical research, indeed, almost anything you can name.  
  
Through the study of computational theory and applied computer programming, you will develop the skills to solve endless problems. From making websites faster, cooler and more responsive to developing software for medical researchers or ranchers, you will have the chance to not only improve people’s work lives but also to contribute to life-changing innovations (hello, robotic cowboys).  
  
Start writing software to solve real-world problems in class and keep building your development toolkit through internships and research. Then pick up the torch of progress and venture onwards.
[Computer Science Brochure](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/_files/docs/compscience-brochure.pdf "Link to the Computer Science Brochure")   

Learn more about our program and all it has to offer!
###  Concentrations & Certificates 
A bachelor of science in computer science allows you to match your degree to your individual interests and pick between two concentrations:
  * Big Data
  * Computers & Business


  
On top of your computer science degree, you can also earn an undergraduate certificate in one of the following programs:
  * [Cadastral Surveying Certificate](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/land-surveying-certificate.html "Learn more about the Cadastral Surveying Certificate")
  * [Cybersecurity Certificate](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/cybersecurity-certificate.html "Learn more about the Cybersecurity Certificate")


###  Courses & Curriculum 
## Computer Science, B.S.
A state-of-the-art curriculum that provides a solid foundation in programming, algorithm design and analysis, cybersecurity, databases, and computer systems. Elective topics include: AI, ML, AR/VR, and Mobile apps. 
### Accreditation
**The Computer Science Program is accredited by the Computing****Accreditation Commission of ABET,[https://www.abet.org](https://www.abet.org/), under the General Criteria and the Computer Science and Similarly Named Program Criteria.**
### Degree Requirements
The degree requires **120** credits, **42** of which must be upper-division. 
### University Studies Program
This degree requires that [The University Studies Program 2015](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/content.php?catoid=16&navoid=1470) requirements are met before graduation. Some of the courses required for this major fulfill USP requirements, but not all. Students should check their degree evaluations and consult with their assigned academic advisor to discuss their specific course plan.
  * [C 1 - Communication 1 (U5C1) (COM1) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173259)
  * [C 2 - Communication 2 (U5C2) (COM2) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173260)
  * [C 3 - Communication 3 (U5C3) (COM3) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173261)
  * [Q - - Quantitative Reasoning (U5Q) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173262)
  * [PN - - Physical and Natural World (1) (U5PN) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173263)
  * [PN - - Physical and Natural World (2) (U5PN) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173268)
  * [H - - Human Culture (1) (U5H) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173264)
  * [H - - Human Culture (2) (U5H) ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173269)
