  * [FYS or USP Elective - - Any 3-credit hour of FYS or 3-credit hours of USP electives ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173370)


### Computer Science General Information
Computer Science majors must satisfactorily meet the requirements of the University Studies Program (USP), and they must complete a minimum of 120 credit hours, at least 42 of which must be upper division hours.
Note that some of the courses required for the Computer Science core or the concentrations will meet some of the USP requirements. Students do not have to take additional courses to meet those requirements.
All courses in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Statistics must be completed with a grade of C or better. 
### Mathematics and Science Courses
  * [MATH 2200 - Calculus I ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=170763)
  * [MATH 2205 - Calculus II ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=170764)
  * [MATH 2250 - Elementary Linear Algebra ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=170766)
  * [STAT 2050 - Fundamentals of Statistics ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=172311)
  * [COSC 2300 - Discrete Structures ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168932)
  * **OR**
  * [MATH 2300 - Discrete Structures ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=170767)
  *   * Approved Science course - 4 credits
  * Approved Science course - 4 credits
  * Approved Math/Science Elective - 4 credits
  * * * *
ABET requires a minimum of 30 Math/Science credit hours.
Math elective means any MATH course above Calculus II or STAT courses 3000 and up.
Exceptions: cannot count MATH 2350, MATH 2355, MATH 4000, STAT 4220 [Inactive] or any variable credit courses toward this requirement.
Courses meeting the Science requirement must have a lab component and be for science or engineering majors. See Department web pages for a current list of approved courses.


### Computer Science Courses
  * **Introductory Programming Course - Choose one of:**
  * [COSC 1010 - Computational Thinking and Programming ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168923)
  * [COSC 1030 - Computer Programming ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168925)
  * [COSC 2030 - Data Structures ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168930)
  * [EE 2150 - Computer Organization ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=173433)

  * [COSC 3015 - Functional Programming ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168934)
  * [COSC 3020 - Algorithm Design and Analysis ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168935)
  * [COSC 3050 - Ethics for the Computer Professional ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168936)
  * [COSC 3765 - Computer Security ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168962)
  * * * *
  * **Theory Course - Choose one of:**
  * [COSC 4100 - Foundations of Computing ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168945)
  * **OR**
  * [COSC 4200 - Computability and Complexity ](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168946)
  * **Operating Systems Course - Choose one of:**

  * **OR**

  * **Programming Language Course - Choose one of:**

### Electives
  * 9 credits of COSC Electives (3000-level or above, not used to complete any other requirement)
  * General Electives to reach 120 credits. 


A total of 3 credits of [COSC 3970](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=16&coid=168942) can be used. 
Approved EE courses may also be taken as COSC electives. See Department web pages for a current list of approved courses.
General electives include any course at or above the 1000 level, not used to complete any other requirement.
Electives should be selected to meet the 42 hour requirement for Upper Division credits.
### Computer Science Program Educational Objectives
The following are the objectives that the Computer Science program is preparing its graduates to achieve:
  * Success: Graduates will be employed in a computer science-related field or making progress toward an advanced graduate degree.
  * Growing: Graduates show continued learning and leading in computing-related professions.
  * Ethics: Graduates exhibit ethical and responsible behavior in all professional and community endeavors.


### Computer Science - Student Learning Outcomes
The program of study in Computer Science enables students to achieve, by the time of graduation:
  1. Analyze a complex computing problem and to apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions.
  2. Design, implement, and evaluate a computing-based solution to meet a given set of computing requirements in the context of the program's discipline.
  3. Communicate effectively in a variety of professional contexts.
  4. Recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles.
  5. Function effectively as a member or leader of a team engaged in activities appropriate to the program's discipline.
  6. Apply computer science theory and software development fundamentals to produce computing-based solutions.


## Computer Science Minor
Interested in computer science? Consider getting a minor in computer science and gaining more knowledge about programming, databases, computing, web applications, machine learning and AI.
[Learn More](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17361 "Learn more about the computer science minor")
## Computer Science Bachelor's Degree Program Highlights
Select a Highlight
Scholarships  Personal Attention  Experiential Learning  Accredited  Student Organizations  Internships  Housing 
Scholarships 
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences offers 300-plus merit scholarships a year.
[Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html "Learn more about our scholarships")
The computer science department boasts a 20:1 faculty-student ratio and 87 percent of classes are taught by faculty, rather than graduate students.
As a UW computer science major, you will have the chance to conduct research, attend conferences such as the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence and compete at events like the Department of Energy’s CyberForce competition.
[Competition Details](https://www.uwyo.edu/cedar/competitions/index.html "Learn more about the Department of Energy’s CyberForce competition")
UW’s computer science program is accredited by ABET, an organization that validates engineering, technology and applied science programs worldwide for their quality.
[ABET](https://www.abet.org/ "Learn more about A.B.E.T. accreditation")
As a UW computer science student, you can get involved on campus while also learning more about the vast opportunities available in technology by joining organizations such as the Association for Computing Machinery, Robotics Club, Defense Against the Dark Arts, Tau Beta Pi and the Society of Women Engineers.
[STUDENT ORGS](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/index.html "Learn more about student organizations")
UW computer science students have interned at companies such as Trihydro Corporation, Manufacturing-Works, AristaTek, EchoStar Corporation, LGS Innovations and others.
UW has designated three floors (with computer labs) for engineering students only, so you can live and study with other computer science majors.
Scholarships 
### Select a Highlight
Scholarships  Personal Attention  Experiential Learning  Accredited  Student Organizations  Internships  Housing 
## What Can You Do With a Computer Science Bachelor’s Degree?
Computer science degrees are one of the most versatile degrees you can earn. A bachelor’s degree in computer science from UW makes it possible for you to enter the creative and highly compensated world of software development, whether you’re launching your own high-tech start up or pursuing a dream gig in sports, agriculture, energy production, telecommunications and more—because the world needs more coders. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) estimates that Computer Science jobs with grow 19% by 2026.
What jobs and careers are available for computer science graduates? 
  * Technology Lead
  * Chief Information Officer
  * Operations Team Lead
  * Senior Software Engineer
  * System Administrator
  * Director of Client Solutions
  * Senior Data Scientist
  * Web Developer


Where are UW’s computer science alumni working or studying? 
  * Amazon
  * Lockheed Martin
  * American Express
  * Microsoft
  * Northrop Grumman
  * DHI Group
  * FirstBank
  * Charter Communications
  * MediaWorks
  * Major League Baseball
  * Cachematrix
  * Dish Network
  * Travelport
  * BeefChain
  * Exadel
  * Express Scripts
  * Stanford
  * Johns Hopkins University
  * University of Texas at Austin
  * MIT
  * University of Wyoming


What makes UW’s computer science program stand out in preparing students for the tech industry? 
The UW computer science department has developed strengths in cutting-edge areas such as robotics, artificial intelligence, human-computer interaction, cyber security, formal methods and computational complexity, so you will graduate with the latest and greatest skills to take with you into this creative, constantly changing field.
How do UW computer science graduates fare in this competitive job market? 
University of Wyoming computer science graduates enjoy a 90-95% job placement/graduate school attendance rate within 6 months of graduating. Computer Science also has one of the smallest pay gaps between male and female professionals according to the American Association of University Women. STEM careers have a hand at creating the very tools that shape society.
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)[Request Info](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Undergraduate&UW=UG)
### Related Programs
If you’re thinking about a bachelor’s degree in computer science, you might also be interested in these UW programs, too:
  * [B.S. in Electrical Engineering](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/electrical-engineering-bachelors.html "More information about the B.S. in Electrical Engineering")
  * [B.S. in Computer Engineering](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-engineering-bachelors.html "More information about the B.S. in Computer Engineering")
  * [M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-science-ms-phd.html "More information about the M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science")

# 500 - Internal Server Error
## The server has encountered an internal error or misconfiguration
You may have reached this page due to a URL that has recently changed on the uwyo.edu website. You can attempt to [search for the page you are looking for](https://www.uwyo.edu/search.html "UW Website Search Tool") and follow these steps below.
**If possible, please notify the UW department where the broken link was located.**
  * Determine where the broken link was located. This is typically within a UW website (such as a webpage, [WyoWeb](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/) or another UW o nline resource).
  * If the link you clicked was on a page housed within the _**www.uwyo.edu**_ website, scroll to the bottom of that original page to locate the department's contact information.
  * If you cannot find contact information for a UW department or page, please use our [A - Z directory](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/webdirectory/index.html) to find the unit you are looking for.
  * When contacting a department, be sure to include the page(s) in which the broken link was located, along with the URL of the broken link itself that will be shown inside your web browser's URL bar. This is important information so they can identify and fix the issue.

# Research and Economic Development Division
## _Wyoming Relevant, Nationally Competitive,  
Globally Preeminent_
The University of Wyoming Research and Economic Development Division (REDD) advances research, service and innovation through interdisciplinary collaboration. By supporting faculty and student research, REDD drives economic growth and positions UW as a center of research excellence and real-world impact.
[ About Us ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/index.html)[ Resources ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/index.html)
[FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/fundingupdates/index.html "FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES")
Guidance and FAQs. 
## Research & Economic Development at UW:
###  For Researchers & Faculty 
  

UW is proud to work alongside some of the nation’s most accomplished researchers and faculty. As a faculty member, graduate researcher or postdoc the Research and Economic Development Division provides you with the resources, guidance and support to secure funding and launch impactful research. 
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/researchers-and-faculty.html)
Explore

Find training opportunities:
  * [Training Calendar](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/training-calendars.html)


###  For Students 
Undergraduate and graduate students at UW can access our strong network of support to help you succeed in your research journey. The Research and Economic Development Division offers a wide range of resources, guidance and funding opportunities to help you develop your ideas, secure support and bring your research project to life.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/students.html)
Explore
  * [Research Development](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/grant-submissions/index.html)

  * [Economic Development Units](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/index.html)


###  Community & Partnerships 
UW is a key driver of workforce development and economic growth across Wyoming. Our faculty, students and partners contribute research, innovation and talent to meet real-world needs. We build strong partnerships with industry, public institutions and communities to create jobs, grow industries and support statewide prosperity.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/community.html)

### UW Named Top 5% Research University
The Research and Economic Development Division at UW proudly drives innovation, research and service, enriching student experiences and fueling statewide economic growth. Now a Carnegie R1 institution, UW ranks among the nation’s top research universities.   
  

“R1 status boosts the value of a UW degree, strengthens recruitment, supports Wyoming’s economy and deepens student engagement,” says President Ed Seidel.  
  

With $166M in annual research funding, UW faculty lead advances in energy, AI, agriculture, biomedicine and beyond. UW students and faculty are making an impact!
[UW’s R1 Status](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/uwyo-r1-info.html)

You can also find updates on agency-specific policies and archived communications to help navigate the evolving funding landscape.

## UW Admissions Requirements
###  First-Year Students 
UW welcomes all first-time students to apply and considers each applicant based on academic achievement and completion of the High School Success Curriculum. Students with a cumulative, unweighted high school GPA of 3.00–4.00 (on a 4.0 scale) are assured admission, while those with a GPA of 2.50–2.99 are [admitted with support](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/admission-with-support.html).  
  

**High School Success Curriculum:**
  * 4 years English
  * 4 years Math
  * 4 years Science
  * 3 years Social Sciences
  * 4 years additional coursework


[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html)
[International First Year Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-first-year.html)
Learn more about the international first-year student admissions process. 
###  Transfer Students 
Transfer students thrive at the University of Wyoming! Transfer students who have obtained at least 12 post-high school transfer credits are eligible for UW's [transfer commitments](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html)!  
  

**Transfer Students Admissions Requirements:**
  * Cumulative 2.0 GPA (on an unweighted 4.0 scale)
  * 12 transferable credit hours
  * *If less than 12 transferable credit hours, a high school transcript is required and ACT or SAT score is required if the student is less than 21 years of age.


[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/index.html)
[International Transfer Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-transfer.html)
Learn more about the international transfer student admissions process. 
###  Graduate Students 
Prospective graduate students are encouraged to consult with their respective[academic departments](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)regarding the admission process before making a formal UW application as graduate requirements can differ by program.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)
[International Graduate Student?](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html)
Learn more about the international graduate student admissions process. 
## UW Admissions FAQs
We want applying to UW to be simple and stress-free. This is an exciting step and it doesn’t have to be complicated! Below are some frequently asked questions to help guide you as you begin your UW admissions process.
What materials should I have to apply? 
The most important item to have on hand is your official high school transcripts. [Transcripts will be sent to UW with your application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html#steps). Beyond that, you’ll want any ACT or SAT scores and documentation of any previous college credits, if applicable.
Is an ACT or SAT score required? 
Currently, an ACT or SAT score is not part of the admissions requirements for the University of Wyoming. However, these scores can help you to earn more [financial assistance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html).
Does applying to UW cost money? 
Yes, there is a non-refundable $40 application fee that is processed when you submit your application.
Who can I contact for further help? 
Us! Contacting the friendly and helpful UW admissions team is quite simple. You can quickly chat with us via [UW Answers](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html#answers). You can also call us at (307) 766-5160 or email us at admissions@uwyo.edu.
### Applying takes less than 10 minutes!
Applying to the University of Wyoming is easy and straightforward. Our simple, user-friendly online application, ensures the process only takes a few steps and just about 10 minutes. Of course, if you do run into any questions [UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html) is here to help you every step of the way. Whether you're a first-year, transfer or returning student, UW makes it easy to take the first step toward your future. Apply today and get started!
[Start Your Application!](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Register)
## Additional Student Categories
Select Your Student Type
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students  Veteran Students  Returning Students  Non-Degree Seeking Students  UW Casper Students  Online Students  High School Guest Students 
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students 
If you have already received a bachelor’s degree from the University of Wyoming and are interested in pursuing a second, your path to UW admissions looks a bit different. Our goal is to streamline this process, so you can quickly return to your academic goals. Our admissions team is here to help each step of the way.
[Second Bachelor’s Degree Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/second-bachelors.html)
UW is proud to welcome and support our military and veteran students! Our admissions team is here to help you navigate the application process and connect with the resources you need. There are several student groups and programs on campus to help military and veteran students succeed both academically and personally!
[Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)
Welcome back to UW! Whether you have taken a quick academic break, or have stepped away for a longer period of time, we are here to help ensure a smooth re-enrollment to the University of Wyoming. There are different steps that need to be taken depending on your specific circumstances, and our team is here to provide all the assistance you need.
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
The University of Wyoming offers a non-degree admission status for students who wish to take courses without pursuing a degree. This flexible option allows you to explore interests and learn more about your passions. Applying for this path looks a little different, but is still straightforward and you have access to our admissions team for any guidance you may need.
[Non-Degree Seeking Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)
The University of Wyoming Casper is a unique partnership between UW and Casper College. Students from UW Casper that wish to attend the University of Wyoming in Laramie can work with admissions teams at both locations to help ensure a seamless transition.
[Students from UW Casper](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwcasper/index.html)
UW Online Education brings the University of Wyoming’s academic programs to learners across Wyoming and beyond through innovative distance learning. We offer flexible learning opportunities to allow for more students of all backgrounds and locations to access UW world-class education! Applying to be an online UW student is quick and easy.
[Online Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/index.html)
UW offers the unique opportunity for current juniors and seniors to take classes and earn credits while still in high school. Eligible students can apply to UW as dual-enrollment students and get a jumpstart on pursuing their academic goals!
[High School Guest Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students 
### Select Your Student Type
Second Bachelor’s Degree Students  Veteran Students  Returning Students  Non-Degree Seeking Students  UW Casper Students  Online Students  High School Guest Students 
## Apply to UW in 3 Steps
### Step 1
Fill out UW’s online application or the Common Application to get the admissions process started. The application can be completed in just a few minutes.
[Online Application](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Register)
### Step 2
Submit additional materials to UW Admissions, including official high school transcripts. You may also submit standardized test scores, AP scores, or CLEP scores, if applicable.
[Submit Your Materials](https://www.uwyo.edu/registrar/undergraduate-students/credit.html)
### Step 3
Once you have applied and submitted all your necessary materials, you can check the status of your UW application.
[Check Application Status](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Login)
### Scholarships and Financial Aid Available
The University of Wyoming is committed to enhancing the lives of our students and strengthening our communities by making higher education accessible. This commitment begins with an easy and straightforward application process, ensuring that all students can take the first step toward their academic journey without unnecessary barriers. Beyond admissions, UW provides unparalleled access to a wide range of scholarships and financial aid opportunities, designed to support students from all backgrounds. Whether you’re pursuing an undergraduate degree or advanced studies, we are dedicated to helping you achieve your educational goals with financial support and guidance every step of the way.
[Explore Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
## Cost of Attendance
The University of Wyoming is proud to consistently rank as one of the most cost-effective universities in the nation. for both resident and non-resident students. With competitive tuition rates and generous financial aid opportunities, UW offers affordable, high-quality education. You can easily estimate your [cost of attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html) using our online tools, helping you plan and prepare for your college journey.
[Tour UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
Visiting and taking a tour of our campus is a great way to get a taste of the UW experience! Can’t visit in-person? You can take a [virtual tour](https://www.youvisit.com/tour/uwyo/139452?pl=v&m_prompt=1) from wherever you are.
[Scholarship Opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
UW offers financial aid and scholarship opportunities in order to make higher education more accessible. Be sure to take a close look at the opportunities that are available to you!
[Check Application Status](https://uwyo-erx.my.site.com/ERx_Forms__Portal_Login)
Use our easy login portal to complete your application or check the status of an application that has already been submitted.
[Find an Admissions Rep](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html)
UW admissions representatives can help guide you through the application, share insights on life at UW and answer all your questions one-on-one.
Get in Touch with UW Admissions
Applying is a big step, but you’re not alone. Our knowledgeable UW staff is here to answer any questions you may have!
[Contact us!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
## Next Steps
[Explore Over 200 Majors](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
Take some time to look over all the areas of education you can dive into at the University of Wyoming.
[Check Out Campus Life](https://www.uwyo.edu/fye/campus-life.html)
There’s always something happening on campus at UW! Take a look at upcoming events.
[UW Dining & Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html)
Explore UW’s on-campus dining and residence halls to see what’s the best fit for you!

## Undergraduate Students
### Resident
Eligible Wyoming resident new first-time students (non-transfer) have several opportunities for scholarship support.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/residents/index.html)
### Non-Resident
Eligible non-resident new first-time students (non-transfer) have several opportunities for scholarship support.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/non-residents/index.html)
### International
Eligible new first-time international students (non-transfer) have scholarship opportunities at the University of Wyoming.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/international/index.html)
## Cards Carousel Slider
### Transfer
Students who transfer to the University of Wyoming - whether resident, non-resident, or international transfer students - may qualify for a scholarship.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html)
### Non-Traditional
Non-traditional students who meet certain criteria may qualify for scholarship assistance through the Wyoming's Tomorrow Scholarship.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/wyomings-tomorrow-scholarship.html)
### External Scholarships
  
External scholarships are developed and funded by organizations external to UW. They’re available to the public and can potentially help students cover the costs of their education and education-related expenses. Student eligibility rules are created by the organization offering the scholarship and can depend on many factors. If you are a student who has been awarded an external scholarship or are a donor/organization that is funding an external scholarship, please review the [External Scholarships page](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/external-scholarships.html) for more information.
* * *
### Emergency Scholarship
The University of Wyoming Emergency Scholarships are one-time only awards for UW students who experience unexpected emergent circumstances. Several criteria must be met to be eligible for this type of scholarship. Students must submit the [Emergency Scholarship Request](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9Ev0eeaDAC8fa4u) to be considered.

The Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) faculty are focused on preparing students to become the next wave of elite engineers, researchers, and scientists. # Student Organizations
## Find Your UW Community
Your University of Wyoming experience extends far beyond the classroom. While, of course, our high-quality academic programs are essential, there are countless opportunities to enrich your time here. UW student organizations play a key role in helping you build lasting connections and develop valuable life skills. From networking opportunities to fostering a strong sense of community and belonging, the benefits of joining a student organization are endless. Getting involved allows you to grow both personally and professionally, elevating your overall college experience!
[Explore Student Orgs](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View our student organizations")
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil)

[Workshop Series](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/workshops.html)
## How to Get Involved
### Upcoming Events
Stay informed about upcoming CSIL and student organization events to ensure you never miss out on exciting opportunities, activities and experiences on campus!
[View Calendar](https://uwyo.presence.io/events "View our events calendar")
### Explore Cowbell
Take a look at the full list of student organizations and explore the wide variety of options available to find the one that’s the best fit for you.
[STUDENT ORGS](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View student organizations")
### Start an Organization
You may just be the perfect person to start a new student organization to fill a gap in the University of Wyoming community. Here's how to get started!
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/forming-student-orgs.html "Learn more about how to start a student organization")
### Center for Student Involvement & Leadership
The Center for Student Involvement and Leadership plays a vital role in fostering a vibrant campus community by supporting the wide range of student organizations UW is able to offer. Beyond just assisting student groups, CSIL offers numerous opportunities for students to engage in leadership development, connect with others and expand their networks. Whether you're interested in learning about leadership opportunities, accessing valuable resources or want to stay in the know about upcoming exciting campus-wide events, CSIL is your go-to resource for making the most of your time at UW.
[Check Out CSIL](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/index.html "Learn more about CSIL")
## Finding or Building Your Community
UW’s student organizations are made possible because of you. These organizations are driven by student needs and desires. Whether you are looking through all of the available options and finding your perfect match, or you decide to create a new organization to fill a need, you are a key part of this process.
Existing Student Organizations
UW boasts over 250 diverse student organizations, each offering its own unique purpose, culture and opportunities. Whether you’re looking to get involved in academics, service, recreation or anything in between, there’s a likely group waiting for you! Explore our [complete list of student organizations](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View the complete list of student organizations") to find one that excites you and aligns with your personal interests. This is your chance to connect, grow and make a lasting impact!
Creating a Student Organization
If the student organization of your dreams doesn’t already exist, you may be interested in [forming a new student org](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/forming-student-orgs.html "Learn how to form a new student organization"). Be sure to look over the [Student Organization Constitution](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/_files/student-organizations/student-orgs-constitution-template.pdf "View the Student Organization Constitution") and requirements, and consider the organization’s purpose. Feeling excited and ready to move forward? It’s time to fill out the New [Student Org Application](https://uwyo.presence.io/form/organization-registration "Link to the Student Org Application"). Once approved, you’re all set to begin planning events and moving forward with your initiatives!

### Making the Most of Your UW Experience
Getting involved in student organizations and clubs is one of the most rewarding ways to add to your college experience. And you don’t just have to take our word for it, many and many UW grads before you share that sentiment. At the University of Wyoming, we boast over 250 student organizations and clubs! This means there are plenty of opportunities to explore your interests and connect with like-minded individuals. Take the time to explore your options, learn more about different organizations and make the most out of your time at UW!
[STUDENT ORGS](https://uwyo.presence.io/ "View student organizations")
## By The Numbers…
The Center for Student Leadership & Involvement (CSIL) is the central hub for student organizations at UW. CSIL is committed to providing students with opportunities to find communities where they feel connected and supported. We are proud of the work they do and the student organizations they support.

# Research
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
**Our Mission:**
The development, application and dissemination of new knowledge (often lumped together under the term "Research") are key functions of the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences. This web page serves as a locus for finding information related to research activities in the College as well as a place to find links to College and University research policies and procedures.

### Collaborate With Colleagues
Finding the right research collaborators and partnering with counterparts can be a game-changer for your research. While working with research collaborators from different fields offers a blend of unique perspectives, it also allows access to specialized equipment, funding opportunities, and research facilities that would not otherwise be possible. Benefits of research collaboration include:
  * Comprehensive, High-Quality Research
  * Improved Chance of Publication
  * Increase in Peer Networking
  * Fostering of Cross-Discplinary Understanding


Despite the many benefits and growing collaborative research trends, finding the right partners or research collaborators can be a challenge. Visit our [Collaborate With Colleagues webpage](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/research/collaborate-with-colleagues.html) to start collaborating with your colleagues!
Distinguished Postdoctoral Fellowships for AI-Enabled Interdisciplinary Research
The University of Wyoming invites applications for the Distinguished Postdoctoral Fellows Program for conducting convergence research at the intersection of different disciplines. This year, the program will support a cohort of up to six Distinguished Postdoctoral Fellows for two-year terms. Distinguished Postdoctoral Fellows participating in the program will receive professional development opportunities, including entrepreneurship-focused workshops, and mentorship from experts in at least two disciplines. Projects involving collaboration with Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories are encouraged. Learn more about this opportunity [here](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/research-at-uw/distinguished-postdoc-fellowship-program.html).

# Department of Physics and Astronomy
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
[UW Planetarium](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/planetarium/index.html "Learn more about the UW Planetarium")
The Harry C. Vaughan Planetarium is a state-of-the art planetarium located on the University of Wyoming campus in the basement of the Physical Sciences Building. With weekly public shows, the UW Planetarium was a passion projected for the Windy Ridge Foundation owner, Harry C. Vaughan, who devoted his time and resources to build the physics and astronomy community at UW.
[Observatories](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/observatories/index.html "Learn more about UW's observatories")
The University of Wyoming boasts four different observatories: the Apache Point Observatory, Wyoming Infrared Observatory, Red Buttes Observatory and Star Observatory. Located conveniently near or in Laramie, these observatories act as an experiential learning vessel for physics and astronomy students.
[WY NASA Space Grant](https://wyomingspacegrant.org/ "Learn more about the WY NASA Space Grant")
The Wyoming NASA Space Grant Consortium supports NASA’s mission by funding education and research initiatives across Wyoming, serving as a vital connection between NASA and the people of the state and the University of Wyoming.
### About Our Department
Our program offers a welcoming, personalized educational experience that broadly prepares students for challenging careers in space sciences, nanotechnology, quantitative finance, engineering, environmental sciences, optics, computer technology, energy policy, science law and many other fields. Our research efforts are broadly focused on condensed matter physics, materials science and astronomy. Our physics faculty and students carry out interdisciplinary, collaborative and hands-on research in multiple cutting-edge laboratories. Our astronomy faculty and students have exceptional access to observing opportunities at Apache Point Observatory, the Wyoming Infrared Observatory and Red Buttes Observatory. Our researchers also use the NCAR Wyoming supercomputer and the Mount Moran cluster for their theoretical computational work.
[WATCH Our VIDEO](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tCFCCyCI_J0 "Watch a video that overviews the Department of Physics and Astronomy")

## Physics and Astronomy Degree Programs
Select a Program
B.S. in Astronomy and Astrophysics  B.A. and B.S. in Physics  Astronomy Minor  Quantum Information Science and Engineering Minor  M.S. in Physics  Ph.D. in Physics 
B.S. in Astronomy and Astrophysics 
Fascinated by black holes, galaxies and the origins of the universe? Explore the cosmos with our astronomy and astrophysics bachelor’s degree ([4-year courseplan PDF](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/curriculum.html#physics-astronomy-curricula)) and prepare for careers in research, space science or advanced study.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/astronomy-and-astrophysics-bs.html "Learn more about the B.S. in Astronomy and Astrophysics")
Whether you're headed toward grad school, research or a tech-driven career, our physics bachelors degrees ([4-year courseplan PDF](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/curriculum.html#physics-astronomy-curricula)) give you a strong foundation in the laws that govern everything from atoms to galaxies. Just want a taste of physics? We offer a physics minor too!
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/physics-bachelors.html "Learn more about the B.A. and B.S. in Physics")
Explore the universe without changing your major. Our astronomy minor ([courseplan PDF](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/curriculum.html#physics-astronomy-curricula)) is perfect for students curious about stars, planets and cosmic phenomena.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/astronomy-minor.html "Learn more about the Astronomy Minor")
Dive into the cutting edge of science and technology. This interdisciplinary minor introduces you to quantum computing, quantum mechanics and the future of information systems.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/quantum-information-science-engineering-minor.html "Learn more about the Quantum Information Science and Engineering Minor")
Looking to deepen your physics knowledge or grow as a science educator? Our master of science (M.S.) focuses on advanced coursework and research. ([see Graduate Handbook for details](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/_files/docs/grad_manv33.pdf))
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/physics-masters.html "Learn more about the M.S. and M.S.T. in Physics:")
Ready to contribute to cutting-edge discoveries in physics? Our Ph.D. program ([see Graduate Handbook for details](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/_files/docs/grad_manv33.pdf)) combines rigorous research with close faculty mentorship to prepare you for careers in academia, government labs and industry.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/physics-phd.html "Learn more about the Ph.D. in Physics")
B.S. in Astronomy and Astrophysics 
### Select a Program
B.S. in Astronomy and Astrophysics  B.A. and B.S. in Physics  Astronomy Minor  Quantum Information Science and Engineering Minor  M.S. in Physics  Ph.D. in Physics 
## Department of Physics and Astronomy Resources
### Research
In the Department of Physics and Astronomy, we're uncovering the mysteries of the universe through groundbreaking research from quantum mechanics to astrophysics.
[Research Topics](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/graduate-program/Research.html "View our research topics")
### Graduate Program
Interested in getting a higher degree in physics and astronomy but not sure if it's the right choice for you? Let us convince you and show you how to apply!
[Grad Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/graduate-program/index.html "View graduate student information")
### Undergraduate Program
Take an in-depth look at what it means to be an undergraduate physics and astronomy student. From program details to admission information, we're here to help!
[Undergrad Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/undergraduate-program/index.html "View undergraduate student information")
### Faculty and Staff
From full-time faculty members to scientists and support staff, the Department of Physics and Astronomy is home to leading experts in the field. We boast world-renowned alumni and take pride in helping students find their passion in astronomy and physics topics. At the University of Wyoming, you can rest assured you'll be learning from the best of the best that take the time to get to know their students and create successful scientists.
[Our People](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/people/index.html "Learn more about the people who work in the Department of Physics and Astronomy")

Tau Beta Pi - The Engineering Honor Society & Center
Tau Beta Pi provides tutoring across all engineering, science, mathematics disciplines.
Tutoring takes place in the basement of Coe library during select times Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Tutoring is by drop-in or by appointment through the Engineering Tutoring – Tau Beta Pi community on the Penji platform. Penji can also be accessed through WyoCourses or downloaded as an app for mobile devices.
### STEP Tutor Center
STEP provides Tau Beta Pi tutoring for engineering and computer science students Monday through Thursday, 4:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.
In-person and online appointments are available. Students must download the Penji app (either on mobile or web application) to get tutoring.
[Check the schedule HERE!](https://uwy-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/steveb_uwyo_edu/EZNNYAx63F5BowKCzWD6HM8BfAYFSpRCZF3mG7jyk1VG2Q?rtime=7k5p2Pa-20g)
### Online Tutoring
Online tutoring through NetTutor.
NetTutor is  _subject-_ based tutoring (e.g., help with "chemistry" not necessarily "CHEM 1020")
Free for UW undergraduate students at UW.[Login with your UWYO credentials and select "online tutoring."](https://uwyo.instructure.com/courses/529715)
  * Meet with a Live Tutor
  * Drop off a Question
  * Paper Center


Looking to explore a little first? [Visit our informational page for more information](https://www.uwyo.edu/step/tutoring/online/index.html).

# CEAS Computer Labs
## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences
The Engineering Science Computer Labs (ESIG) are available to students who are enrolled full-time in any College of Engineering degree program. Any room may be used during hours of operation unless a class has been scheduled.

## Begin Your Journey With Us
###  Degrees & Programs 
At the University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences, students are taught by a dedicated community of academic leaders who believe that interdisciplinary, diverse and inclusive education and research are all critical to our success in overcoming the challenges facing today’s world. The need for individuals within the STEM industries has never been greater and the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences is the right place at the right time for you to make a difference.
[Find Your Degree](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
[ABET Accreditation ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/dean/Accreditation/index.html)   

Learn how accreditation ensures quality and career readiness.
###  Admissions & Scholarships 
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences offers 275+ scholarships yearly. Undergrads are admitted on a rolling basis; grad requirements vary by program. With low tuition and 55% graduating debt-free, UW is a top-value choice for an engineering or physical sciences degree.
[Request Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/request-information.html)
Get Started at UW
[UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/index.html)[Engineering Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/scholarships/index.html)[Financial Aid](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)[Cost of Attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)[Graduate Requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)[Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)
[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)   

Explore all that UW has to offer!
###  Who We Are 
At the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences, we’re driven by innovation, discovery and a commitment to shaping future leaders in science and engineering. Under the leadership of Carrell Family Dean, the Dean’s Office is dedicated to supporting students, faculty and staff across the University of Wyoming.

### Where Student Success Matters
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences is dedicated to helping you succeed academically and professionally. Our personalized advising ensures you’re on track to meet your goals. Career services assist with job searches, internships, resume reviews and networking, connecting you to opportunities within the STEM field.
The College also offers tutoring services to support you in challenging courses. With these resources, we aim to provide comprehensive support for your academic and professional growth. Explore more at the Susan McCormack Center for Student Success.
[Student SUCCESS CENTER](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/index.html)

Atmospheric Science 
Explore the science behind weather, climate and atmospheric phenomena. Students and researchers in this department use cutting-edge tools to study and model atmospheric systems that impact our life on Earth.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/atsc/index.html)
This department prepares students to innovate in chemical processes, biotechnology and biomedical devices. With strong industry ties and research opportunities, its where chemistry meets real-world problem-solving.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/index.html)
From materials and energy to health and the environment, the Department of Chemistry is a hub for hands-on discovery. Students gain practical lab experience while working alongside expert faculty. 
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemistry/index.html)
Build your future with programs in civil engineering, architectural systems and construction management. This department focuses on infrastructure sustainability and project leadership.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/index.html)
Design the future with skills in circuits, AI, cybersecurity, and software development. Students in this department tackle modern challenges through theory, lab work and innovation.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/index.html)
Focused on efficient, sustainable resource extraction and energy systems, this department blends geoscience, engineering and technology to address global energy needs.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/petroleum/index.html)
Study Earth from core to crust with faculty-led research in natural resources, tectonics, seismology and more. Fieldwork and lab experience prepare students for geoscience careers.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/geolgeophys/index.html)
Solve real-world problems through advanced mathematics and data analysis. Students learn critical thinking, modeling and computational skills essential in research and industry.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/index.html)
From robotics to renewable energy, this department equips students to design, test and innovate mechanical and energy systems for today’s and tomorrow’s challenges.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/mechanical/index.html)
Dive into the fundamental laws of nature and the mysteries of the universe. Students explore everything from quantum mechanics to galaxies through hands-on experiments and research.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/physics/index.html)
This interdisciplinary hub fosters innovation in computing, data science and digital systems. Students gain in-demand skills through applied projects and cross-campus collaboration.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/soc/index.html)

### World Class Facilities
The Engineering Education and Research Building at the University of Wyoming is a state-of-the-art facility designed to foster innovation, collaboration and hands-on learning. As part of the Tier-1 Engineering Initiative, it supports workforce development and research tied to Wyoming’s economic future. Inside, you’ll find flexible labs, project spaces, active-learning classrooms, a drilling simulator and more—built for next-level engineering education.
[Explore Facilities ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/facilities.html)

# Senior Design Symposium
The University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences hosts an annual Senior Design Symposium in the Engineering Education and Research Building (EERB) as it showcases a multitude of projects presented by students from various engineering and physical science disciplines.
The symposium is a time-honored tradition for the college to help feature senior capstone projects. Students may choose to represent their projects alone or can join up in teams with other students. Projects cover a wide range of topic areas.
Students put in hundreds of hours to prepare for the event.

program_details.url_81:
# Scholarships
## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences
Scholarships in the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences are competitive and based on academic merit. Students are automatically considered for CEPS awards, provided they have submitted the General Application in WyoScholarships, the UW Scholarship awarding platform:
  * Log into [WyoScholarships](https://uwyo.academicworks.com/)
  * Click the "**Sign In** " button in the top right corner
  * Sign in with your UW Username and Password
  * Answer the three general application questions and click "Finish and Submit"


Most college scholarships do not require additional materials or applications. College scholarships are used to fulfill the UW Commitment or Brown & Gold Commitment.
All students admitted to the University of Wyoming by December 1 are considered automatically for scholarships for the next academic year.
  * [UW Financial Aid](http://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/ "Student Financial Aid")


Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps)
[External Funding](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/scholarships/externalfunding.html)
### External Scholarships and Fellowships
Several off-campus organizations offer scholarship opportunities to UW students. The selection process is handled by the individual organizations. Application criteria and deadlines for these scholarships vary. As we receive information on new off-campus scholarship opportunities, we will post them on this page. Check back often for updates.
**Cheyenne Engineers Club**
  * Deadline:**May 31, 2025**
  * [Application Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/resources/student-services/scholarships/docs/cheyenne-engineers-club-scholarship-2025.pdf)
  * Graduates from a high school located in Laramie County, Wyoming
  * Majoring in Engineering, Surveying, Geology, or Construction Management


**Uplink Robotics Scholarship Grant**
  * Deadline:**August 1, 2025**
  * [Application Information](https://www.uplinkrobotics.com/2025scholarshipgrant/)
  * Major in Engineering
  * Minimum GPA of 3.5


More [External Funding Opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/scholarships/externalfunding.html)
### Project Lead the Way (PLTW) Scholarship
The University of Wyoming, College of Engineering and Physical Sciences is a proud partner of PLTW and offers scholarships for first-year students. Students who have completed relevant coursework within the PLTW curriculum with a grade of a C or higher at a certified PLTW high school are eligible for the scholarship. This is a one-time, $40 scholarship awarded to students upon declaring their enrollment at the University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences. For more information about
Project Lead the Way, please visit the[Project Lead the Way website](https://www.pltw.org/ "Project Lead the Way Website ").

# Cost of Attendance
The University of Wyoming (UW) consistently ranks among the best values in the country with low and cost-effective tuition for both resident and non-resident students. Cost of Attendance (COA is not a bill but is an estimate of school-related expenses a full-time student can expect to have for an academic year, and it can help a student estimate their overall out-of-pocket costs when attending UW.

## COA includes direct expenses (billed by the university) and indirect expenses, and it considers a student's residency status, living arrangements and, in some cases, the student's major. The following components are included in in COA as required by federal law and will be used to determine financial aid.
Direct Expenses
  * Tuition
  * Fees
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if on-campus


Indirect Expenses
  * Books, Course Materials, Supplies, and Equipment
  * Transportation
  * Miscellaneous Personal Expenses
  * Living Expenses (Housing and Food) if off-campus or at home

# Graduate Programs
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Welcome to the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences! If you have reached this page and you are interested in Graduate Programs, you have come to the right place. I hope that you will find on this page either the information you are looking for or a link to that information.
Graduate Programs in the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences are managed through the College's Departments. For department and program-specific information, please see the links below for each program.
The University of Wyoming also has an School of Graduate Education that houses even more information about [Graduate Programs](http://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/) across the University. This is a great place to find all of the University-forms and requirements to complete graduate degrees. When going to that site, just be patient and start clicking different links that look useful. You will eventually find what you need.
Finally, if you have any questions or concerns that cannot be readily addressed elsewhere, please contact me. Email is best but you may also call (307) 766-3186 or visit my office in EERB Room 401C.
Sincerely,  
David M. Bagley, Ph.D., P.E.  
Associate Dean for Graduate Programs

Dual MS in Engineering and Physical Sciences/MBA Degree Program
The dual MS in engineering and physical sciences/MBA program at the University of Wyoming allow students to pair advanced technical tranining with strong business and leadership skills. Designed for those seeking to expand their career options in management, entrepreneurship or industry, the program combines rigorous coursework in engineering or science with an MBA curriculum focused on strategy, project management and real world application. Students graduate with both an MS and an MBA, prepared to lead and innovate at the intersection of technology and business.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/mba-engineering-ms.html)

# K-14 STEM Education Outreach Office
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences K-14 STEM Education Outreach Office looks forward to the opportunity to engage students and teachers in hands-on learning to build knowledge and understanding in the field of science, technology, engineering and mathematics. Strength in K-14 education can enhance the quality and quantity of students who pursue STEM programs in higher education and ultimately pursue high-impact careers in Wyoming and beyond.

# Department of Chemical and Biomedical Engineering
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Undergraduate Programs
Explore our ABET-accredited Chemical Engineering program. See how our hands-on learning, research opportunities, and courses that emphasize career-ready skills can launch your future in energy, materials, biotechnology, and more at this [link](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/undergraduate/index.html)!
Graduate Programs
Advance your expertise with our graduate programs in Chemical Engineering. Participate in cutting edge research, receive personalized mentorship, and explore career pathways in industry, academia, and national laboratories at this [link](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/graduate/index.html)!
Faculty
Our faculty are dedicated to mentoring students and advancing innovation in both research and education. Meet them at this [link](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/faculty-staff/index.html)! 
Research
Our department conducts groundbreaking research in energy, health, sustainability, and more using innovative techniques, collaboration, and state-of-the-art facilities. Discover more at this [link](https://www.uwyo.edu/chemical/research/index.html)!
### About Our Department
Welcome to the Department of Chemical and Biomedical Engineering at the University of Wyoming! Here, we prepare students for careers where they can tackle modern and complex challenges in energy, the environment, health, and biotechnology.
  

We offer rigorous undergraduate and graduate programs grounded in hands-on experiences, collaboration, and communication. Our faculty are dedicated and award-winning researchers, mentors, and teachers, leading cutting-edge projects in areas including sustainable energy, materials science, and bioengineering.
Located in the heart of the Mountain West, our department provides a unique and personalized enviornment for learning and discovery, supported by state-of-the-art facilities and strong industry partnerships. Whether you plan to pursue a career in engineering, research, healthcare, or academia, we invite you to explore how our programs can help you shape the future!

## Chemical and Biomedical Engineering Degree Programs
Select a Program
B.S. in Chemical Engineering  Minor Biomedical Engineering  Minor in Process Control  M.S. in Chemical Engineering  Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering  M.S. in Environmental Engineering  B.S./M.S. Quickstart in Chemical Engineering 
B.S. in Chemical Engineering 
Earn your bachelor of science in chemical engineering and learn about the fundamentals of biology, chemistry, physics and math to analyze and design processes.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/chemical-engineering-bachelors.html "Learn more about the B.S. in Chemical Engineering")
Get a minor in biomedical engineering and get the best of both worlds by learning about both medicine and engineering design!
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/biomedical-engineering-minor.html "Learn more about the Minor Biomedical Engineering")
Earn a process control and instrumentation minor and get equipped with theoretical, software and hands-on skills to solve complex control problems in chemical, electrical, mechanical and petroleum engineering industries.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/process-control-instrumentation-minor.html "Learn more about the Minor in Process Control")
Study microfluidics, permeable media, process control and more with a master or science in chemical engineering.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/chemical-engineering-ms.html "Learn more about the M.S. in Chemical Engineering")
A Ph.D. in chemical engineering prepares you for top-level practice and research through close collaboration with world-class scholars on critical topics such as material science, transport in permeable media, energy production, interfacial science, biomedical engineering, regenerative medicine and water treatment.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/chemical-engineering-phd.html "Learn more about the Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering")
Offered in conjunction with the Department of Civil and Architectural Engineering and Construction, the master of science in environmental engineering prepares you to make the world a cleaner, healthier space through engineering.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/environmental-engineering-masters.html "Learn more about the M.S. in Environmental Engineering")
Earn a bachelor of science in chemical engineering and a master of science in chemical engineering in just five years with our quickstart program!
[Learn More](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17347&returnto=1485 "Learn more about the B.S./M.S. Quickstart in Chemical Engineering")

# What We Do
We offer a variety of services such as design consulting, machining, welding, sheet-metal fabrication, scientific instrument repair, and system/apparatus design from our on-campus location in the Engineering Building (L65).
  
The various communities that we support are undergraduate/graduate students and researchers and those doing experiments in the support of teaching in the STEM fields. Historically, our university-affiliated partners have included [Manufacturing-Works](http://manufacturing-works.com/ "Manufacturing-Works Website") and the [Wyoming Technology Business Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/wtbc/ "Wyoming Technology Business Center Page") (WTBC).

# Student Resources
## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences
At the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences, we are committed to providing our students with a rich and supportive academic environment. Students have access to a wide range of resources designed to enhance their educational experience. From state-of-the-art laboratories, cutting-edge research opportunities and ABET Accreditation to dedicated academic advisors and a vibrant student community, we empower our students to excel in their academic pursuits and prepare for successful careers in engineering and the physical sciences.

# Department of Chemistry
## Welcome
The University of Wyoming's Chemistry Department offers a variety of undergraduate and graduate courses, as well as research opportunities in a variety of topic areas. The department enrolls 110 undergraduate and 50 graduate students, and houses world-renowned and award-winning faculty.

# FE Exam
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
All undergraduate engineering students in the University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences are required to take the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) Exam with a good faith effort within one year prior to their expected graduation for program assessment purposes. Taking the FE Exam is a graduation requirement.
Click here for more information: [FE Instructions](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/dean/fe-exam/fe-instructions-2024-03.pdf)
The NCEES Examinee Guide, Practice Exams, and Exam Discipline Specifications can be found on the [NCEES FE website](https://ncees.org/exams/fe-exam/).

# Department of Mathematics and Statistics
## College of Engineering and physical Sciences
[Math Program](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/academics/undergraduate.html "More information about our math program")
A mathematics degree builds strong analytical and problem-solving skills, making it excellent preparation for careers in fields like medicine, law, business and beyond. Math majors consistently score higher on entrance exams like the LSAT and GMAT, and they also enjoy strong job prospects and high starting salaries, often among the top for bachelor’s degree graduates, alongside engineering and computer science. Whether you're aiming for graduate school or the job market, studying math is a smart and rewarding choice.
[Statistics Program](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/academics/undergraduate.html "More information about our statistics program")
Statistics is the science of understanding and extracting value from data, with wide-ranging applications in fields like healthcare, business, public policy and science. Statisticians are in high demand across nearly every industry, enjoy strong job security, high salaries and excellent job satisfaction. With job growth projected to rise over 30% in the coming years, statistics offer a future-proof and rewarding career path.
### About Our Program
The mathematics and statistics department faculty are dedicated to its undergraduate, graduate and post-graduate programs through a passion for teaching, a deep commitment to research and discovery, and by demonstrating significant relevance to a large number of other intellectual fields in science, engineering, economics and business.
  

The department strives to nurture and prepare its own students for successful careers in the statistical and mathematical sciences, whether in academic, governmental or industrial positions. It also strives to provide the foundation for studying and mastering all other fields that use mathematics and statistics.
_**Let us know how you learn in mathematics classes! Please click the button below to access the survey.**_
[Learning Mathematics Survey](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9Tf5EuLeC8U0gpE "Link to the learning mathematic survey")

## Center for Assistance with Statistics and Mathematics (CASM)
The Center for Assistance with Statistics and Mathematics (CASM) offers free, in-person, drop-in (no appointment needed) tutoring for students who are looking for mathematics or statistics help. Our tutors are qualified to help students enrolled in most math and stats courses up to the 3000 level (with occasional help available for higher-level courses). 
[Visit CASM](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/casm/index.html "Learn more about the Center for Assistance with Statistics and Mathematics")

# Advising Center
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
The CEPS Academic Advising Center, located in Engineering Building Room 2085, provides advising services to undergraduate students majoring in Architectural Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical and Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Construction Management, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Energy and Petroleum Engineering, Geology and Geophysics, Mathematics, Statistics, Mechanical Engineering, Energy Systems Engineering, Physics and Astronomy. We assist students with scheduling and registering for courses, creating an undergraduate academic plan, exploring possible majors and minors, understanding university policies, forms and petitions, understanding degree requirements, referrals to university and college services, exploring extra-curricular and co-curricular activities, and discussing academic difficulties.
Our center officially opened in the summer of 2018, and consists of seven full-time Professional Academic Advisors, an Advising Manager and Support Staff. We also serve as a resource for information and training to the academic advising community in our college.
[For incoming students](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/index.html "For Incoming Students") [Our Hours](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/index.html#hours)

# Honors Program
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
It is the goal of the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences to provide Honors students with an enhanced educational experience within the CEAS that complements the liberal arts curriculum currently offered by the Honors Program. This experience should foster creativity and critical thinking, and also provide distinction for HP students.
Course Options
Students interested in the Engineering Honors Program will need to satisfy requirements of the [UW Honors Program](https://www.uwyo.edu/honors/index.html), along with CEPS-specific program requirements. In addition to fulfilling the liberal arts requirements of the UW Honors Program, those enrolled in the Engineering Honors Program need to complete an additional nine (9) credit hours from the engineering curriculum. [Review the list of courses](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/honors/info.html) necessary for the program.

# Awards and Recognition
## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences
The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences (CEPS) has an awards and recognition committee whose purpose is to recognize and honor deserving individuals who have brought distinction to the programs of CEPS through achievements and/or service.
Recognition is given either through induction into the Hall of Fame or by receipt of the College's Distnguished Engineer/Scientist or the Distinguished Service Awards. By honoring these exemplary individuals, we wish to show appreciation to them for the distinction they have brought to the College and the University of Wyoming.

# Susan McCormack Center for Student Success 
## College of Engineering & Physical Sciences
The Susan McCormack Center for Student Success at the University of Wyoming is dedicated to supporting students in UW’s College of Engineering and Physical Sciences. We provide comprehensive support through academic tutoring, career and professional development, scholarships and access to software and computer resources. Our center is focused on fostering student success and preparing graduates for rewarding careers. Above all, we are dedicated to ensuring students have the guidance, resources and opportunities they need to excel both academically and professionally, at UW and beyond.

# Collaborate With Colleagues
Finding the right research collaborators and partnering with counterparts can be a game-changer for your research. While working with research collaborators from different fields offers a blend of unique perspectives, it also allows access to specialized equipment, funding opportunities, and research facilities that would not otherwise be possible. 
[View opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/research/collaborate-with-colleagues.html#view)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps)
[Collaborate with Colleagues](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/research/collaborate-with-colleagues.html)
Benefits of research collaboration include:
  * Comprehensive, High-Quality Research
  * Improved Chance of Publication
  * Increase in Peer Networking
  * Fostering of Cross-Discplinary Understanding


Despite the many benefits and growing collaborative research trends, finding the right partners or research collaborators can be a challenge. So, if you are looking for research collaborators, then [submit your research request here](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8ff9Tuxcsr7rPuu) to be featured on this webpage and start collaborating with your colleagues!
2D Magneto-Optical Microscopy on Low-Dimensional Heterostructures
**SUMMARY:** Due to proximity nature of 2D materials, the 2D heterostructures(2DH) involving 2D magnets and 2D semiconductors present themselves with promising intrinsic properties for magneto-optical manipulation that is essential for quantum technology development. This project aims to study optical response in 2DH by thoroughly testing the sample with the cutting-edge magento-optical microscopy capable of temperature/electrical bias/external magnetic field control. Furthermore, the multi laser line excitation and the time-resolved laser excitation for this instrument enables investigation of resonant excitonic dynamic in pico-second time intervals.
**CONTACT:** Department of Physics and Astronomy Assistant Professor Yu-Tsung(Rem) Tsai

# Academics
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
##  **Be part of the solution:** Only the most innovative and creative solutions will overcome the energy and technology challenges facing today's world. The students, faculty, and staff of the University of Wyoming's College of Engineering and Physical Sciences understand these challenges. They coordinate with leading national science and technology agencies to devise strategies to make our nation and world safer, cleaner and more technologically sound. All students have the opportunity to learn from and work alongside world-class researchers who engage our most complex topics. UW College of Engineering graduates are leaders within many of the world's most influential corporations and government agencies.

### Why Engineering & Physical Sciences at UW?
  * 55% of UW students **graduate debt-free**.
  * Our college offers more than **275 merit-based scholarships** per year.
  * Our **student-faculty ratio is 20:1** and our average **class size is 28**.
  * Fall and spring career fairs are attended by **50-60 local, regional and national employers/organizations hiring UW engineering students** for internships and positions upon graduation.
  * Upon graduation about **55% of CEPS graduates have a job in their chosen field, 75% at three months and 90 percent at six months**.
  * UW has more than **250 recognized student organizations** , including Pi Epsilon Tau (Petroleum Honor Society), SPE (Society of Petroleum Engineers), TBP (Tau Beta Pi), SWE (Society of Women Engineers) and many more.

# University of Wyoming Virtual Tour
## Explore UW from right where you are!
Take a stroll through the stunning University of Wyoming campus without leaving your home! Our interactive virtual tour lets you explore campus with ease, offering an accessible and immersive experience. You can explore Half Acre Recreation & Wellness Center, see what’s happening at Wyoming Union or simply take in the beauty of Prexy’s Pasture.   
  
From our iconic landmarks to our state-of-the-art facilities, you can get a sneak peek into UW campus life. Ready to explore? Start the virtual tour now!

# Research and Economic Development Division
## _Wyoming Relevant, Nationally Competitive,  
Globally Preeminent_
The University of Wyoming Research and Economic Development Division (REDD) advances research, service and innovation through interdisciplinary collaboration. By supporting faculty and student research, REDD drives economic growth and positions UW as a center of research excellence and real-world impact.
[ About Us ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/index.html)[ Resources ](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/index.html)
[FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/fundingupdates/index.html "FEDERAL FUNDING UPDATES")
Guidance and FAQs. 
## Research & Economic Development at UW:
###  For Researchers & Faculty 
  

UW is proud to work alongside some of the nation’s most accomplished researchers and faculty. As a faculty member, graduate researcher or postdoc the Research and Economic Development Division provides you with the resources, guidance and support to secure funding and launch impactful research. 
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/researchers-and-faculty.html)
Explore
  * [EPSCoR and IDeA Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/index.html)
  * [Research Development Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/grant-submissions/index.html "Research Development Office")
  * [PreAward Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/support-and-resources/preaward-services.html "PreAward Services")
  * [Integrity & Compliance](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/research-compliance/index.html)
  * [Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation](https://www.uwyo.edu/innovation/index.html)
  * [Tech Transfer Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/technology-transfer-office/index.html)
  * [Economic Development Units](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/index.html)
  * [WYNDD](https://uwyo.edu/wyndd)
  * [WYSAC](https://wysac.uwyo.edu/wysac/)


  
Find training opportunities:
  * [Training Calendar](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/announcements/training-calendars.html)


###  For Students 
Undergraduate and graduate students at UW can access our strong network of support to help you succeed in your research journey. The Research and Economic Development Division offers a wide range of resources, guidance and funding opportunities to help you develop your ideas, secure support and bring your research project to life.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/students.html)
Explore
  * [Research Development](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/grant-submissions/index.html)
  * [EPSCoR and IDeA Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/epscor/index.html)
  * [Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation](https://www.uwyo.edu/innovation/index.html)

### UW Named Top 5% Research University
The Research and Economic Development Division at UW proudly drives innovation, research and service, enriching student experiences and fueling statewide economic growth. Now a Carnegie R1 institution, UW ranks among the nation’s top research universities.   
  

“R1 status boosts the value of a UW degree, strengthens recruitment, supports Wyoming’s economy and deepens student engagement,” says President Ed Seidel.  
  

With $166M in annual research funding, UW faculty lead advances in energy, AI, agriculture, biomedicine and beyond. UW students and faculty are making an impact!
[UW’s R1 Status](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/about/uwyo-r1-info.html)
