## Why The University of Wyoming?
###  Strong Academics 
The University of Wyoming offers more than 200 areas of study, giving students the opportunity to explore diverse fields and discover their true passions. At UW, we believe in empowering students to pursue their interests with purpose and dedication. Our university's size allows for unique advantages, including more opportunities for hands-on learning, in-depth research experiences and closer connections with faculty members. This student-centered approach to education is a cornerstone of UW. It empowers our students to prepare for success and make an impact that extends far beyond our campus.
[Explore Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)  
  

[Student Success Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html)
Explore resources to support your academic journey.
###  Affordable 
“We value access to an affordable, high-quality education.” This is the very first line of our [Values and Propositions](https://www.uwyo.edu/strategic-plan/value-statements.html) because we wholeheartedly stand by this sentiment. We know that Wyoming is full of hardworking and driven individuals who can have an immense impact on making their community, their state, and the world a far better place. At UW, we are committed to breaking down financial barriers by offering competitive tuition rates, generous scholarships and financial aid options.
[Explore Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
[Estimate Your Cost of Attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)
We factor it all in to give you peace of mind.
###  No Place Like UW 
The University of Wyoming campus and surrounding community is simply unmatched. Your UW experience goes far beyond the classroom—think hiking, skiing, fishing and camping in [world-class outdoor spaces](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/student-life/top-10-laramie.html). And when it’s time to unwind, you’ll find [one of the best downtowns](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html) in the country (seriously—Laramie’s award-winning Main Street Alliance proves it).
[Explore UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/index.html)
Visit UW for Yourself
[Schedule a Weekday Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/index.html)[Learn About Walk-In Tours](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)[Experience our Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)[Join us for an Event](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
[Plan Your UW Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)   

From parking to lodging partners, everything you need for a great visit. 
## Discover the Full UW Experience
Admission to the University of Wyoming opens doors academically and beyond. Choosing the right university is a big decision and our admissions office is here to provide all the information you need to feel confident in choosing UW!
Hear from UW Students 
UW [Student Blogs](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/index.html) are your way to get firsthand insight into campus life at the University of Wyoming. Hear from your peers and learn about all UW has to offer.
Explore Success Resources 
Discover the many ways UW [supports students](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html), from academic resources to personal wellness resources. We're committed to helping you thrive both in and out of the classroom!
Browse UW's Colleges & Schools 
Get to know the Colleges and Schools that shape the University of Wyoming. [Explore the full list](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/colleges.html) to see how each one contributes to UW's academic community and student experience. 
### The World Needs More Cowboys!
At the UW, our students embody Poke Pride and what it means to be a Cowboy. UW is a symbol of leadership, innovation and determination. In the classroom, on the field or in the community, UW students are shaping the future and making an impact. Cowboys are; leaders in their field, problem solvers, innovators, changemakers in their communities, builders of the future and dedicated to excellence.
Welcome the next generation of Cowboys to UW!
[Explore Cowboy Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/areas-of-excellence.html)
## Your Path to the University of Wyoming
Select Your Student Type
First-Year Students  Transfer Students  Graduate Students  International Students  Additional Student Categories 
First-Year Students 
Starting at the University of Wyoming is an exciting experience! With exceptional academic programs and a vibrant, welcoming community, students are drawn to UW. Our admissions team is here to guide you every step of the way, ensuring you have everything you need for a smooth and successful transition to campus life.
[First-Year Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html)
Transferring to the University of Wyoming is an exciting step forward in your academic journey! At UW, transfer students are not only welcomed but also set up for success. The UW admissions team can help you transition smoothly, providing guidance through the entire admissions process. Whether you’re bringing in credits from another school or changing direction, our team is here to help.
[Transfer Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/index.html)
UW offers a diverse range of prestigious graduate programs, and we're excited to guide students through the admissions process. While there are general requirements for all grad students, each program has its own specific criteria. Fortunately, our UW admissions team has the resources and has expert staff to support you every step of the way.
[Graduate Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)
Navigating the admissions process as an international student can feel daunting, but we’re here to make it easier! From ensuring you have the right documentation to connecting you with expert advisors, our team is dedicated to supporting you every step of the way. At UW, you’ll always have the help you need to make your transition smooth and successful.
[International Student Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/index.html)
From military veterans to non-degree-seeking students, there’s a path for everyone at UW. Our team is here to support your unique journey and connect you with the resources you need to succeed. No matter your background or goals, you’ll find the guidance and community to help you thrive.
[ADDITIONAL STUDENT CATEGORIES](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/index.html)

From your first campus tour to confirming your enrollment, UW offers admissions events tailored to every step of the college search. Whether you're just starting to explore through our Campus Pass program or joining us for a New Student Day as a future Cowboy or Cowgirl, you’ll get a genuine look at what makes the University of Wyoming unique. We also host virtual sessions and webinars—so no matter where you are, you can connect with us and get your questions answered.

# UW Education Abroad
The University of Wyoming Education Abroad Office proudly offers a variety of international opportunities for UW students. With programs in over 80 different countries and on all 7 continents, UW students can explore opportunities such as exchange, study abroad, research, and international internships. These global learning opportunities form a crucial part of the UW experience and help prepare students for success in an increasingly interconnected world. Start here…go anywhere!

## Make Your Study Abroad Dreams a Reality
###  Find Your Program 
There are various [Education Abroad programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/get-started/explore-programs.html "View Education Abroad programs") to choose from, each offering unique experiences. Finding the right fit depends on your preferences and goals. Explore UW’s offerings and narrow your options by program type. If you want to go abroad for a semester or a year and take classes at a partner university, consider an exchange or direct-enroll program. For studying with UW faculty and students, check out UW faculty-led programs. Other factors like your desired level of independence and preferred regions will also help guide your choice. Take your time and enjoy the process of exploring as the first step in your journey abroad!
###  Keep Your Degree on Track 
Studying abroad is an immensely enriching experience, both personally and academically. To ensure success, it’s key to [align your program with your academic goals](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/get-started/academics.html "Learn more about how to align your program with your academic goals"). By understanding how the program will contribute to your degree requirements, you can maximize your time abroad while staying on track for graduation. With careful planning, preparation, and [collaboration with your advisor](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/faculty-advisors/index.html "View faculty advisor information"), you can participate in a study abroad program without delaying your degree progress, reducing academic stress and leaving more room to fully enjoy all the delights of your time abroad—and hopefully an extra pastry or two.
###  Ensure You Are Eligible 
In order to participate in UW sanctioned education abroad programs, you must meet the following [requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/get-started/apply.html "View study abroad requirements"):
  * A minimum of a 2.75 university/college GPA
  * 30 or more credit hours (sophomore standing or higher)
  * Good standing with the university and not on academic or disciplinary probation
  * Second-semester freshmen can participate in the Spring London Semester, the Fall Rome Semester or Faculty-Led programs (with faculty approval)


_If you don’t currently meet these requirements, don’t fret! Meet with your advisor to create a plan to get on track for eligibility._
## Cost of Education Abroad Programs
It's essential to be aware of the financial responsibilities of studying abroad and plan accordingly. The good news is that with careful planning and preparation, making this experience more affordable and accessible may be easier than you think!
Cost of a Study Abroad Program 
Program costs vary by duration, experience and location. Visit the specific [program page](https://uwyoabroad.via-trm.com/visitor-programs-v2 "View programs more in-depth") to get a more accurate estimate of costs for the programs you're interested in.
Financial Aid Accessibility 
Federal FAFSA funding, UW Scholarships, and private funding sources can typically be applied to UW-approved study abroad programs.
Study Abroad Scholarships 
You can find an overview of UW scholarships in the [Study Abroad Scholarship Booklet.](https://www.canva.com/design/DAFLxUIpzMA/slFQOf5Aav85Gl2-9q9soA/view?utm_content=DAFLxUIpzMA&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=publishsharelink) Our largest scholarship endowment, the Cheney Study Abroad Grant has helped nearly 3,000 students fund their study abroad programs since 2007. Learn more about eligibility and applying!
UW Study Abroad scholarships will open in [WyoScholarships](https://uwyo.academicworks.com/) every semester – September for January and Spring programs, February for Summer and Fall programs.
Study Abroad Costs and Budgeting Tips 
Creating and sticking to a budget may not seem glamorous, but it's key to reducing stress and ensuring you can fully enjoy your study abroad experience! [Check out our tips here](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/money-matters/costs-budgeting.html "View tips for budgeting").
### Education Abroad 101
Education Abroad 101 is UW’s introductory course designed to provide all the essential information about studying abroad. This brief, easy-to-complete course takes just minutes and serves as the perfect first step to start exploring the many opportunities available through Education Abroad. Whether you're ready to jump head first into study abroad, or are just curious about the available options—this is your first step.
[START YOUR COURSE](https://rise.articulate.com/share/hS-6mayuuGesJOE7j9CFh1HsyBsoSIrG#/ "Link to begin your course")
## Education Abroad: The Student Experience
Helpful Resources
Identities Abroad  UWYO Global Buddies  UWYO Abroad Ambassadors  Returning Home 
Identities Abroad 
Preparing for identity considerations abroad is an important part of any study abroad journey. Take time to learn about the host country or city of your program, including how different aspects of your identity might be perceived in another cultural context.
[Get the resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/index.html "Link to hear from UW students")
Joining the UWYO Global Buddies program is a fantastic way to enhance your UW experience. This initiative, part of the [UW Global Engagement Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/global/index.html "Learn more about the UW Global Engagement Office"), fosters cross-cultural friendships and understanding. Domestic and international students are matched based on shared interests to build meaningful relationships and lasting connections.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/iss/current-students/global-buddies.html "Learn more about the Global Buddies Program")
The UWYO Abroad Ambassadors are a dedicated group of students passionate about education abroad. These individuals aim to share their personal experiences and promote the benefits of studying abroad to the UW campus community. By connecting with fellow students, they help inspire others to explore global opportunities and make UW a more inclusive, welcoming and dynamic campus.
[HOW TO APPLY](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/uwyo-ambassadors.html "Learn how to apply")
Just as every study abroad experience is unique, so too is the experience of returning home. Reintegration after spending time abroad can sometimes be more challenging than expected. You are re-adjusting to a different pace, culture and environment, and bursting at the seams to share about your experience! To support you through this transition, we’ve provided resources designed to help guide you through the process.
[Returning Home Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/returning-home.html "View resources for returning home")

### Benefits of Studying Abroad
UW is dedicated to enriching the lives of our students through education, whether that be here on campus or far beyond. We know that more Cowboys out in the world is always a good thing, and we are proud of our Pokes abroad! Studying abroad offers countless benefits that go beyond the classroom. It allows you to immerse yourself in new cultures, gain valuable global perspectives and enhance your academic experience. You'll develop skills like adaptability, problem-solving and cross-cultural communication. This is a transformative experience that you won’t want to miss!
[Study Abroad Benefits](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/parents.html "View study abroad benefits")
## Health and Safety Abroad
Preparing for [health and safety abroad](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/safety/index.html "View health and safety abroad information") is a crucial step in ensuring a smooth and successful education abroad experience. To help you get ready, we've compiled essential resources and answered frequently asked questions to guide you through the process. By taking these steps, you—and your loved ones—can feel more confident and prepared for your time abroad.
[Cultural Adjustment](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/while-abroad/index.html "View cultural adjustment information")
Studying abroad is an exciting yet challenging adventure. Navigating a new culture, country and academic system can be a lot. Understanding this transition phase can help ease the process.
[Mental Wellness](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/while-abroad/self-care.html "View mental wellness information")
Supporting your mental health during study abroad is essential. We've compiled resources to help you prioritize self-care, stay connected with loved ones and seek support when needed. It’s okay to ask for help!
[Document Your Experience](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/student-experience/while-abroad/documenting.html "View documentation details")
Studying, researching or teaching abroad creates unforgettable moments. While memories may fade, we have some helpful tips for documenting through photos, journals or sharing with loved ones.
[Emergency Communication](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwyoabroad/safety/emergency-communication.html "View emergency communication information")
UW and our education abroad partners prioritize open communication for your safety. Familiarize yourself with local emergency procedures, and know the UW team is always here to support and ensure your well-being.

# Civil and Architectural Engineering and Construction Management
## Working for Wyoming and the World
### Programs
Explore the different programs offered by our department.
[Architectural Engineering](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/architectural-engineering/index.html "Architectural Engineering program") |  | [Civil Engineering](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/civil-engineering/index.html "Civil Engineering program")  
---|---|---  
[Construction ManageMENT](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/construction-management/index.html "Construction Management program") |  | [Land Surveying](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/land-surveying-certificate.html "Land Surveying certificate")  
  

## Research
Learn about our fields of research
Architectural Engineering  Construction Management  Environmental  Geotechnical  Structures  Transportation  Water Resources 
Architectural Engineering 
Architectural Engineering research at the University of Wyoming centers on sustainable design, energy-efficient buildings, and smart system integration. Key areas include urban-scale energy modeling, advanced building envelope technologies, and the use of hybrid physics and machine learning approaches to optimize building performance. Faculty also focus on Building Information Modeling (BIM) to support collaborative and sustainable design practices. Additional efforts explore the role of indoor greenery and controlled environment agriculture in improving energy use and occupant well-being.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/architectural/index.html "Architectural Engineering research")
Research in the Construction Management program at the University of Wyoming focuses on improving construction processes, project management, and sustainable building practices. Areas of study include advanced construction scheduling and risk management, data analytics for project performance, and the integration of new technologies like robotics and drones in construction. Faculty also explore the use of machine learning and AI to optimize project outcomes, along with the impact of construction practices on sustainability and resilience. Additionally, there is significant focus on construction education, enhancing both industry training and interdisciplinary collaboration.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/construction-management/index.html "Construction Management Research")
The Environmental Engineering faculty at the University of Wyoming are deeply involved in exploring solutions for water and wastewater treatment, environmental sustainability, and pollution control. Their research spans developing advanced water treatment technologies, cleaning up contaminated environments, and using data analytics to better understand environmental impacts. They also focus on renewable resources and innovative materials for improving engineering systems, while investigating the broader effects of climate change on water and air quality. A lot of the work is geared toward improving environmental health, resource management, and finding new ways to monitor and mitigate pollution.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/environmental/index.html "Environmental Engineering research")
The Geotechnical Engineering faculty at the University of Wyoming are focused on understanding the behavior of soils and materials in the context of construction and infrastructure. Their research includes studying soil-structure interactions, seismic hazards, and the behavior of foundations in challenging environments. They also look into innovative techniques for soil stabilization, as well as the impact of natural events like earthquakes and landslides on built structures. The faculty aim to improve the safety and efficiency of geotechnical design and construction practices while advancing knowledge in soil mechanics and geotechnical engineering applications.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/geotechnical/index.html "Geotechnical Engineering Research")
The University of Wyoming Structural Engineering research group explores innovative solutions to improve the safety, sustainability, and resilience of the built environment. Current research focuses on understanding masonry material behavior under loading, assessing the carbon footprint of steel in structural applications, enhancing the sustainability of timber construction, and improving the seismic performance of concrete structures. By integrating experimental testing, computational modeling, and life-cycle analysis, the group advances engineering knowledge that supports safer buildings and infrastructure while promoting environmentally responsible practices.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/structural/index.html "Structural engineering research")
The Transportation Engineering faculty at the University of Wyoming are focused on improving the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of transportation networks. Their research spans traffic flow optimization, roadway design, and the use of advanced materials for pavement systems. Faculty also study transportation safety, with a particular emphasis on rural and low-traffic areas, and the use of data-driven approaches for traffic management and infrastructure development. Additionally, they explore the integration of emerging technologies such as autonomous vehicles and intelligent transportation systems to shape the future of mobility.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/transportation/index.html "Transportation Engineering research")
The Water Resources faculty at the University of Wyoming focus on advancing our understanding of water systems, sustainability, and environmental impacts. Their research covers areas like hydrology, water quality, and water resource management, with a particular emphasis on the effects of climate change and human activities on water supplies. Faculty also study the movement of water through natural and engineered systems, and the design of efficient water treatment and distribution technologies. Additionally, they explore innovative methods for water conservation and the protection of aquatic ecosystems.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/civil/research/envewr/index.html "Water Resources Engineering Research")

# Atmospheric Science
## College of engineering and physical sciences
A graduate student with the Mobile Research Laboratory
Two faculty members at the NCAR-Wyoming Supercomputing Center
Faculty members with the NSF UW King Air research aircraft
### About our department
The Department of Atmospheric Science provides a rigorous graduate program that allows students to compete for top-level careers in the field. Our students have direct access to unique training facilities: an atmospheric research aircraft and one of the most powerful supercomputers in the world. Our students have careers that cross many boundaries. Many of our students have pursued careers with the National Weather Service or with air quality agencies. With a graduate degree in Atmospheric Science at UW, you will receive the training you need to succeed in your chosen field, be it weather forecasting, climate research, or air quality monitoring. The Department of Atmospheric Science offers excellent opportunities in graduate education and research, using both observations and numerical modeling.

# Innovation
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
The University of Wyoming encourages and facilitates the development of businesses across the State of Wyoming (see the [UW Business Resource Network](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/economic-development/index.html) for more information). This includes the development of companies by members of the UW community, especially due to the results of internally and externally-funded research conducted by UW faculty and students. A number of companies have been developed by members of the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences. This webpage provides a summary of these companies as well as information for those interested in learning more about how UW supports entrepreneurs and where to go next to develop their business ideas.

program_details.url_137:
# Shop Policies
**Please review the following policies for the UW Engineering Shop.**
* * *
  * We do not loan tools to non-UW users.
  * We occasionally loan tools for short-term lab use.
  * We charge an hourly rate for labor ($60 per) and machine time (between $60-80 per) in the following areas: 
    * Design
    * Fabrication
    * Programming
    * Troubleshooting
    * [**Review the UW Fee Book**](https://www.uwyo.edu/administration/financial-affairs/feebook/)
  * We do not teach students how to weld (MIG or TIG). These processes are time consuming to learn and are more cost-effective to be completed by the Shop Staff, as needed. Students who have successfully completed a collegiate/SkillsUSA welding certificate program may be exempt.
  * We offer free 30 minute consultations with each new project.
  * **To discuss your project in-person at no cost, please bring the following information:**  

    * Project name/course number
    * Laboratory room number
    * Principal investigator, instructor, or advisor
    * First and last name of person requesting the work
    * Phone and email contact for requestor
    * Part material and quantity
    * Well-annotated drawing
  * Walk-in hours are 1-3 p.m. Monday-Friday and by appointment.
  * Raw materials can be purchased from the shop or provided by the customer.
  * During senior design, enrolled students may use the shop after completing mandatory safety training. 
    * Read [Student Handbook](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/shop/ceps-machine-shop-student-handbook-rev.-aug-2022.pdf) & complete Shop Safety Assessment.
    * **Each Senior Design project qualifies for 15hrs of free shop staff labor, including equipment operator training.**
    * Materials available for purchase at then-current market prices, subject to University regulations.
  * [CEPS Shop Billing Policy](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/shop/ceps-shop-billing-policy-revised-summer-2025-final.pdf "CEPS Shop Billing Policy")
  * [Shop Training Policy](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/shop/ceps-shop-safety-1125.pdf "Shop Training Policy")
  * Other students must obtain permission from the shop manager before using shop facilities for university projects only. 
    * Read [Student Handbook](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/_files/shop/ceps-machine-shop-student-handbook-rev.-aug-2022.pdf) & complete Shop Safety Assessment.
  * Projects are prioritized generally on a first-in-first-out (FIFO) basis. If needed, the queue may be re-ordered with the following priority list: Academics, then funded research, then unfunded research, then external.

# Recruiters and Employers
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
## WELCOME
Let our University of College of Engineering and Physical Sciences Susan McCormack Center for Student Success Career Services Office employer relations team assist in connecting your company to UW students and recent graduates, for entry-level science, technology, engineering, and mathematics employment.
[View our services](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/recruiters-and-employers.html#services)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps)
[For Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/students.html)
[For Recruiters & Employers](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/recruiters-and-employers.html)
[For Faculty](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/faculty.html)
[Job Search Sites](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/job-search-sites.html)
[BuzzFile](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/buzzfile.html)
[Handshake](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/handshake.html)
[TREKs](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/trek.html)
## SERVICES WE OFFER
POST A JOB 
We use the Handshake online recruiting platform. Over 12,000 UW students and recent graduates have 24/7 access and can see your jobs once they are posted. Create an [employer account](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/handshake.html) and start posting positions today! 
**You are also welcome to reach out toTyler Grabner to have your posting emailed directly to students and added to our CEPS Weekly Bulletin that goes out to all students!**
FREE | VIRTUAL
INTERVIEW STUDENTS 
Receive welcoming all-round support for all your full-time and internship interview needs in meeting one-on-one with students. For more information, please be sure to review our [Employer Recruiting Policies](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/employers/employeruserpolicy.html).
FREE | ON-CAMPUS | VIRTUAL
INFORMATION SESSIONS 
These hour-long sessions allow the hosting companies to provide UW students with valuable information about your organization and industry, and generally end with ample Q&A time. Contact us to learn more!
FREE | ON-CAMPUS | VIRTUAL
CLASSROOM LECTURES 
Attend a class in a major of your choosing to discuss your work and how it relates to the concepts students are learning. Availability dependent on class workload. 
FREE | ON-CAMPUS | VIRTUAL
CAREER FAIR 
We host yearly Career Fairs for various employer industries. Actively student participants number around 450 per fair. To see what we have scheduled this year, visit [Career Fairs](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/career-events.html).
$$ | ON-CAMPUS | VIRTUAL
COMPANY SITE VISITS 
These opportunities allow employers and students to connect informally for 1:1 or small group tours of a company’s work location. Students gain industry insights from current employees and learn about real-work taking place in real-world settings. Contact us to learn more!
$ | LOCAL | VIRTUAL
SPONSOR A SENIOR DESIGN PROJECT 
Senior Design projects are completed by senior year students and range from one to two semesters. Contact us to learn more!
$$ | LOCAL | VIRTUAL
STUDENT CLUBS 
Connecting with specialized student clubs allows for broader audiences to recruit from. We can assist with the connections or you can access the list of [UW’s registered student clubs](https://www.uwyo.edu/csil/student-orgs/index.html) you are interested in.
FREE | VIRTUAL
GRADUATE EMPLOYMENT DATA 
Graduates self-report their employment information. Visit [UW Career Outcomes](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/career_outcomes.html) to discover the data on our graduating class.
FREE | VIRTUAL
BECOME A CAREER CHAMPION 
Want to participate in your own professional development? Career Champions are those who connect with students in individual career-related aspects by volunteering to conduct resume reviews, mock interviews, informational interviews, and mentoring conversations. Contact us today so we can help you develop a specialized company recruiting strategy.
### CONNECT WITH OUR OFFICE
Our office is excited to share with you the many opportunities we have available for recruiters and employers to engage with our University of Wyoming students. 
Tyler Grabner
Manager, Career Services Office
Susan McCormack Center for Student Success
College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
EN 2085
307-766-4277 | tgrabner@uwyo.edu
  
Employers schedule an appointment with Tyler:
[Schedule an appointment here](https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/EngineeringCareerServices@uwy.onmicrosoft.com/bookings/ "Employer appointment scheduling")
#### EMPLOYER EXPECTATIONS
We hold our students to a high standard of academic and professional excellence and expect to see the same from our valued employers. [Click here](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/uw-ceps-employer-hiring-expectations.pdf) to view our expectations of the companies we work with to hire our students.

program_details.url_139:
# Student Projects
* * *
Students are encouraged to use the UW Engineering Shop for senior-design projects and other applications utilizing design curriculum. Student use of the facility will be limited to course-related work only.
* * *
**What we expect from non-engineering UW students**  
  
**To discuss your project in person, please bring the following information:**   
  

  * Project name/course number
  * Laboratory room number
  * Principal investigator, instructor, or advisor
  * First and last name of person requesting the work
  * Phone and email contact for requestor
  * Part material and quantity
  * Well-annotated drawing


* * *
  

**What we expect from UW engineering students**  
  
**To discuss your project in person, please bring the following information:**  
  

  * Parts must be drawn and modeled in Solidworks, no matter how big or small.
  * If multiple parts are used, a Solidworks assembly model is required.
  * Fasteners and off-the-shelf hardware must be included in assembly model, if applicable.
  * If the parts are attached to an existing assembly, part or off the shelf item, that item is to be represented in the assembly model.
  * Engineering drawings of each part are to be created on title blocks with appropriate dimensions and tolerances, quantities and materials.
  * Assembly drawings with bill of materials are to be created, if applicable.
  * All drawings and models are subject to shop manager and technician approval before fabrication process can begin.
  * This procedure is an exercise of what is expected of an engineer in industry and the same process the shop technicians use to design and fabricate projects for customers.


**[SolidWorks Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/shop/solidworks.html "SolidWorks Information page") | [Innovation Wyrkshop Center](https://www.wyrkshop.org) **

# Career Services for Students
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
The University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences Susan McCormack Center for Student Success Career Services Office is here to help students connect with employers that are or potentially seeking qualified candidates. We participate in job fairs throughout the academic year like the BIG Job Fair (held once in the fall and once in the spring), and the STEM Job Fair (held once in the fall and once in the spring). In addition, we provide services directly to students such as resume reviews, mock interviews, job and internship searching assistance, and much more, to help students navigate the stressful experience of finding a job/career! We have also partnered with many companies and developed programs to simplify a student's journey through college and prepare them for their career or graduate school after college. [View resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/students.html#resources) [View stats](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/students.html#stats) |  |   
---|---|---  
## MEET YOUR CAREER SERVICES TEAM
### Tyler Grabner
Tyler heads the CEPS Susan McCormack Center for Student Success Career Services Department. He focuses on developing relationships with employers in our industry. 
**Contact Tyler:**

### Annie Cowger
Annie is the CEPS Career Coach. She helps students prepare for the professional world through resume reviews, mock interviews, cover letter writing, building connections in the field, gaining internships, and more! 
**Contact Annie:**

[Book an appointment with Annie here](https://uwyoming.campus.eab.com/pal/acrB0zViqV "Book an appointment with Annie here")
## CEPS CAREER SUCCESS PLAN
There are certain steps that you, as college students, should take to help you explore various career options and move forward with them.  
Just like a final exam, your job and/or internship search or program selection is not something you should ‘cram’ for at the last minute.  
It takes time, reflection, and different experiences that will help you define what you’d like to do.
Start exploring and learning as early as your first year. We are confident that you will be more prepared to find a career that suits your passions,values, interests, and goals.
FIRST YEAR: REFLECT AND EXPLORE
| 
  * Nail down a system for yourself to complete courses successfully. This may include dedicating the right amount of time to study, people to study with, and places to complete coursework.
  * Check your UWYO email regularly. This is a valuable place for you to learn about upcoming jobs and events like the UW Career Fair!
  * Complete the Cowboy Joe Exercise (Flower Exercise). This is an effective way to reflect on your own interests, skills, and values, and do some research on the field you eventually want to get into.
  * Join a registered student organization (RSO). Student organizations will allow you to meet other students and may even help you develop professionally and build connections in the industry.
  * Login to Handshake and attend the UW Career Fair. Events like the UW Career Fair and company information sessions are extremely valuable for learning about opportunities and building relationships.
  * Build (or update) your resume and meet with a Career Services Professional. In this meeting, you may talk about anything internship or professional development related, though the focus of this meeting may be to simply go over your resume, talk about job searching in general, and briefly discuss your personal 4-year plan!

  
---|---  
SECOND YEAR: PREPARE
| 
  * Meet with a Career Services Professional to talk about tailoring your resume and/or cover letter, interviewing, and start applying for internships or Research Undergraduate Experiences (REUs). Many second-year students obtain relevant summer work. This is a great time to start to use what you're learning in class in a real-world situation. If you are looking to apply, start early! Positions open and close throughout the school year, many as early as September.
  * Dive into Suitable (SOAR) to upskill and learn more about career competencies. SOAR has information as well as lessons for you to learn about essential skills that will be helpful with entering the workforce.
  * Dive into the career resources below. We have resources for everything from resumes to job searching links available to you. Take a look and determine what you need to be successful.
  * Attend career events and start growing your network. Attend events like the UW Career Fair, career seminars, and company presentations to build connections you may use as you actively apply for positions.
  * Create a LinkedIn profile to connect with professionals. LinkedIn is a professional social media tool for networking and it can be valuable when trying to keep in touch with professionals in the field

  
---|---  
THIRD YEAR: EXPERIENCE
| 
  * Research graduate education to determine if that is right for you. Graduate school will give you a deeper understanding of your subject and will likely give you experience in research. Grad school may be a requirement for the field you are looking to get into.
  * Get an internship or get involved in research. Start your search early and reach out to our Career Services Professionals for assistance.
  * Take on a leadership role with your RSO. You can elaborate on this in your resume to show the skills you have gained and the initiative you have taken.
  * Perform informational interviews with your contacts. Informational interviewing is when you ask a professional to meet in order for you to ask them a few professional questions. This can help you learn more about your career field and strengthen your connection.

  
---|---  
FOURTH YEAR: SUCCEED
| 
  * Start applying for jobs early. It can take anywhere from 3-to-12 months to get a job once you start applying. We generally recommend that seniors use multiple job searching boards and strategies and start applying for positions 3-to-7 months before they graduate.
  * Meet with our CEPS Career Services Office to learn about salary negotiation techniques.
  * Let your professional contacts know that you are looking for a job and let them know when you apply. This is a major benefit to having a professional network. Professionals know about available roles and may be able to help you get your foot in the door!
  * Complete your First Destination Survey before you graduate. This information gives us a good idea about where our students are going and how much they are making.

  
---|---  
MASTERS AND PHD STUDENTS
  * Meet with a Career Services Professional to talk about your goals and experience. Our CEPS Career Services staff can help you format research experience, projects, publications and any other items that you may want to include on your resume or CV.
  * Tailor your job search for positions that you are interested in and qualified for. This may look slightly different for master's students looking to get involved in research!


### CEPS CAREER RESOURCES
Beneficial resources to guide you to your professional goals. Click on the window below for downloadable resources on resumes, cover letters, interviewing, job searching, and much more!
[Visit the Resource Hub](https://padlet.com/CEPSCareerServices/ceps-career-services-resource-hub-8zc43utqf24qd2qt)

The College of Engineering and Physical Sciences Business Office was developed to support the college’s faculty and staff with the transaction-based activities of the college. The staff of the CEPS Business Office strive to provide excellent customer service to our departments, faculty, staff, and students. We aim to provide services that are efficient, timely, accurate, and based on best practices.
The CEAS Business Office staff provide services in the following areas:
**Human Resources:** Support all of the department’s hiring needs, including the recruitment process, the hiring process, time entry and the termination process. 
**Accounting:** Support all the department’s accounting needs, including departmental purchases, payment of invoices and reimbursements, reconciliation of P-cards, and provide routine reports on the department’s budget status. 
**Grant Awards:** Support the PI’s needs including all related accounting and HR support, monitor award balances, and provide routine reports to individual PI’s.

# Advising Center
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
The CEPS Academic Advising Center, located in Engineering Building Room 2085, provides advising services to undergraduate students majoring in Architectural Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical and Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Construction Management, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Energy and Petroleum Engineering, Geology and Geophysics, Mathematics, Statistics, Mechanical Engineering, Energy Systems Engineering, Physics and Astronomy. We assist students with scheduling and registering for courses, creating an undergraduate academic plan, exploring possible majors and minors, understanding university policies, forms and petitions, understanding degree requirements, referrals to university and college services, exploring extra-curricular and co-curricular activities, and discussing academic difficulties.
Our center officially opened in the summer of 2018, and consists of seven full-time Professional Academic Advisors, an Advising Manager and Support Staff. We also serve as a resource for information and training to the academic advising community in our college.

**Newly admitted transfer students:** Please send an email to ceps-advising@uwyo.edu to request advising. You should include your full name, W number, and intended major in your email. 
_Fall transfer students are advised in April, while spring transfer admits are advised in November. However, you should reach out as soon as you are admitted so that your transfer work can be evaluated in a timely manner._
**Newly admitted freshmen students:** Advising for first time students begins with New Student Days. [Click here for information](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html). For students who were not able to attend a New Student Days event, advising will begin in June. Watch for an email from your advisor with information on how to schedule an appointment. 
_If you have not received an email by June 15, please send an email toceps-advising@uwyo.edu and include your full name, W number, and intended major. _

# Undergraduate Degrees in EECS
The EECS Department offers four undergraduate programs: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, and an Electrical Engineering with a Bioengineering Option. These degrees provide students with comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience in designing and developing vital technological systems.

### Careers in EECS
The faculty of the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science endeavor to train the next generation of top-quality engineers, researchers, and scientests. With a combination of successful, funded research and top-level industrial experience, EECS professors bridge the gap between theory and practice, creating an environment in which students can develop the requisite skills demanded by the best employers.
[Learn more](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/studentservices/jobs/index.html)
### Research Opportunities
With any of our degrees, take part in [cutting-edge research](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/index.html) with our faculty members. You'll gain valuable experience and contribute to the future of the industry.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/research/index.html)
### QuickStart BS/MS Program
The combined BS/MS program enables especially well-qualified students to be admitted to the MS program during the junior year, allowing a simultaneous pursuit of the BS and MS degrees. BS/MS students may have up to six credit hours count toward both the undergraduate and graduate requirements to reduce the period of study.
Students enrolled in this program gain the advantage of a reduced course workload so that they may devote more time to investigation, thus enhancing the quality of research products and expediting degree completion.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-electrical-engineering-quickstart.html)

About our Programs
## Electrical Engineering
The electrical engineering program offers a strong foundation in core engineering principles while allowing students to specialize in areas like circuits, communications, robotics and energy systems. With extensive lab work and a year-long senior design project, students gain hands-on experience applying their knowledge to real-world challenges.
[See Catalog](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17365&returnto=1485)
ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING (BIOENGINEERING OPTION)
This area focuses on applying electrical engineering to environmental science, wildlife research, biology and medicine, preparing students for roles in government, industry and medical settings. It’s also a strong pathway for careers in biomedical instrumentation, environmental monitoring, wildlife telemetry and even preparation for medical or dental school.
[See Catalog](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17367&returnto=1485)
## Computer Engineering 
The computer engineering program blends electrical engineering and computer science, giving students a strong foundation in both hardware and software. With hands-on lab experience in digital systems, microprocessors, embedded devices and computer networks, students learn to design and integrate the technologies that power modern computing systems.
[See Catalog](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17366&returnto=1485)
## Computer Science
The B.S. in Computer Science equips students with computational problem-solving skills and prepares them for careers across every industry. With foundations in software systems, data and IT—and optional concentrations in Business, Big Data or International Engineering—students gain the versatile expertise needed to innovate in a world driven by technology.
[See Catalog](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/preview_program.php?catoid=16&poid=17357&returnto=1485)
## Resources
[Paying for College](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)
[Resources for Current Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/resources/current-students/index.html)
[Course Catalog](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/index.php)
### EECS Minors
EECS minors provide foundational and specialized knowledge in computer science and electrical engineering, complementing various majors across the university. These programs equip students with critical technical skills and analytical thinking essential for today's technology-driven world.
[About our minors](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/undergraduate/eecs-minors.html)
## Degree Plans
Our sample four-year degree plans provide a clear roadmap for undergraduate students in each of our EECS programs, outlining recommended courses semester by semester. These plans help students navigate their academic journey, ensuring they meet all requirements while building a strong foundation in their chosen specialization.
[See Plans Here](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/curriculum.html)

# Career Services
## Advising, Career, Exploratory Studies
The ACES Career Services team is committed to helping UW students find, connect with and secure their dream jobs, enabling you to make a lasting impact. Our team knows the University of Wyoming produces graduates who excel in their fields and would be an asset to any company or team. You have the skills—we are here to help make the connections! We offer a wide range of services, including resume building, interview preparation, career counseling and networking opportunities, all designed to set students up for success. Whether you're pursuing a career in agriculture, art history, or anything in between, we're here to support you every step of the way!
[ACES Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/index.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces)
[Career Outcomes](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/aces-data-hub/career-outcomes.html)
[Employers By Major](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/employersbymajor.html)
[Fairs & Career Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/career-events.html)
[Handshake](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/handshake.html)
[Internship Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/internship-resources.html)
[Job Searching](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/job-search.html)
[UW Career Guide](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/uw-career-guide.html)
[Schedule an Appointment](https://uwyo.navigate.eab.com/app/#/authentication/remote/)
Schedule an appointment with our knowledgeable and supporting ACES advising team! We are here to help you plan your academic path and set you up for success.
[Internships Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/internship-resources.html)
Explore on-campus, seasonal or even international internships with Career Services support. Reach out to familiarize yourself with the opportunities available and make it happen!
[Handshake: Job Search Tool](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/handshake.html)
Handshake is a job search platform that connects UW grads with alumni in your field. It’s your virtual handshake to build connections with employers and experts in your industry.
### The Spring 2025 career fairs are almost here!
It’s the perfect time to connect with employers, explore opportunities, and take the next big step toward your future.
Each semester, the University of Wyoming hosts career fairs across a wide range of fields—including STEM, business, health, education, and more—where students can explore opportunities, network with employers, and make meaningful professional connections. These events are complemented by resume reviews, mock interviews, and other prep sessions, ensuring students enter ready and confident. Held both fall and spring semesters, the fairs are a high-impact platform to jump-start your career journey.
[career fair calendar](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/career-events.html)

Previous
### UW Job Listings

The UW Alumni Association is proud to support upcoming or recent UW grads in finding their career path and making helpful connections with UW alum in similar fields.
[UWAA Support](https://www.pokes.org/)
### UW Grad School
After your undergrad, graduate school may be your next step. If you are interested in pursuing a further degree, explore all UW grad school has to offer!

### Resumes & Cover Letters
Use our helpful resources and supportive staff to make your resume and cover letter stand out, giving you the confidence to apply for jobs with a polished, professional approach. Resume guides and resources can be found on pages 9-15 in the Career Guide and pages 26-29 include cover letter resources. You can also make an appointment with our dedicated career services staff for individualized support.
[CAREER GUIDE](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/uw-career-guide.html)

Starting a job search can be overwhelming, but our team has curated resources to give you a strong start and make the process more manageable.

Interview preparation is one of our most popular and effective student services. Use our Career Guide to learn what to expect and how to approach your next interview feeling confident and fully prepared.

After your undergrad, graduate school may be your next step. If you are interested in pursuing a further degree, explore all UW grad school has to offer!
[Graduate School](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html)
Next
### Employers—Let’s Work Together!
At UW, we are proud to support students who are driven, collaborative and emerging leaders in their fields. We firmly believe that each UW alum who lands a new job is making a positive impact in the world. 
That's why we're excited to support employers in connecting with UW students. We can help you engage with soon-to-be graduates and recent alumni who will be valuable assets to your company. Explore how you can build a relationship with ACES to post job openings and internships, register for career fairs, set up on-campus interviews and much more!
[Employer Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/employers/index.html)
## Career counseling
Stepping into your career search with preparation and confidence can make all the difference in your success. Our Career Services team is here to ensure you’re equipped with the resources, tools and expertise needed to navigate the job search process effectively.
From resume building and interview preparation to career counseling and networking opportunities, we offer comprehensive support to help you reach your goals. Don’t miss out—explore all the services and take full advantage of the opportunities available to you.

[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/index.html)[Bremen Whitlock](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/bremenwhitlock.html)[Kris Brewer](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/kbrewer.html)[Laurie Bonini](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/lbonini.html)[Conrad Chavez](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/reds.html)[Jessica Robinson](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/robinson.html)[Rosie McMaster](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/academics/advising/staff/rosiemcmaster.html)
CEPS Advisor Availability
Our office is open during UW business hours, Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. Our office will close occasionally for university or college business.
Generally, you will need to schedule an appointment at least one day in advance. You can request an appointment with your advisor by clicking on their email link below. You will need to check in for your appointment at the front desk kiosk in the Engineering Building Room 2085.
* Please note if you are more than 5 minutes late to your appointment, it will be canceled and you will be asked to sign in as a walk-in. All main campus students must schedule in-person advising appointments.
You can also contact an advisor via email or phone. We strive to answer all emails within 48 business hours; however, there might be a delay in response during peak times. We will only respond to your official UW email address, so be sure you are checking it regularly. We do not offer full advising via email or phone.
You are always welcome to send an email or call if you need assistance. Please be sure to always include your full name, W number, and a full explanation of the nature of your question. Your advisor may still want you to schedule an appointment, but sometimes an email is sufficient for an advisor to provide assistance!
**Newly admitted transfer students:** Please send an email to ceps-advising@uwyo.edu to request advising. You should include your full name, W number, and intended major in your email. Fall transfer students are advised in April, while spring transfer admits are advised in November. However, you should reach out as soon as you are admitted so that your transfer work can be evaluated in a timely manner.
**Newly admitted freshmen students:** Advising for first time students begins with New Student Days. Click here for information. For students who were not able to attend a New Student Days event, advising will begin in June. Watch for an email from your advisor with information on how to schedule an appointment. If you have not received an email by June 15, please send an email to ceps-advising@uwyo.edu and include your full name, W number, and intended major.
Appointment Scheduling Links
Make an appointment with our advising team by clicking on their name below.

  * Kris Brewer
  * Conrad Chavez
  * Rosie McMaster
  * Jessica Robinson
  * Bremen Whitlock

# Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
## College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Electrical Engineering
Electrical engineers design control and communication systems, sensors, displays, machine learning , robots, instruments, speech recognition, computer vision, electronics, motors, power systems, the internet of things—the list goes on and on.
Computer Engineering
Computer engineering is a blend of computer science and electrical engineering. A computer engineering degree consists of both hardware and software courses.
Computer Science
Traditional areas of computer science, such as graphics, software engineering, networks, databases, multimedia, and artificial intelligence, remain strong, with job growth being driven by the fundamental impact of computer science in nearly every industry.
### About Our Department
The Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) Department is committed to excellence in teaching, research, and service. Distinguished faculty conduct world-class research and their instruction is recognized via numerous teaching awards. Rigorous instruction, small class sizes, and extremely competitive tuition guarantee an accessible, challenging, and rewarding experience in EECS.
EECS offers undergraduate degrees in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, and Computer Science. These programs include concentrations in big data, business applications, bio-engineering, and a K-12 endorsement and cybersecurity certificate. QuickStart programs allow top students to earn a MS and BS in a total of five years.
EECS offers MS and PhD programs in Electrical Engineering and in Computer Science. Areas of expertise in EE include: Bio-engineering, Controls, Electrical Energy Systems, Internet of Things, Robotics, Signal Processing and Computer Networks. Areas of expertise in CS include artificial intelligence, computational complexity, cybersecurity, formal methods and theorem proving, Human-centered computing and interactions, 3D User interfaces and graphics. 
_**At the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, we are proud to be a part of this college and University while helping mold the next generation of computer and electrical engineers and scientists.**_

## ACES Student Services
###  Academic Advising 
Our ACES team understands that academic advising is about more than just selecting your courses for the next semester. Thorough academic advising can be a powerful tool to help you explore your passions, set meaningful goals and prepare for your dream career. Our dedicated advisors work with you to provide personalized guidance and connect you to valuable resources that will support your academic and professional journey. This is the perfect opportunity for taking a proactive step toward building your dream future!
[More Advising Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/index.html)
Quick Links to Advising Resources
[Handshake](https://wyoming.joinhandshake.com/login)[Soar](https://www.uwyo.edu/soar/index.html)[Navigate](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html)[Advising FAQs](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/advising-faq.html)[Student Reinstatement](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/students-seeking-reinstatement.html)[Student Success Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/resources/index.html)
###  Career Counseling 
If you're unsure about your major or career fit, schedule an appointment with a career counselor at ACES. Our licensed career counselors help UW students explore their personalities, values, interests and abilities—key steps in finding the right academic and career paths. We’ll guide you in setting goals that align with your values and help you find a career path that feels like the perfect fit. While we don't pretend to have all the answers, we are excited to support you in exploring your options and discovering the path that's best for you.
[Make an Appointment](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-counseling/index.html)
###  Career Services 
ACES Career Services provides comprehensive support to help you find a successful and fulfilling career. Whether you need a resume review, job interview preparation or assistance identifying job and internship opportunities, we're here for you! Our services are available to the entire UW community—from undergrad and graduate students to alumni. UW grads are prepped and ready to create a massive impact in their field and we are proud to help connect those students with their dream job. We are committed to helping you take the next step in your career with confidence.
[Explore More](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/index.html)
## ACES Frequently Asked Questions
The ACES team has compiled a few of our most frequently asked questions to help you out. Don’t see your question here? Check out our full [FAQ page](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/advising-faq.html) or stop by and see us in Knight Hall!
Who does ACES serve? 
ACES is here for all UW students and alumni! Our main mission is supporting student success. Even if we don’t have the answer we can help get you connected with someone who does.
What is Exploratory Studies? 
[Exploratory Studies](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/exploratory-studies.html) isn't a major, but a program to help you explore academic areas that could lead to your ideal degree. Choose from six broad tracks to guide your exploration.
How do I find and connect with my advisor? 
You can find out who your advisor is through your [WyoRecords ](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/?_gl=1*1ngafrs*_gcl_au*NzMwOTk4NjQwLjE3MzkyOTMwNjY.*_ga*MTA4ODMwNDE2MS4xNzM2NzkzMDYx*_ga_DCJG3HESYS*MTc0MTI4NzI0OC44MC4xLjE3NDEyOTA2MDMuNTkuMC4w)account. Scheduling an appointment with them is easily done through the [Navigate](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html) app.
What is academic probation? 
Academic probation occurs when your cumulative GPA falls below 2.0 at the end of the semester. If placed on probation, you will be clearly notified.
What is the process for academic reinstatement? 
If you are interested in seeking academic reinstatement, you will need to follow the six steps to petition for reinstatement. You can learn about each step of the reinstatement process by visiting our [Student Seeking Reinstatement page](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/students-seeking-reinstatement.html).
How do I declare and/or change my major? 
Start by meeting with your current advisor, they will guide you through the proper paperwork. Once that is completed, you will meet with your new department for approval.
### Here to Support the WHOLE Student
Advising • Career • Exploratory Studies is dedicated to student success. We support the whole student, addressing both academic and personal growth. Our staff uses their expertise to help students explore their interests and make academic choices that align with their passions and goals. College is a time for growth and self-discovery. Luckily, you don’t have to navigate it alone!
[Set Up An Appointment](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html)
## Academic Success Services
More Ways We Support Your Success
Step Tutoring  Writing Center  Oral Communication Center  University Counseling Center  Cowboy Coaching 
Step Tutoring 
STEP Tutoring Services are free and available to all UW students. They offer support in a wide range of courses, providing one-on-one instruction from students who have already successfully completed those classes. This is a valuable opportunity to get personalized help and reinforce your understanding of course material.
[STEP Tutoring](https://www.uwyo.edu/step/index.html)
The Writing Center is an incredibly helpful and essential resource for many UW students, offering support throughout the entire writing process. Whether you need help with outlining, improving clarity or proofreading, the Writing Center staff is here to assist you with papers for any course. Their expertise can help strengthen your writing skills and ensure your assignments are clearly conveying the message you are trying to get across.
[Writing Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/writing-center/index.html)
The Oral Communication Center provides support for all aspects of public speaking. Whether you're preparing for class presentations, working on group projects or aiming to reduce public speaking anxiety, the center’s staff is here to help. They offer personalized guidance and practice opportunities to improve your communication skills and boost your confidence when speaking in front of others.
[OCC](https://www.uwyo.edu/cojo/OCC/index.html)
The University Counseling Center offers free, year-round counseling services available to all UW students. They are dedicated to supporting your emotional well-being and providing a safe, confidential space to address any personal challenges you may be facing. Whatever you may be dealing with, their professional staff is here to support you and help you develop skills to support your mental health.
[UW Counseling](https://www.uwyo.edu/ucc/index.html)
Cowboy Coaching is a free peer mentoring program at the UW, available to all students. This service connects you with fellow students who offer valuable guidance, support and advice to help you navigate college life. Whether you need help balancing your academic load with your social life or managing stress and building study skills, Cowboy Coaching provides a supportive, peer-driven resource for success.
[Cowboy Coaching](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/cowboy-coaches/index.html)
Step Tutoring

## More Student Resources
### Make an Appointment
Use the Navigate app to contact your academic advisor, schedule meetings and view your class schedule easily.
[Navigate](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html)
### Job Searching with Handshake
Use Handshake to apply for jobs with local or national companies, schedule interviews and learn about upcoming career events on and off campus.
[Handshake](https://wyoming.joinhandshake.com/login)
### Career Prep
Confidently prepare for your career or grad school with SOAR! With networking events, workshops and internships, SOAR will get you ready for your next step.
[SOAR](https://www.uwyo.edu/soar/index.html)
### Exploratory Studies
Unsure of which major to choose? We get it—many students have been there. That's exactly why UW created Exploratory Studies!
This program isn’t necessarily a major, but it does help you explore academic areas that could lead to your ideal degree. Instead of being labeled “undeclared,” you’ll choose from six broad tracks to guide your journey. As an Exploratory Studies student, you’ll take courses in your track, possibly live with peers in the same area and work closely with an advisor to narrow down your options. It’s a great way to explore your interests without feeling like you're missing out or falling behind.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/exploratory-studies.html)
## How to Change Your Major
Interested in changing your major? This is an exciting decision and one that [many students have made](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/academics-and-career/ok-to-change-majors.html) before you. Start by meeting with your current advisor, who will guide you through the process and explain any requirements, like a minimum GPA, for your new department.  
  
_*Note: your advisor may change after switching majors._
[Career Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/career-events.html)
UW offers job fairs, career skill workshops and opportunities to learn about regional and national events. Stay informed and never miss out by keeping up with our events calendar!
[Job Search Tools](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/job-search.html)
Give yourself a head start in the job search by utilizing the resources, guidance and expertise of our ACES team!
[Student Success Hub](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html)
The UW Student Success and Graduation Hub is your one-stop resource for support in all areas of your academic, emotional and physical well-being during your time at UW.
[Register for Classes](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/registering-for-class/index.html)
Registering for classes in a timely manner and with your advisor's guidance, is essential to staying on track with your degree and setting yourself up for success.
Student Seeking Reinstatement
Students who are seeking reinstatement to the University of Wyoming can find helpful resources and a step-by-step guide through ACES. Be sure to reach out with any questions.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/students-seeking-reinstatement.html)
## Get Connected with ACES
[Make an Appointment](https://www.uwyo.edu/navigate/index.html)
Schedule an appointment via the Navigate app to start accessing our variety of resources.
[Meet Our Staff](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/meet-our-staff/index.html)
Get connected with our friendly and supportive staff!
[Student Success Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/events.html)

# Graduate Degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
The UW Electrical Engineering and Computer Science faculty consists of researchers from top-20 universities developing new applications in rapidly growing technologies such as controlled environment agriculture and alternative energy. Graduate students in EECS are immersed in an environment that is the synergism of deep theory and practical application, as ideas spawned in intellectual exchange with faculty are developed and eventually verified in one of our active [research laboratories](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/_files/doc/eecs-laboratories.pdf) within the department. Opportunities for students to produce scholarly research are augmented with the potential to take part in commercial enterprises established by faculty, further enhancing the graduate experience and establishing invaluable ties to industry.
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)

### Graduate Admissions Information
* * *
Ready to advance your expertise in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science?
Our graduate programs offer cutting-edge research opportunities and specialized curricula designed to prepare you for leadership in a rapidly evolving technological landscape. You'll find detailed information on admission requirements, application procedures, funding opportunities, and program-specific insights. 
Discover how our cutting-edge research, dedicated faculty, and vibrant community can help you achieve your goals. Your future starts here – visit our graduate admissions page today!
  
GRE Test Score is not required for AY 2025-2026 Admissions
[LEarn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/eecs/graduate/admissions.html)
## Paths
Explore our range of Master of Science (MS) options designed to deepen your expertise and our innovative Ph.D. programs that empower you to push the boundaries of knowledge. Discover the perfect program to advance your career and contribute to groundbreaking research.
M.S. Plan A
A Plan A degree is a traditional research-based Master's program that requires the student develop and complete a research project, and to successfully defend a written thesis. Refer to the Master's admissions guidelines for minimum requirements.
M.S. Plan B
The Plan B option replaces the requirement of a formal thesis with a project defense and an increased course load. Consult with your advisor about this option. Refer to the Master's admissions guidelines for minimum requirements.
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering
The University of Wyoming's Doctor of Philosophy in Electrical and Computer Engineering will train students to conduct scientific research on innovative topics using the most current and cutting edge tools and resources.
[More Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/electrical-engineering-phd.html)
Ph.D. in Computer Science
Each doctoral student will have a supervising committee of at least five members appointed. The primary functions of this committee are to suggest coursework, to administer the qualifying, preliminary, and final examinations, and to oversee and evaluate the research of the candidate.
[More Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-science-ms-phd.html)
### QuickStart BS/MS Program
The combined BS/MS program enables especially well-qualified students to be admitted to the MS program during the junior year, allowing a simultaneous pursuit of the BS and MS degrees. BS/MS students may have up to six credit hours count toward both the undergraduate and graduate requirements to reduce the period of study.
Students enrolled in this program gain the advantage of a reduced course workload so that they may devote more time to investigation, thus enhancing the quality of research products and expediting degree completion.
[More Information](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/computer-electrical-engineering-quickstart.html)

WHY UW ENGINEERING AND PHYSICAL SCIENCES?
Want [world-class facilities](https://www.uwyo.edu/ceps/engineering-initiative/facilities.html "world-class facilities ")? A [picturesque campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html "UW tour page ")? A nationally recognized research institution? Small student-to-faculty ratio? This is the place for you. The Engineering Initiative
Thanks to a significant investment from Wyoming state government, a new era has dawned for the University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Physical Sciences (CEPS) – an age that will elevate the college to new heights of excellence in education, research and service. Guided by the Wyoming Governor’s Energy, Engineering, STEM Integration Task Force and CEPS leadership, the Tier-1 Initiative was born in 2012.
The implementation plan of the initiative focuses on the following strategic goals:
  * Excellence in Undergraduate Education
  * World-Class Research and Graduate Education
  * Productive Economic Development through Partnerships
  * K-14 STEM Education


Just the facts
  * 90 percent of our graduates have jobs or go on to graduate programs within six months of graduation.
  * Small-class sizes (average: 28 per) ensure you’ll have the opportunity to participate in hands-on research.
  * Our graduates have gone on to careers with companies like Ford Motor Company, Encana, IBM, AT&T, ConocoPhillips and NASA.
  * Scholarships are available – more than 375 merit-based awards are allocated each year to current students and high school seniors.
  * Nearly 78% of our graduates report a starting salary greater than $60,000 annually, and 89% report a starting salary greater than $50,000 annually.
  * Choose from engineering programs like architectural, chemical, civil, computer, computer science, electrical, energy systems, mechanical and petroleum.
  * Working in collaboration with the UW School of Energy Resources, students can access some of the world’s finest research facilities.


Notable alumni
  * W. Edwards Deming, the father of modern Total Quality Management (TQM), was a 1921 UW graduate in Electrical Engineering.
  * Tom Osborne, an Electrical Engineering graduate from 1957, developed the first hand-held calculator that later became the HP35.
  * General Samuel C. Phillips, who earned a UW engineering degree in 1942, served NASA as the Apollo Manned Lunar Landing Program Director.
  * H. David Reed, a 1964 graduate in Mechanical Engineering, was a member of the mission control team that safely returned the crew of the damaged Apollo 13 to Earth.
  * Mike Sullivan, former U.S. Ambassador to Ireland and Governor of the State of Wyoming from 1986-1994, is a 1961 UW graduate in Petroleum Engineering.
