Laramie Campus
College of Agriculture, Life Sciences and Natural Resources
Passionate about agriculture and communication? UW’s B.S. in agricultural communications blends both, preparing students for careers in marketing, media, sales and public relations. Students take courses in ag economics, animal science and journalism while developing strong advocacy skills.

Agricultural Economics

College of Agriculture, Life Sciences and Natural Resources

# UW Summer Camps and Programs
## Exciting Learning Opportunities for K-12 Students!
The University of Wyoming offers a wide variety of summer camps and programs designed for students from elementary through high school, as well as opportunities for educators. From exploring the arts through music and textiles to diving into STEM fields and athletic skills, there’s something for everyone. Our camps provide hands-on experiences, expert instruction and a chance to explore new interests or strengthen existing talents. Whether you’re looking to ignite a passion for science, improve athletic abilities, or express creativity, UW’s summer programs offer the perfect environment for learning and growth.

## Events for PROSPECTIVE students
If you're a high school junior or senior interested in learning more about the University of Wyoming, we invite you to explore our upcoming admission events! These events are a great opportunity to dive into the admissions process, discover what UW has to offer and get a feel for campus life. You'll have the chance to tour our beautiful campus, meet current students and hear from admissions staff—all in a fun and informative setting. Whether you’re already thinking about applying or just curious to learn more, these events are designed to help you make an informed decision about your future at UW.
[Admissions Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)

# Next Steps for Admitted Students
## Your Path to Becoming a Cowboy
If you’ve already applied and been accepted to the University of Wyoming—congratulations! You’re on your way, but there are a few important steps to take next. Start by activating your WyoWeb account, your hub for everything from class registration to financial aid. Set up your username and password to access your personalized checklist in WyoRecords. Then, confirm your enrollment by submitting your $300 deposit by May 1 to secure your place—refundable until May 2. If admitted after May 1, submit your deposit within three weeks (non-refundable). Once confirmed, you're ready to proceed with the next steps to prepare for your arrival on campus!
[Confirm Enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html#confirm)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Next Steps to Enroll](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/nextsteps.html)
[Admission With Support](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/admission-with-support.html)
[Start at a WY Community College](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/start-at-wy-cc.html)
[Defer your Enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/defer-enrollment.html)
## You've Confirmed Enrollment - Your Next Steps
Previous
### Check Your UW Email
Stay updated on housing, financial aid, class registration and events! Check your UW email via regularly—it’s how UW will contact you with important info.
[Access Email](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/)
### Explore First Year Experience
Start strong at UW with programs that support your academic success and help you build community from day one. FYE sets you up for a successful transition to college life.
[Explore FYE](https://www.uwyo.edu/fye/index.html)
### Download Student Apps
Once you’ve confirmed your enrollment, download essential student apps to your smartphone. These apps will help with course access, tutoring and more. Get started today!
[Get the Apps](https://www.uwyo.edu/step/apps.html)
### Submit Your FASFA
File your FAFSA starting October 1 to qualify for financial aid like grants, loans and work-study. Submit by January 1 for priority consideration.
[Apply for Aid](https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa)
### Find Scholarships
UW offers automatic and competitive scholarships based on merit and financial need. Explore available awards and apply early to maximize your aid!
[Scholarship Info](https://uwyo.academicworks.com/)
### Apply for Housing
First-year students must live on campus. Complete your housing contract in WyoWeb, select preferences and find a roommate. Contracts open late December!
[Explore Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/index.html)
### Math Placement Exam
Your ACT/SAT scores determine math placement. To qualify for a higher-level course, take the online Math Placement Exam (MPE).
[Take the MPE](https://www.uwyo.edu/mathstats/math-placement/index.html)
### Submit Final Transcripts
After graduation, UW requires your official final high school transcript. Have your school send it along with new test scores, AP/IB test results and dual enrollment directly to UW Admissions.
### Immunization Requirements
Meet UW’s health and immunization requirements before arriving. Submit proof of required vaccines and complete any necessary medical forms before move-in.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/shser/mmr-requirement.html)
### Check Your UW Email
Stay updated on housing, financial aid, class registration and events! Check your UW email via regularly—it’s how UW will contact you with important info.

### Explore First Year Experience

[Explore FYE](https://www.uwyo.edu/fye/index.html)
### Download Student Apps
Once you’ve confirmed your enrollment, download essential student apps to your smartphone. These apps will help with course access, tutoring and more. Get started today!
[Get the Apps](https://www.uwyo.edu/step/apps.html)
### Submit Your FASFA
File your FAFSA starting October 1 to qualify for financial aid like grants, loans and work-study. Submit by January 1 for priority consideration.
[Apply for Aid](https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa)
### Find Scholarships
UW offers automatic and competitive scholarships based on merit and financial need. Explore available awards and apply early to maximize your aid!
[Scholarship Info](https://uwyo.academicworks.com/)
### Apply for Housing
First-year students must live on campus. Complete your housing contract in WyoWeb, select preferences and find a roommate. Contracts open late December!
[Explore Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/index.html)
### Math Placement Exam
Your ACT/SAT scores determine math placement. To qualify for a higher-level course, take the online Math Placement Exam (MPE).

### Submit Final Transcripts

Next
### Get Ready for Life at UW
Your UW journey starts with onboarding events designed just for you. Join us for New Student Day, dive into key topics through the Summer Webinar Series and gear up for college life at Saddle Up. These experiences help you feel confident, connected and ready for your first semester.
[Start onboarding](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/onboarding.html)
## Signing Day Celebration
Celebrate your commitment to the University of Wyoming! Join the nationwide event by sharing your photos on social media. Tag our Facebook and Instagram with #UWyoBound and #TheWorldNeedsMoreCowboys to celebrate with us!
Watch for an email and mailer in the spring with more event details and access to our interactive social media toolkit to help you share your journey.
[Join In](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/signing-day.html)

## Online Degrees & Certification Options
###  Online Degrees 
The University of Wyoming proudly offers a wide range of online degree programs, providing students with the opportunity to pursue bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees from our renowned institution. Whether you’re seeking to advance your career or explore new academic horizons, you can be confident that you’ll receive the same high-quality education that UW is known for.
Explore the diverse online degree options available to you and discover how these programs can open doors to new opportunities, both academically and professionally.
[Online Degree Options](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/index.html)
###  Certification and Licensure 
UW offers a variety of online programs that help you earn licensure or certification in your chosen field. From nursing to land surveying and everything in between, we provide the resources and programs you need. Whether you're looking to renew your current license or pursue a new certification to advance your career, we’re here to help you find a program that fits your needs and support you each step of the way. Explore our full range of certificate and licensure programs today to find the perfect fit for your professional goals!
[Certificates & Licensure Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/certificates.html)
###  Professional Development 
Professional development is essential for advancing your career and becoming a leader in your field. UW Online and Continuing Education collaborates with various UW colleges and departments to provide a range of professional development programs. These opportunities are designed to help you gain valuable skills and earn credit through external agencies you may be working with.
Whether you're looking to enhance your expertise or meet specific career requirements, explore how UW’s professional development programs can help you reach your goals and advance your career.
[Professional Development Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/registrar/sponsored-courses/index.html)
[Student Success Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/student-resources/student-success-center.html)
Familiarize yourself with the resources and tools available to help online students succeed every step of the way from course registration to graduation.
[Technology Support](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/student-resources/it-support.html)
Reliable technology is essential for online students. UW’s expert IT team is here to help you navigate any technology issues that may come your way.
[Disablity Support Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/student-resources/health-services.html)
UW is committed to a positive learning environment no matter where you study. Our Disability Support Services team ensures all students' needs are met and improves educational accessibility.
### Resources for Online Students
At UW, we are committed to supporting all of our students, whether they are on campus or studying remotely. Our student success resources are available to everyone, ensuring that online students never feel isolated. From academic advising to tutoring and peer support, we provide the tools and services you need to succeed. We understand that pursuing an online degree can present unique challenges, and we’re here to help you navigate them. Take advantage of the resources available to you and set yourself up for academic success!
[Explore Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/student-resources/index.html)

## Explore Our Online Accredited Degree & Certification Programs
Select an Area of Study
Online Bachelor’s Degrees  Online Master’s Degrees  Online Doctoral Degrees  Certificates and Licensure  Online Course Offerings 
Online Bachelor’s Degrees 
Pursuing an online bachelor’s degree is a great way to achieve your academic and career goals with the flexibility you need. Whether you prefer a fully online program, asynchronous or a hybrid option, UW Online offers a range of choices to fit your schedule and learning style. Explore our programs and find the perfect fit for your needs!
[View Bachelor's Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/bachelor.html)
Explore UW Online’s master’s degree options in your field, available through both fully online and hybrid programs. These rigorous and engaging programs are designed to help you advance your career, offering flexibility without compromising on academic quality. Take the next step in your professional journey with a degree that fits your goals and lifestyle.
[Online Master's Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/master.html)
The University of Wyoming offers a variety of doctoral degree options, including fully online and hybrid formats. Whether you're looking for flexibility or a blend of in-person and online learning, UW provides programs that cater to your academic and professional goals. Explore the paths to find the option that will be the best fit for you.
[Search Doctorate Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/doctoral.html)
UW offers a range of online programs for licensure and certification across a wide variety of professional fields. Students can take the necessary continued learning requirements to renew a license or pursue a new certification. UW Online provides the resources and support to help you advance your career and find the program that best fits your needs.
[Find a Certificate](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/programs/certificates.html)
You don’t have to pursue a full degree to take advantage of UW Online. We offer a variety of individual online classes online, making it easier for you to stay on track with your degree or simply gain new skills while creating a flexible schedule. Explore the available courses and work with your advisor to find the best options that fit your academic goals and personal commitments.
[Find an Online Course](https://www.uwyo.edu/online/courses/index.html)
Online Bachelor’s Degrees 
### Select an Area of Study

### Hybrid or Fully Online? You Have Options!
UW is a leader in offering and expanding top-tier education. Our online course and degree options are about making learning more accessible and flexible, opening doors to a variety of opportunities. Whether you choose to pursue a fully online degree, or create a hybrid schedule with both online and in-person classes, the options are endless. At UW, we offer a variety of bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral degrees online, allowing you to find the path that best fits your life. Whatever your academic goals, we’re here to help you achieve them on your terms. Find a path that works for you and keep pursuing those dreams!

[Learn More](https://www.hlcommission.org/mark-of-accreditation-status-verification?104108099+118097108105100097116105111110+108111103111046112110103+104116116112115058047047119119119046117119121111046101100117047&UGxEQk3X8u8QMkuPIANEOVaVqkHKfm7H)
UW’s online programs are fully accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, ensuring a high-quality education that meets rigorous academic standards. Choose UW Online and earn your degree with confidence and credibility!
## Convenient, High-Quality Education
The University of Wyoming has always been dedicated to providing top-tier education to as many students as possible. Our online programs and courses make higher education accessible, flexible and convenient, allowing you to pursue your academic goals from anywhere, on your schedule.

# Deferring Enrollment
## Deciding If Deferment is Right for You
The University of Wyoming is committed to supporting students in achieving their educational goals and we recognize that life events may require adjustments to those plans. That is exactly why UW offers students the option to defer enrollment if necessary. Students may choose deferment for various reasons, including personal circumstances, financial challenges or military service commitments. Deferring enrollment ensures students have the opportunity to address their needs and begin their studies when they are ready and able to commit to their academic journey.
[Submit a Deferral Request](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Deferment)

## Steps for Deferment
Students wishing to defer enrollment at the University of Wyoming must be admitted for the current or upcoming semester. To begin the process, communicate with your advisor to discuss your options. If you decide to move forward with deferral, submit a [deferral request form](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/leads/apex/ERx_Forms__PageMaker?pageId=Deferment). Then, confirm the deferral with the admissions office. 
This is an important decision. UW [admissions reps](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html) can provide valuable guidance.
## Deferment FAQs
Each student who chooses deferment has their own circumstances and reason for making that choice. While the circumstances may be unique, there are a few questions that frequently pop up with students considering deferring their enrollment.
When is the deadline to defer enrollment? 
Students must complete the deferment process _**prior**_ to the first day of classes for which they were originally admitted.
How long can I defer enrollment? 
Students may choose to defer their enrollment for up to one academic year.
Do I have to reapply to UW after deferment? 
Students may only defer enrollment _**one time**_ before needing to reapply.
Does deferment impact financial aid and scholarships? 
Deferring enrollment does not guarantee [scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html) or [financial aid](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/applying-for-financial-aid/index.html) opportunities that may have been offered to you. Students must apply for these opportunities again based on their new entry term.
What happens to my enrollment deposit after deferment? 
Students will forfeit any enrollment deposit paid and not refunded prior to the published deadlines for the semester for which they were originally admitted.
How do I re-enroll after deferment? 
Students ready to re-enroll after deferment are required to provide final, official transcripts from any schools attended since last applying for admission. 
What information must be disclosed after deferment? 
Students wishing to re-enroll are required to notify the Admissions Office, in writing, regarding felony and/or behavioral suspensions which occurred since last applying for admission.
Who to contact with further questions? 
Reach out to UW Office of Admissions, for any further questions regarding deferred enrollment, a deferral request or steps to enrolling after deferment.

# Housing & Dining at UW
Where you sleep, eat and thrive!
Living on campus at the University of Wyoming is more than just convenience. It's part of what makes your college experience complete. From our residence halls to campus apartments, UW student housing puts you close to classes, dining and everything happening on campus. With flexible meal plans, welcoming spaces and built-in support, you’ll find the perfect balance of independence and connection as you make UW your home.

## Your Living and Dining Options at UW
###  Residence Halls 
Living in a residence hall is a big part of the UW experience. You'll live close to classes, dining and friends. The halls offer a mix of traditional double, suite style and single rooms, as well as communities focused on academics, leadership and more. communities focused on academics, leadership and more.
[Explore the Halls](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/index.html "UW Residence Halls")
Housing Quick Links
[Rates](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/rates.html#halls "UW Housing Application")[Apply for Housing](https://uwyo.starrezhousing.com/StarRezPortalX "UW Housing Application")[Purchase a Storage Locker](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/storage-lockers.html "UW locker storage options")[Winter & Summer Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/flexible-housing.html "Flexible housing options at UW")[Honors Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/tobin-house.html "Honors Housing Information at UW")[Policies & Procedures](https://issuu.com/uwyorlds/docs/policies_procedures?fr=xKAE9_zU1NQ)[Summer Camps and Conferences](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/conferences/index.html)[FAQ](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html#faq)

Learn more about this UW policy and see if you qualify to request an exemption.
###  Apartment Living 
Apartments at UW give you a more independent lifestyle while still being part of the university community. They’re a great fit for upperclassmen, graduate students, students with families, or anyone looking for extra space and privacy. Apartments are managed just like regular housing with maintenance services and easy access to campus resources.
[Check out the apartments](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/uw-apartments/index.html "UW Residence Halls")

No matter where you live on campus, you’ll have easy access to dining. From quick bites to full meals, your plan works at our dining center, the Wyoming Union, coffee shops and convenience stores on campus. Choose a plan that fits your schedule and add Dining Dollars for even more flexibility.

## Mcintyre hall to south hall move
**Fall to Spring Semester Transition**
_December 2025 - January 2026_
As McIntyre Hall closes at the end of the Fall 2025 semester, **524 students** (plus **18 Resident Assistants**) will transition to the newly constructed **South Hall**. The University of Wyoming has organized a structured moving process to reduce student stress and ensure a smooth, efficient, and safe transition during **Winter Break**. 
A professional moving company will handle the transport of student belongings. **Students are responsible for packing their own items** before leaving for break. **Staff will assist with labeling** items to ensure all belongings are marked with the correct South Hall room assignment. 
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/_files/pdfs/mctosouth.pdf)
Do I need to be present during the move in January 
No. Your items will be placed in your South Hall room before your return. 
Can I use my own boxes or suitcases? 
Yes, if they are secure and in good condition. 
What if I forget to check out properly? 
Your items will **not** be moved. You will be responsible for moving everything yourself in January. 
What happens if something is damaged or lost? 
UW and the moving company are **not liable** for any damage/loss. You must sign a waiver before participating. 
Can I move everything myself instead? 
Yes, but you will be responsible for transport in January and must vacate McIntyre Hall by **January 19**. 
Will I be able to access McIntyre after I move out? 
No. McIntyre Hall access is not available over winter break. If dual hall student access is needed to complete the move, it will be granted between the dates of January 15-19. Access to McIntyre Hall ends at **8:00 p.m. on January 19, 2026.**
## Have Questions? We’ve Got Answers
Living and dining on campus comes with a lot of new experiences. Whether you're wondering what to bring, how meal plans work or where to do laundry, we’re here to help. Browse some of our most common questions below.
What should I bring to my residence hall? 
We recommend bringing basics like bedding, toiletries, a desk lamp and a few things that make your space feel like home. View our [move-in checklist](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/move-in/preparing-for-move-in.html "UW Move-in Checklist") for details on what to bring to campus and what UW provides.
Can I choose my own roommate? 
Yes! You can request a [roommate](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/roommates.html "UW roommate information") when you apply for housing. If you don’t have someone in mind, we’ll match you with another student based on your preferences.
Is laundry available on campus? 
Yes. Every hall and apartment on campus has laundry access. [Learn more about laundry and vending services](https://www.uwyo.edu/enterprises/vending-services.html "UW laundry and vending service information") at UW.
Are there dining options for special diets? 
Yes. We accommodate a variety of diets and food intolerance. Whether you have food allergies, food sensitivities, gluten intolerance, are following a vegan/vegetarian diet, or have other dietary restrictions and/or medical needs, UW Dining is here to help you make safe and delicious choices. Schedule a consultation with our campus nutritionist.
What if I need to move out early? 
  * UW Apartment residents need to submit an [Intent to Vacate Form](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8q3tlsRrZteknv8) to indicate when they are moving out – this needs to be completed 60 days in advance to avoid additional fees. The completion of this form does _not_ release a leaseholder from the terms of their lease.  
  

  * All students living in the residence halls sign a [housing contact](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/_files/pdfs/20252026housingdiningservicescontractfinal.pdf) in the application process. Under special circumstances a contract release may be considered. See the Residence Coordinator of your building for information on the contract release process.


Who do I contact if something needs fixed in my room or apartment? 
If something is not working correctly or is broken, it is important that you file a request to have it fixed right away to prevent further damage. [Submit a Work Order Request](https://login.myschoolbuilding.com/msb?acctNum=1727114240&productID=MD "Submit a campus work order") and we'll be in touch as soon as possible.
### Life on Campus Start Here
Living at UW means more than just having a place to sleep. It's about finding your people, learning independence and having support close by. You’ll live near your classes, dining and campus events, with staff and resources ready to help you thrive. Want a sneak peek? Check out our virtual tour to see where you might live, eat and hang out.
  
[UW Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html "Start UW's online virtual tour")
## What’s Included in On-Campus Living?
Select an Option
Furnished Residence Halls Rooms  Central Campus Location  Internet & Tech Support  Laundry & Vending Services  Community Living & Spaces  Campus Safety & Security 
Furnished Residence Halls Rooms 
Each residence hall room includes a bed, desk, chair and dresser so you can move in and get settled right away. Many of our [apartments](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/uw-apartments/index.html "UW campus apartments") also come furnished!
[See the Halls](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/index.html "UW Residence Halls")
Living at UW puts you close to popular on-campus dining spots like Panda Express®, Chick-fil-A®, Rendezvous Café and more. Whether you’re craving something quick or looking for a place to meet up with friends, campus dining has you covered.
[Dining Locations](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/dining/dining-hours.html "UW Retail Dining Locatons")
Enjoy high-speed internet and on-campus Wi-Fi. Need help? Campus IT support can help with tech issues, device setup and more.
[Tech Support](https://www.uwyo.edu/infotech/ "UW Campus Tech Support")
Washers and dryers are located in every hall so you can do laundry without leaving the building. All our apartments offer laundry with some offering full hookups for in-unit laundry.
[Laundry Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/enterprises/vending-services.html "UW Laundry & Vending Services")
Hang out in lounges, use shared kitchens or join events and programs hosted by Residence Life staff.
[RESIDENCE LIFE TEAM](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/residence-life/index.html "UW Residence Life")
All UW residence halls require keycard access. Campus police and hall staff are available 24/7 for added peace of mind, along with emergency call boxes located throughout campus.
[Campus Safety](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/campus-safety.html "UW Campus Safety information")
Furnished Residence Halls Rooms

# International Student Admissions
## Start Your Journey at the University of Wyoming
Welcome to the University of Wyoming! We’re excited that you’re considering joining our community of international students. Here, you'll find everything you need to navigate the admissions process, from application requirements to visa guidance and scholarship opportunities. Whether you're a first-year, transfer, or graduate student, we’re here to support you every step of the way. Explore the resources below to start your journey at UW, where academic excellence meets adventure in the heart of the American West!
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[First-Year International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-first-year.html)
[Graduate International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html)
[Transfer International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-transfer.html)
[English Proficiency](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/english-alternatives.html)
## Find Your Admissions Path
### First-Year Undergraduate
Start your college journey at UW! Learn about admission requirements, deadlines and how to apply as a first-year international student.
[First-Year Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-first-year.html)
### Transfer
Continue your studies at UW! Find out how to transfer credits, meet admission requirements and take the next step in your academic journey.
[Transfer Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-transfer.html)
### Graduate
Take your education further with a graduate degree at UW. Explore admission criteria, program options and the application process for international students.
[Graduate Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html)
### Explore the UW Experience
Discover what makes the University of Wyoming a great place for international students! Our International Student Viewbook offers a closer look at academics, campus life and student support, along with the vibrant community and stunning surroundings that make UW unique. Learn about the resources available to help you succeed, explore research and career opportunities and see what life is like in Wyoming. From admissions to graduation, UW is here to support your journey every step of the way.
[View Lookbook](https://issuu.com/uwyo/docs/international_viewbook)
## Support for international Students
The International Students and Scholars (ISS) office at the University of Wyoming is dedicated to supporting international students throughout their journey. From immigration advice for visa holders to cultural programs and student resources, ISS provides guidance to help you navigate life at UW. Whether you need assistance with visas, employment authorization, or adjusting to a new environment, ISS is here to help ensure a smooth and successful experience.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/iss/index.html)
## Contact Us
### UW Office of Admissions
Knight Hall
  * Room 150
  * 1000 E. University Ave
  * Laramie, WY 82071
  * Dept. 3435
  * Toll Free: (800) 342-5996
  * Email: admissions@uwyo.edu
  * Phone: [(307) 766-5160](tel:307-766-5160)
  * [UW Student Blog](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/index.html)


The University of Wyoming has earned its Research Level 1 (R1) status from the Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education, placing Wyoming's only four-year university with the [top research universities](https://www.uwyo.edu/research/index.html) in the United States.
## Curious about what a college in the U.S. has to offer?

# Graduate Student Admissions
## Your Future Awaits!
The University of Wyoming offers a wide range of graduate programs that empower students to advance their education and personal growth. Our graduate programs provides exceptional opportunities for students to explore diverse fields of study, engage in cutting-edge research and develop their professional skills.
At UW, you'll benefit from a supportive academic community, access to state-of-the-art resources and personalized guidance from faculty. Whether you’re pursuing a master's, doctoral or certificate program, UW offers the tools you need to succeed and make an impact in your field. Join us and take the next step toward your future!
[Apply Today!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)

### Building Your Future at UW!
Attending graduate school at the University of Wyoming means stepping into a world of limitless possibilities. With a vast array of graduate programs across diverse disciplines, UW provides students with the tools to explore their passions, innovate and excel. Our strong research focus, combined with access to advanced facilities and resources, ensures our graduate students are equipped to push boundaries and shape the future. At UW, your academic journey is not just about earning a degree—it's about creating a legacy beyond yourself.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/index.html)
## Graduate Admission Requirements
**Completed Online Application | Completed Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent | 3.00 GPA**
Along with these prerequisites, each academic department may have additional criteria, such as standardized test scores or letters of recommendation. Prospective students should consult their respective department before applying.
International Grad Students
Each graduate program has its own requirements that all students must fulfill, there are some additional [requirements that all international graduate students must complete](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html) including providing proof of English Proficiency, proof of financial support and a copy of your passport. 
Pharmacy & Law School
Some University of Wyoming programs follow unique application processes. The [College of Law](https://www.uwyo.edu/law/admissions/index.html) has its own admissions steps, with detailed information and resources available for prospective students. Similarly, the [School of Pharmacy](https://www.uwyo.edu/pharmacy/doctor-of-pharmacy-program/admissions.html) outlines a separate process and provides guidance on program options and how to apply.
## Admitted? Next Steps!

### Graduate Assistantships
Many graduate programs at the University of Wyoming offer graduate assistantships to help fund your education. Responsibilities and stipends for each assistantship vary, so it's important to explore the specific opportunities within your program. These positions can include teaching, research or other roles that align with your academic focus.
  
In addition to financial support, graduate assistantships provide invaluable hands-on experience, helping you gain practical skills, expand your professional network and enhance your resume. It’s a great way to grow both academically and professionally! Also, be sure to fully explore financial aid and scholarship opportunities available to grad students.
[Explore Assistantships](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/enrolled-students/financial-assistance/index.html)
## UW Grad School Beyond the Numbers
When you choose to further your education at UW, you’re investing in yourself. UW graduate school offers the opportunity to pursue your passions and make a lasting impact. With diverse programs and dedicated mentors, you’ll receive the support needed to thrive academically and professionally. At UW, you’ll be empowered to shape the future in your field and beyond.
2,700
number of graduate students enrolled at UW.
44%
percent of graduate students with an assistantship.
90+
number of graduate programs offered at UW.
[New Student Checklist](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/enrolled-students/new-students.html)
Preparing for grad school can feel overwhelming. To help, we've gathered key resources and reminders for newly accepted UW grad students, ensuring you’re set to succeed as you continue to pursue your education.
[Grad Student Orientation](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/enrolled-students/index.html)
UW offers a Graduate Assistant Teaching & Learning Symposium. This program is designed to equip grad assistants with the tools they need to succeed in their teaching roles and effectively engage their students.
[Grad Student Success](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwgrad/enrolled-students/gradsuccess.html)
We understand that graduate students have unique needs and responsibilities. Our Graduate Student Success team is here to help you balance your graduate work and find success as you progress in your program!
[Get in Touch](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
Meet with an admissions rep and get your questions answered or request more information about our graduate programs to help you start off on the right foot. 
A Closer Look at Graduate Life at UW
From degree options to fast facts, the UW Graduate Viewbook gives you a snapshot of what’s possible here. Explore programs, research opportunities, funding options, and what makes UW a standout choice for graduate study.
[EXPLORE ViewBook](https://issuu.com/uwyo/docs/uwyo_graduate_education_view_book)

## Why The University of Wyoming?
###  Strong Academics 
The University of Wyoming offers more than 200 areas of study, giving students the opportunity to explore diverse fields and discover their true passions. At UW, we believe in empowering students to pursue their interests with purpose and dedication. Our university's size allows for unique advantages, including more opportunities for hands-on learning, in-depth research experiences and closer connections with faculty members. This student-centered approach to education is a cornerstone of UW. It empowers our students to prepare for success and make an impact that extends far beyond our campus.
[Explore Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)  
  

[Student Success Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html)
Explore resources to support your academic journey.
###  Affordable 
“We value access to an affordable, high-quality education.” This is the very first line of our [Values and Propositions](https://www.uwyo.edu/strategic-plan/value-statements.html) because we wholeheartedly stand by this sentiment. We know that Wyoming is full of hardworking and driven individuals who can have an immense impact on making their community, their state, and the world a far better place. At UW, we are committed to breaking down financial barriers by offering competitive tuition rates, generous scholarships and financial aid options.
[Explore Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
[Estimate Your Cost of Attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html)
We factor it all in to give you peace of mind.
###  No Place Like UW 
The University of Wyoming campus and surrounding community is simply unmatched. Your UW experience goes far beyond the classroom—think hiking, skiing, fishing and camping in [world-class outdoor spaces](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/student-life/top-10-laramie.html). And when it’s time to unwind, you’ll find [one of the best downtowns](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html) in the country (seriously—Laramie’s award-winning Main Street Alliance proves it).
[Explore UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/index.html)
Visit UW for Yourself
[Schedule a Weekday Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/index.html)[Learn About Walk-In Tours](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/weekday-visits/daily-drop-in.html)[Experience our Virtual Tour](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/virtualtour.html)[Join us for an Event](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
[Plan Your UW Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)   

From parking to lodging partners, everything you need for a great visit. 
## Discover the Full UW Experience
Admission to the University of Wyoming opens doors academically and beyond. Choosing the right university is a big decision and our admissions office is here to provide all the information you need to feel confident in choosing UW!
Hear from UW Students 
UW [Student Blogs](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/index.html) are your way to get firsthand insight into campus life at the University of Wyoming. Hear from your peers and learn about all UW has to offer.
Explore Success Resources 
Discover the many ways UW [supports students](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html), from academic resources to personal wellness resources. We're committed to helping you thrive both in and out of the classroom!
Browse UW's Colleges & Schools 
Get to know the Colleges and Schools that shape the University of Wyoming. [Explore the full list](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/colleges.html) to see how each one contributes to UW's academic community and student experience. 
### The World Needs More Cowboys!
At the UW, our students embody Poke Pride and what it means to be a Cowboy. UW is a symbol of leadership, innovation and determination. In the classroom, on the field or in the community, UW students are shaping the future and making an impact. Cowboys are; leaders in their field, problem solvers, innovators, changemakers in their communities, builders of the future and dedicated to excellence.
Welcome the next generation of Cowboys to UW!
[Explore Cowboy Excellence](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/areas-of-excellence.html)

# Concurrent Enrollment Program
## High School Guests Can Earn UW Credits
The Concurrent Enrollment Program at the University of Wyoming allows eligible high school students to take university-level courses and earn college credit while still in high school. This opportunity provides students with a chance to experience the rigor of higher education while developing academic skills and confidence. By earning college credit early, these high school students can lighten their future course load, save on tuition and better prepare for the next step in their academic career.
[APPLY now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[High School Guests](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
[Military & Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)
[Second Bachelor Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/second-bachelors.html)
Non-Degree Seeking Students
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)[Undergraduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html)[Graduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html)
## Requirements for Concurrent Enrollment
High school students interested in this program must meet several requirements to ensure they’re prepared for university-level coursework while balancing their high school responsibilities.  
**Requirements:**
  * Current high school junior or senior
  * Submit an official high school transcript with an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher
  * Written letter of recommendation from high school principal or counselor
  * Submit ACT or SAT scores (if available)


## Concurrent Enrollment FAQs
UW’s concurrent enrollment program offers valuable experience for high school students. To determine if it’s the right fit, talk with your guidance counselor or a [UW admissions counselor](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html). Be sure to check out our frequently asked questions for more information.
How do I apply? 
Interested high school students will submit their [online application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) through the UW portal as a Non-Degree Seeking Undergraduate Student.
When do I apply? 
Admittance to UW happens on a rolling basis, meaning applications are accepted at any time. However, you will want to be sure [your application is submitted](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html) prior to UW classes starting for the semester.
Where do I send my official transcript? 
Official transcripts need to be sent to the University of Wyoming Office of Admissions from your high school. Be sure to talk to your high school counselor about this requirement.
Any other documentation I need to submit? 
High school students who are admitted into the concurrent enrollment program will need to submit a copy of their Immunization Records to [Student Health Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/shser/mmr-requirement.html).
Do I have to have an ACT or SAT score? 
An ACT and/or SAT score is not required for admission to this program. However, if you have taken either test, it is helpful to submit your score to demonstrate your readiness for the program.
Will I earn actual college credits? 
Yes! Concurrent enrolled high school students will be held to the same academic standard, required to do the same work and able to earn the same credits on their college transcript.
Learn more about the differences between high school and college. 
Hear from UW students! This [student blog](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/academics-and-career/high-school-vs-college.html) breaks down the key differences between high school and college to help prepare incoming students.

# Second Bachelor's Degree Admissions
## Undergraduates Pursuing Another Degree
The University of Wyoming is dedicated to the lifelong pursuit of education. Whether you’re seeking a second bachelor’s degree to switch careers, deepen your expertise or expand your academic horizons, we are here to support you every step of the way. Our programs offer flexibility and personalized guidance, ensuring you can successfully navigate your educational journey. 
[Apply Now!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[High School Guests](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
[Military & Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)
[Second Bachelor Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/second-bachelors.html)
Non-Degree Seeking Students
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)[Undergraduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html)[Graduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html)
## How to Apply
Students who completed your first bachelor's degree at UW and have not attended any other institutions:
  * Fill out the [online application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) as a “returning student.”


Students who completed your first bachelor's degree from another institution or graduated from UW and have since taken courses at another institution:
  * Fill out the [online application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) as a “transfer student.”
  * Pay the $40 application fee.
  * Send all other official transcripts sent to the UW.


## Second Bachelor’s Degree FAQs
A second bachelor’s degree can unlock new career opportunities and broaden your academic horizons. We are here to provide all the information and support you need to successfully navigate this exciting next step in your educational journey.
Who is eligible for a second bachelor’s degree? 
To be eligible for a second bachelor’s degree, you must provide proof of your first bachelor’s degree, have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.00 and complete the application process.
Who is my advisor for my second bachelor’s degree? 
Once admitted to UW, you can find your advisor’s name and contact information in the WyoRecords section of your [WyoWeb](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/).
Is a second bachelor’s degree the same as a graduate degree? 
A second bachelor’s degree and a graduate degree are separate. Coursework from a second bachelor’s cannot count toward a graduate degree. If interested, learn more about pursuing a [graduate degree](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html).
Can I still access financial aid and scholarship opportunities? 
Yes, students working towards their second bachelor’s are still eligible for [financial aid and scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/index.html). You will need to reapply for these opportunities.
I’ve been admitted! What are the next steps? 
Fantastic! Once you have been admitted, you will want to visit our [Next Steps for Admitted Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html) page and, of course, give yourself a little time to celebrate this exciting next step!

### Get Started With WyoWeb
WyoWeb is your personal student portal at the University of Wyoming. From confirming your enrollment to registering for classes and managing financial aid, this account will be your go-to resource throughout your time at UW. Before you can move forward, you’ll need to log in for the first time. Watch the video to learn how to access your account and get started!
[WyoWeb](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/)
## Steps to Confirm Your Enrollment
Confirming your enrollment is the first step toward joining the University of Wyoming. Follow these four simple steps to secure your place, access vital resources and prepare for the exciting journey ahead. By following these steps, you'll be well-prepared to start your academic journey at UW.
Step 1
Visit [WyoWeb](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/) to begin. Click "Obtain Username and Initial Password" and enter your last name, date of birth and W# (found in your admission letter). Your username and initial password will appear on the screen; note them down securely.
Step 2
Return to [WyoWeb](https://wyoweb.uwyo.edu/) and click "Students" under the WyoRecords section. Log in using the credentials obtained in Step 1. Once logged in, you'll be prompted to change your password for enhanced security.
Step 3
After logging in, navigate to the "Confirm Enrollment" section. For first-year students entering in the fall, a $300 enrollment deposit is due by May 1 at 11:59 p.m. MDT. Transfer students have varying deadlines based on their entry term. This deposit secures your place in the incoming class and is non-refundable after the specified deadlines.
Step 4
Once your enrollment is confirmed, WyoRecords will present additional tasks such as applying for housing, reviewing financial aid and taking placement exams. Completing these tasks ensures a smooth transition to UW.
## Key Actions to Complete
[FAFSA](https://studentaid.gov/)
Complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) to be eligible for financial aid.
[Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html)
Apply for WyoScholarships by May 1 to claim any financial awards and UW-specific scholarships.
[Housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/residence-halls/housing-contract.html)
Apply for on-campus housing and choose your meal plan through WyoRecords once enrollment is confirmed.
### Onboarding Made Easy
Prepare for your academic journey at the University of Wyoming by engaging in our comprehensive new student onboarding program. This includes attending a New Student Day event in the spring, participating in our Summer Webinar Series and joining Saddle Up—a mandatory college introductory course for all incoming freshmen. These activities are designed to familiarize you with campus resources, connect you with peers and equip you for college life.
[Get Started](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/onboarding.html)
[New Student Days](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html)
New Student Days are events held each spring to help you prepare for college. You’ll meet other incoming students, learn about campus life and get familiar with UW resources to ensure a smooth transition.
[Saddle Up](https://www.uwyo.edu/saddle-up/index.html)
Saddle Up is a mandatory college introductory course for all incoming freshmen. This experience helps you adjust to university life through workshops, activities and team-building exercises with your new classmates.
[Admissions Representative](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
Have questions about confirming enrollment or what to expect at UW? Our admissions reps are here to help you every step of the way. Reach out anytime—we’re just a call or message away!
[Cowboy Coach Mentoring](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/cowboy-coaches/index.html)
Cowboy Coaches are experienced students who provide peer mentoring to help you navigate college life. Matched based on your major and interests, they offer guidance, support and a friendly ear to help you thrive at UW.
Celebrate Signing Day With Us
Join us for Signing Day and share your excitement about becoming a Cowboy! We’ll provide social media toolkits, downloadable materials and other fun ways to celebrate with your family and friends. First-year students, keep an eye out for your celebration packet in late spring!
[Signing Day](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/signing-day.html)

# Military & Veteran Student Admissions
## We are proud to welcome you to UW!
The University of Wyoming is dedicated to offering personalized support and resources to military service members, veterans and their families. We provide a wide range of educational opportunities, financial assistance and specialized services designed to help our military-affiliated students achieve both academic and personal success. UW Admissions works closely with military and veteran students, ensuring they are well-prepared for their time at UW and for success beyond graduation.
[Apply to UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[High School Guests](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
[Military & Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)

Non-Degree Seeking Students
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)[Undergraduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html)[Graduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html)
## Admissions Process
We are ready to support you wherever you are on your academic path. Military students may enter UW as [first-year students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html), [transfer students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/index.html) or [graduate students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/graduate.html).
It is important to note, that military and veteran students may be eligible to transfer credits for courses taken at certain military schools. If there are any questions about this process or admissions in general, [UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/index.html) is here to help!
## Military & Veteran Student Resources
Students with military backgrounds bring valuable skills to their collegiate career. UW recognizes how these experiences enrich our campus and is here to help you navigate everything from admissions to financial aid and beyond.
Veterans Service Center 
The University of Wyoming [Veterans Service Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/vetservices/index.html) is here to provide assistance for any questions about accessing your benefits and connect you with our supportive community.
GI Bill 
The GI Bill is a benefits program to help veterans and their families pay for college, graduate school and job training. [Learn more about how to apply and eligibility requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsbo/student-financial-services/veterans/gi-bill-applications.html).
Military Tuition Assistance 
Military and veteran students may qualify for Federal Tuition Assistance. [Learn more about how to apply and eligibility requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/fsbo/student-financial-services/veterans/military-tuition-assistance.html). 
Scholarships Available to Military and Veteran Students 
UW and our supporters offer many [scholarships](https://uwyo.academicworks.com/opportunities?utf8=%E2%9C%93&term=) for military and veteran students. Explore both military-specific scholarships and other scholarships that may be a good fit for you!
UW Counseling Center 
The [UW Counseling Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/ucc/index.html) is here to support all students and is an invaluable resource for supporting personal and academic growth.

# First-Year Undergraduate Admission
## Unlock Your Future at the University of Wyoming
At the University of Wyoming, we are dedicated to providing accessible and affordable education, empowering you to reach your full potential both in and out of the classroom. Our admission process operates on a "rolling basis," meaning you can apply anytime leading up to the next available semester start date, offering you the flexibility to submit your application when you're ready without the pressure of fixed deadlines. We look forward to seeing the unique qualities and experiences you’ll bring to our community and are excited about the possibilities that lie ahead for you at the University of Wyoming.

### Your Path to Becoming a Cowboy
Applying to the University of Wyoming is the first step toward an exciting journey filled with endless opportunities. UW offers a diverse array of academic programs designed to prepare students for success in a variety of fields, from business and engineering to environmental science and the arts. Whether you're drawn to cutting-edge research, hands-on learning, or dynamic extracurricular activities, there is something for everyone at UW.
As a Cowboy, you’ll join a supportive community where faculty and peers work together to foster personal and academic growth. The University of Wyoming isn’t just about earning a degree—it’s about embracing new experiences and discovering your potential in a vibrant, welcoming environment.
[Explore Programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
## Admissions Requirements
To be considered for admission to the University of Wyoming as a first-year student, you’ll need to meet specific academic requirements. Below are the details on the high school success curriculum and GPA needed to help you understand what’s expected to gain admission and set yourself up for success at UW.
GPA Requirements
We welcome all first-time students to apply and will evaluate them based on academic achievement. For assured admission, a cumulative high school GPA of 3.00–4.00 is required. Students with a GPA of 2.50–2.99 are [admitted with support](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/admission-with-support.html). Be sure to check additional requirements for financial assistance opportunities!
High School Success Curriculum
First-year students must have completed 4 years of English, Math (including Algebra I, II, and Geometry) and Science (with one year in physical science like physics or chemistry). You’ll also need 3 years of Social Science and 4 years of Additional Coursework, such as Foreign Language, Fine Arts, or Career Education, with two years in the same subject.

### Home School & GED Admissions Requirements
We welcome qualified home school and GED students to apply to the University of Wyoming! Homeschooled students must meet the same requirements as other high school graduates and their instructor should submit a Home School Credit Evaluation form to UW Admissions.
GED students must have an average score of at least 164. Applicants must be at least 18 years old or have completed their application after their intended high school class has graduated. Those under 21 are also required to submit ACT or SAT scores.
## Support for First-Year Students
At the University of Wyoming, we are committed to providing incoming students with the best support to ensure a successful college experience. Through our peer mentoring program, Cowboy Coaches are there to guide you through your first year, offering one-on-one assistance and personalized support. With plenty of face time and tailored help, this resource contributes to high success rates and strong retention from the first to second year, setting you up for continued success at UW.

# Admission With Support
## Your Pathway to UW
At UW, we believe in potential, not just numbers. Our Admission with Support pathway offers students an opportunity to join the UW community, even if they don’t meet standard admission requirements. We take a holistic approach, considering your individual academic achievements and strengths. Submit your application, transcripts and test scores and let’s build your future together!
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Next Steps to Enroll](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/nextsteps.html)
[Admission With Support](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/admission-with-support.html)
[Start at a WY Community College](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/start-at-wy-cc.html)
[Defer your Enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/defer-enrollment.html)
## What is Admission with Support?
UW’s Admission with Support program offers an alternative pathway for students who don’t fully meet standard admission requirements but show strong academic potential. Students admitted through this pathway participate in the Bridge Program or other transition programs to set them up for success.
[Bridge Program](https://www.uwyo.edu/fallbridge/index.html)
## YOu have questions - we have answers
Being admitted with support is nothing to worry about! UW is here to help you transition smoothly and set you up for success from day one.
Who is eligible for Admission with Support? 
You may qualify if you:
  * Have a cumulative, unweighted high school GPA between 2.50 – 2.99
  * Have a 2.25 – 2.49 GPA (subject to holistic review and may require an essay)
  * Have no more than two deficiencies in the High School Success Curriculum (both cannot be in the same category)


What is the High School Success Curriculum? 
The High School Success Curriculum ensures students are academically prepared for UW. To qualify, students must complete:
  * 4 Years of English
  * 4 Years of Math (Algebra I, Algebra II & Geometry required)
  * 4 Years of Science (At least 1 year must be Physics, Chemistry, or Physical Science)
  * 3 Years of Social Science
  * 4 Years of Additional Coursework (Foreign Language, Fine Arts, or Career-Vocational Education; 2 years must be in the same subject)


Students can have no more than two deficiencies and those deficiencies cannot occur in the same category (e.g., missing two math courses would not qualify).
What is the Bridge Program and why is it required? 
The Bridge Program is a nationally recognized academic support initiative designed to help students transition successfully into college. Students admitted with support must register for Bridge by July 15 before fall classes begin.
What if I miss the Bridge Program deadline? 
If you don’t register by the deadline, we encourage you to start at a community college and transfer to UW after:  
Completing at least 30 credit hours with a 2.0+ GPA  
OR earning an associate’s degree
What if I was homeschooled or earned a GED? 
Homeschooled students must meet the same eligibility requirements and submit a Home School Credit Evaluation Form.
  
GED students must:
  * Have an average score of 157-163 on the GED test
  * Submit ACT or SAT scores if under 21
  * Be at least 18 years old or have a high school class that has graduated

# Schedule Your Weekday Visit to UW
## Plan Ahead to get the Most Our of Your Visit
Welcome to the University of Wyoming! We’re excited to offer weekday visits where you can explore our campus, meet with staff and learn about academic opportunities.
You can schedule a visit at either 9:00 a.m. or 12:00 p.m., based on availability. If a session is listed on the calendar, it’s available for that date and time. If not, it’s either full or unavailable. Your visit to UW will typically last about four hours, depending on the appointments you choose and staff availability. To make sure you secure your spot, please request your visit at least one week in advance. 
[Reserve Your Visit](https://uwyo-erx.my.salesforce-sites.com/EventListing/)

### Admissions Events
In addition to regular visits, we host several special events throughout the year for prospective students. Admitted high school seniors can attend New Student Day events in March and April to meet advisors, residence life staff and other admitted students. We also offer Discovery Days for students still exploring their options, where you can dive deeper into what UW has to offer. Check out all available events and find one that fits your schedule. Click below for more details and to register for an upcoming event!
[Explore Upcoming Events](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
## Important Visit info
Visits with less than a week’s notice will only include a campus tour and an admissions information session, lasting about two hours. We recommend scheduling early to make sure you get the most out of your visit, including academic appointments with faculty members. During special times like Spring Break, the campus may be quieter, but we still offer campus tours and admissions sessions.
[Plan Your Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/plan-your-visit.html)

# English Proficiency for International Students
## Meeting UW's Language Requirements
To ensure academic success, the University of Wyoming requires most international applicants to demonstrate English proficiency. Explore accepted tests, minimum scores, and exemptions for students from English-speaking backgrounds.
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[First-Year International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-first-year.html)
[Graduate International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-graduate.html)
[Transfer International Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/requirements-transfer.html)
[English Proficiency](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/international/english-alternatives.html)
## Who needs to provide proof of English proficiency?
An international applicant whose native language is English and is a citizen of one of the following countries or has earned a university level degree from a school in one of the following countries may be exempt from providing additional proof of English proficiency: Antigua & Barbuda, Australia, Bahamas, Belize, Bermuda, Canada (all provinces except Quebec), Ghana, Grenada, Guyana, Ireland, Jamaica, New Zealand, Nigeria, Singapore, St. Kitts & Nevis, St. Lucia Dominica, St. Vincent & the Grenadines, Trinidad & Tobago, United Kingdom and the United States.

[Future Cowboy Parking](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Hoyt+Hall/@41.3117801,-105.5818919,206m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x876890175d359f17:0xf6f25e2128f9acfa!8m2!3d41.3117801!4d-105.5818919!16s%2Fg%2F11b6t0lrkq?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkxNy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Weekday visit and tour parking is available West of Hoyt Hall. From there, you can follow [directions to the Campus Visitor Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/_files/docs/visit/cowboy-parking-to-visitor-center.pdf) in Ross Hall
[Ivinson Parking Garage](https://www.google.com/maps/place/1010+E+Ivinson+Ave,+Laramie,+WY+82070/@41.3112305,-105.5838761,1758m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x87689019c11cba2d:0x8d869bb88fa9f0cc!8m2!3d41.3112305!4d-105.5838761!16s%2Fg%2F11sw49dpz3?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDMyNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Overflow parking for weekday campus visits (Campus Visitor Center permit required), free for weekend events, and hourly parking available on the top floor during weekdays.
[Ford Stadium Lot](https://www.google.com/maps/place/War+Memorial+Stadium/@41.3117075,-105.5708596,1758m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x8768906af75cad67:0x514f3c033c29d196!8m2!3d41.3117035!4d-105.5682847!16zL20vMDYzNzE3?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDMyNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)
Free parking behind the Marian H. Rochelle Gateway Center available anytime besides game day. Use any unmarked spot. No permit is needed. 
### Visitor Parking Information
**For weekday visits and tours** , park in the "Future Cowboy" spots just West of Hoyt Hall. After arrival, check in at the Campus Visitor Center inside Ross Hall, where you'll receive a parking permit. If you have a handicap placard, feel free to use any accessible spot.
  

**On weekends or during special events** , permits aren’t required unless marked “Enforced 24 Hours.” Explore our parking options and be aware that athletic events may affect availability. Watch your email for additional parking details if you've registered for an event.
_*UW Admissions is not responsible for any parking citations._
[Parking Map](https://www.uwyo.edu/transportation/_files/parking/docs/parkingmap.pdf)

### Make the Most of Your Visit!
The University of Wyoming is located in Laramie, Wyoming. Our campus is tucked right in at the base of the Snowy Mountains and is full of exciting things to do! Of course, we recommend grabbing a beverage or snack at our [on-campus coffee shops](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/dining/dining-hours.html) or playing a game of billiards at the [Pokes Pub & Gameroom](https://www.uwyo.edu/union/pokes-pub-and-gameroom/index.html), but Laramie has so much to offer!  
  
Be sure to explore our bustling downtown ([voted one of the top 3 main streets in the nation!](https://mainstreet.org/our-network/awards-and-recognition/great-american-main-street-awards/laramie-wyoming)) and maybe even get in a little outdoor recreation at our many nearby forest and mountain areas. Discover all the reasons the locals call Laramie, Laradise.
[Visit Laramie](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/aboutuw/about-laramie.html)
## What to Bring for Your Visit to Laramie
[Laramie weather](https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/b5f629e4a418e4bb39b77f5f1206ae1a2c0748e25d00b770198262f0d75f415e) can be a bit unpredictable, so it’s best to dress in layers. In winter, be ready for snow, while summer is likely to bring some sun—don’t forget sunscreen and a water bottle! Comfortable shoes are a must, especially for walking around campus. It’s always a good idea to check the weather the day before your visit so you can pack accordingly and make the most of your time on campus.
[Laramie Conditions](https://wyoroad.info/pls/Browse/WRR.TownResults?SelectedTown=Laramie)

# University of Wyoming Virtual Tour
## Explore UW from right where you are!
Take a stroll through the stunning University of Wyoming campus without leaving your home! Our interactive virtual tour lets you explore campus with ease, offering an accessible and immersive experience. You can explore Half Acre Recreation & Wellness Center, see what’s happening at Wyoming Union or simply take in the beauty of Prexy’s Pasture.   
  
From our iconic landmarks to our state-of-the-art facilities, you can get a sneak peek into UW campus life. Ready to explore? Start the virtual tour now!
[UW Virtual Tour](https://www.youvisit.com/tour/uwyo/139452?pl=v&m_prompt=1)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw)
## Check Out UW Campus Landmarks
Previous
### UW Residence Halls
UW’s Residence Halls are where students sleep, study and build lifelong friendship—all within these halls.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/index.html)
### Wyoming Union
Wyoming Union is the central hub of campus. Thousands of students pass through the union each day to grab a bite between classes, access student resources or catch up with friends.
[Visit the Union](https://www.uwyo.edu/union/index.html)
### Campus Dining
From quick bites and coffee to whats for dinner, UW offers an array of dining options and packages to fuel your education and more.
[Explore Options](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/dining/index.html)
### Coe Library
Coe Library is a campus hub for group study sessions, grabbing a cup of coffee or finding a cozy corner to catch up on coursework.
[Visit COE](https://www.uwyo.edu/libraries/index.html)
### Research Facilities
Explore our cutting-edge research facilites from museums and archives to laboratories and technology hubs. 
[Browse FACILITIES](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/research/research-facilities.html)
### Williams Conservatory
Williams Conservatory houses thousands of rare plants and serves as a research space for botany students. All UW students are welcome to enjoy its beauty and tranquility.
[Check it out](https://www.uwyo.edu/conservatory/index.html)
### Half Acre Recreation
Half Acre Recreation & Wellness Center is a state-of-the-art facility equipped with everything from an epic rock wall to group fitness classes and spaces for meditation.

### Explore UW Campus from Every Angle
The University of Wyoming Virtual Tour is the closest you can get to a real life tour of campus!  
  
Click the “Take the Virtual Tour” button.  
Click and drag left or right to experience the 360° panoramic views. Select pictures in the bottom right hand corner explore each section further. Move your mouse to the left side of the screen to reveal the list of other UW landmarks you can explore and select your next destination!
  
Interested in scheduling an [on-campus visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)? We’d love to have you!
[TAKE THE VIRTUAL TOUR](https://www.youvisit.com/tour/uwyo/139452?pl=v&m_prompt=1)
## Picture Yourself at UW!
Sometimes, you just know when something feels right. Picture yourself relaxing in Prexy’s Pasture after class or tackling the rock wall with friends before grabbing Chick-fil-A™ for dinner. If that sounds like your kind of college experience, it's time to take the next step. With 200+ programs, there's something for everyone. Get started on your [UW application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) today!

# Express Transfer Agreement
Welcome to the Express Transfer Agreement (ETA) program—a pathway designed for Laramie County Community College (LCCC) students in select majors to efficiently complete their bachelor’s degree. What’s your ETA to graduation? With express transfer status, co-admission to the University of Wyoming (UW) and co-advising, we’ll make your academic journey smooth and successful, ensuring every credit counts toward your degree.
[Request Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/request-information/index.html#request)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Transferring Credits](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/transferring-credits.html)
[Next Steps to Enroll](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/next-steps.html)
[Express Transfer Agreement](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/transfer-agreement.html)
[Start at a WY Community College](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/start-at-wy-cc.html)
## Eligible Majors

English 
Develop critical thinking and communication skills through literature and writing. Check back for program specifics soon. 
Communications 
Learn media, PR and messaging skills for careers in communication, marketing and journalism. Check back for program specifics soon.
### Seamless Path to UW
Set yourself up for transfer success by starting at LCCC with a clear, locked-in path to UW. Once you're accepted to LCCC, you're already on the road to UW, with no extra applications required. Along the way, dedicated academic advisors and a full range of transfer student success resources are here to support you—helping you stay on track, build confidence and thrive at the university level.
[Office of Transfer Relations](https://www.uwyo.edu/transfer/index.html)
## Need Assistance? We're here to help!
As part of the Express Transfer Agreement (ETA) program, you’ll receive co-advising from both Laramie County Community College (LCCC) and the University of Wyoming (UW) to ensure a seamless transition. Whether you have questions about your coursework, transfer process, or degree planning, our dedicated teams at both institutions are here to support you.
