# Family Guide to UW
## Tools & Support to Help Your Student Take Their Next Step
As your student searches for their perfect university fit, we’re here to support you, too. At the University of Wyoming, parents and guardians can trust that their student will be cared for, confident and career-ready. Explore resources that make the transition smooth from wellness and mentorship to affordable tuition and proven career outcomes. See why UW is the right choice for your student.
[Explore UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/index.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[FAQs](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/family-resources/faqs.html)
## Experience Campus Life & Support
### Visit UW
Visit campus in person or virtually and see the community where your student will grow.
[Plan Your Visit](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
### Housing & Dining
Discover residence halls and dining options that provide a supportive, comfortable home on campus.
[View Housing & Dining](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html)
### Campus Safety
Explore UW’s safety programs, campus police, emergency care and full wellness support.
[Explore Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/campus-safety.html)
### Planning for College Affordably
We know sending your student to college is a big step for the whole family. At UW, we keep things simple: quality education at an affordable price. Explore our Cost of Attendance Calculator to see how Cowboy life can fit into your family’s plans.
[EXPLORE Calculator](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/undergraduate.html)
## Preparing Students for Success
UW equips students with skills, connections and experiences that lead to meaningful careers. Families can trust their student is on a path toward employment, graduate school and long-term success.
Strong Employment Outcomes
Most UW graduates secure employment or continue their education within a year of graduation. [Career Services](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/career-services/index.html) provides internship resources, advising and job fairs, ensuring students leave with real-world experience and a clear path toward professional success.
Graduation Rates & Career Readiness
UW boasts high graduation rates and [programs](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html) that prepare students for life after college. Families can be confident that the university not only delivers a degree but also ensures students are ready to thrive in their careers and communities.
## Connect & Explore
[Meet Your UW Rep](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
Connect with your student’s admissions rep, request info and get questions answered personally.
[Experience UW Together](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/index.html)
Discover events for future Cowboys and families, from webinars to exciting on-campus experiences.
[Find Your Student's Fit](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)
Explore UW’s degrees together to help your student find the perfect academic and career fit.
### Help Your Student Take the Next Step
After students have applied, families can guide them through [confirming their UW enrollment](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html#confirm), celebrating their commitment at [Signing Day](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/signing-day.html) and preparing for college with our [onboarding](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/onboarding.html) programs. Your support helps ensure a smooth start to their Cowboy journey.
[Next Steps](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/nextsteps.html)
## UW By the Numbers
A quick snapshot of the University of Wyoming shows why parents and families can feel confident: strong graduation rates, career-ready graduates and a welcoming, safe campus community.
90%
of UW graduates secure careers or grad school acceptance within one year.
14:1
student-faculty ratio, ensuring personal attention and hands-on learning.
48%
less student debt than national average, making UW an affordable choice.
Ongoing Family Support
Your role in your student’s success doesn’t end at enrollment. The University of Wyoming’s [Student Success](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html) team offers dedicated resources for families to stay engaged and informed. From communication updates to campus events, you’ll have everything you need to support your student’s journey.
[Family Resources](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/family-support/index.html)

# Next Steps to Enroll as a Transfer Student
## Get started on your path to UW!
Nearly 45% of the University of Wyoming's student body consists of transfer students. That is in large part due to UW being a setting that allows transfer students to really thrive! To support this, UW has streamlined the transfer process, making it clear and easy to follow. We've gathered all the resources you'll need to confirm your enrollment and begin your journey at UW, ensuring a smooth transition.   
  

Whether you’re transferring from a community college or another institution, we’re here to guide you every step of the way as you work toward achieving your academic goals.
[Confirm Your Enrollment!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/nextsteps.html#confirm)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)

[Express Transfer Agreement](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/transfer-agreement.html)
[Start at a WY Community College](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/start-at-wy-cc.html)
## Steps to Enroll

Contact your current school to submit your official transcripts to the University of Wyoming. Transcript can be mailed physically or submitted electronically.

Check in with Student Health Services to submit proof of vaccination. All students must turn in proof of the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella vaccination prior to course registration.
[Immunization Requirement](https://www.uwyo.edu/shser/mmr-requirement.html)

### Scholarships and Financial Aid
The University of Wyoming is committed to making high-quality higher education more affordable for all students. UW offers a wide range of [scholarships and financial aid](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/index.html) opportunities, including special support for transfer students. The [Wyoming Transfer Commitment](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/resident-transfer-student-commitment.html) is a financial pledge for in-state transfer students, offering a yearly scholarship based on GPA. Similarly, the [Pokes Transfer Commitment](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/nonresident-transfer-student-commitment.html) provides a similar program for non-resident transfer students. Be sure to explore all the financial options available to you.
[Transfer Student Scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html)
## Ready to Get Started at UW?
Transfer students can hit the ground running at the University of Wyoming!
Here are a few steps you can take to move forward:
  * Chat with an [admissions representative](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/counselors/index.html).
  * Learn more about [Transfer Saddle Up](https://www.uwyo.edu/saddle-up/transfer.html).
  * Check out the [Office of Transfer Relations](https://www.uwyo.edu/transfer/index.html).
  * Explore your [dining and housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html) options.
  * Get excited about life at UW and get ready to share that Poke Pride!


The UW Office of Admissions team is here to help with any questions. Welcome to UW!

# Transferring Credits to the University of Wyoming
At UW, we make transferring credits easy. Most college-level courses from regionally accredited schools transfer, while remedial and vocational courses typically do not. Your prior GPA determines admission and scholarships, but once at UW, only your UW courses affect your GPA. Your department decides how transfer credits apply to your major and whether "D" grades count. If you're coming from a Wyoming community college, our common course numbering system ensures a smooth transfer process.
[Degree Plans](https://acalogcatalog.uwyo.edu/?_gl=1*bt4zfs*_gcl_au*MTMwMjAxODQ3OS4xNzQ0NjQyNzM1*_ga*OTA3ODQxNzMxLjE3MzY3OTIzODM.*_ga_DCJG3HESYS*czE3NTAxOTczNDUkbzI5NiRnMSR0MTc1MDE5ODYyOSRqNTMkbDAkaDA.)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Transferring Credits](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/transferring-credits.html)
[Next Steps to Enroll](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/next-steps.html)
[Express Transfer Agreement](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/transfer-agreement.html)
[Start at a WY Community College](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/transfer/start-at-wy-cc.html)
## Evaluating Transcripts
To keep your transfer process moving smoothly, submit transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities as soon as possible. Your credits won’t be evaluated until your admission file is complete and you’ve been accepted. Since this process takes time, early submission helps avoid delays. Once the Office of the Registrar reviews your transcripts, you’ll receive an email with instructions on how to check your transfer credits in WyoRecords through WyoWeb. For more details, visit the [UW Registrar’s Office](https://www.uwyo.edu/registrar/index.html) and use the [Wyoming Transfer Catalog ](https://wyossb.uwyo.edu/BannerExtensibility/customPage/page/uw.TransferCatalog?_gl=1*71d797*_gcl_au*MTMwMjAxODQ3OS4xNzQ0NjQyNzM1*_ga*OTA3ODQxNzMxLjE3MzY3OTIzODM.*_ga_DCJG3HESYS*czE3NTAxOTczNDUkbzI5NiRnMSR0MTc1MDE5ODI1NyRqNTgkbDAkaDA.)for an unofficial credit evaluation.
## More About Trasnferring Credit to UW
Easily transfer your credits to UW! Whether you're coming from a community college, a four-year university, or even military training, we’ll help you maximize your prior coursework. Explore how your credits apply and get on track toward your UW degree.
Will my credits transfer from a Wyoming community college? 
Yes! Wyoming community colleges use a common course numbering system, so most courses transfer directly to UW with the same course equivalency and University Studies Program (USP) credit. If a course doesn’t have a direct equivalent, it may transfer as general elective credit. Advisors can also approve substitutions when appropriate.
What if I’m transferring from an out-of-state community college? 
UW accepts credits from regionally accredited two-year institutions. Courses are reviewed individually, and some may transfer as direct equivalents to UW courses, general electives, or USP credits. However, vocational-technical and developmental courses typically do not transfer. Students can also petition for USP credit consideration.
Do four-year college credits transfer to UW? 
Yes! Credits from regionally accredited four-year institutions are reviewed on a course-by-course basis. Lower-division courses may transfer as direct equivalents, general electives, or USP credits. Upper-division courses are initially given elective credit, but department faculty can determine if they fulfill major requirements.
Can I transfer international college credits? 
Yes, but international transcripts require additional steps. If your school’s catalog is not online, you must provide course descriptions and/or syllabi for faculty review. If documents are not in English, a certified translation is required. UW’s Admissions Office will conduct an initial review before sending courses to faculty for evaluation.
What about credits from trade or technical schools? 
UW only accepts credit from regionally accredited institutions. If your school meets this standard, eligible coursework will be reviewed individually. Vocational-technical or developmental courses generally do not transfer.
How does UW handle quarter system vs. semester system credits? 
UW follows national credit conversion standards. Since quarter-system credits are worth 2/3 of semester credits, a three-course sequence in a quarter system may only equal two semester courses at UW.
Can I receive credit for military training? 
Yes! UW reviews American Council on Education (ACE) military transcripts and may grant credit for formal training courses related to UW subjects. However, credit is not awarded for on-the-job training or short courses. Accredited military schools like service academies, the Defense Language Institute, or the Community College of the Air Force are reviewed like any other college.

## How To Apply
Navigating the application process and understanding financial support options are important steps in becoming a UW student. Below, you’ll find key details on how to apply, important deadlines and scholarship opportunities for international students.
Apply to UW
Submitting your application is simple with a low $40 USD non-refundable fee. If paying by international money order or check, it must be drawn from a U.S. bank and payable to the UW Admissions Office.  
**Application Deadlines by Semester**  
Fall: _June 1_ | Spring: _Nov. 1_ | Summer: _April 1_
Explore Financial Assistance
Eligible international freshmen students may qualify for the [International Brown & Gold Commitment](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/international/brown-and-gold-commitment.html) based on GPA. Proof of financial support is still required.

### English Language Center
The University of Wyoming’s English Language Center (ELC) helps non-native speakers build the academic and professional English skills needed for success in higher education. Our [**Intensive English Program (IEP)**](https://www.uwyo.edu/study-iep-esl/intensive-esl-on-campus.html) offers immersive, 15-week courses with 18-20 hours of instruction per week in grammar, writing, speaking and more. The IEP requires a separate application as a full-time, non-degree-seeking student. Admissions, tuition and financial requirements differ from UW’s regular process.

# Non-Degree Seeking Student Admissions
## Embrace Lifelong Learning!
The University of Wyoming proudly offers admission for non-degree seeking students. This flexible option is ideal for students who wish to take courses without official degree status. Feel free to explore personal, professional or academic interests without the commitment of pursuing a degree. Of course, if plans change, UW allows students to switch to degree status at any time, ensuring a seamless transition as you continue to pursue your academic goals.
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[Undergraduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html)
[Graduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html)
## Apply to UW!
UW is excited to welcome students at all stages of their academic journey. Students who wish to explore courses without pursuing a degree select the “Non-Degree Seeking” option on their [application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html). While this path offers flexibility, students are still required to meet UW’s [admission requirements](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/freshman/index.html) and complete the application process. It’s a great way to learn and explore UW's vast academic resources on your own terms.
## Non-Degree Seeking Student FAQs
UW is dedicated to making higher education accessible and supporting all educational paths. Non-degree enrollment offers flexibility, allowing students to explore academic interests without degree requirements or a set timeline. 
How do I apply? 
Non-degree seeking students will apply to UW Admissions through our [online application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html). Be sure to select “Non-Degree Seeking” when prompted.
Which courses are open for non-degree seeking students? 
[Undergraduate](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html) and [graduate](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html) non-degree seeking students are encouraged to explore UW’s entire [course catalog](https://www.uwyo.edu/uw/degree-programs/index.html)!
What about financial aid and scholarships? 
Students choosing a non-degree seeking track CANNOT qualify for financial aid or scholarships.
Who do I go to for advising? 
Undergraduate students will use [ACES](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/index.html) for advising. Advising is not required for graduate students, but it is HIGHLY recommended they discuss courses with their degree program.
Requirements for non-degree seeking graduate students? 
Non-degree seeking students who wish to pursue courses in a graduate program must provide proof of a bachelor’s degree.
What if I want to change my degree status? 
Awesome! Students are welcome to change their status to pursue a degree at any time. Reach out to [UW Admissions](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/) for guidance with this process.
Who cannot qualify as a non-degree seeking student? 
Non-degree admission status is NOT available to international students or to students who are currently under suspension at UW or any other college or university.

## What to Expect as you Prepare to Attend UW
Welcome to the University of Wyoming! We're so excited to have you join our community. To help you feel prepared and confident, we've designed a three-part onboarding experience: New Student Days in the spring, a Webinar Series through the summer and the mandatory college introduction course, "Saddle Up" in August. Each step is designed to help you connect, learn and get ready for life at UW. We can’t wait to see you on campus!

## Get Ready for UW: Onboarding Events
### New Student Days
Join us for a day dedicated to helping you explore campus, meet fellow students and get a jumpstart on your UW experience. It’s the perfect way to launch your future at UW!
[view dates](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/new-student-day.html)
### Summer Webinar Series
These online sessions cover essential topics like scholarship & financial aid, parking & housing and an introduction to Saddle Up. Great for you and your family to prepare for the upcoming school year.
[explore series](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/events/summer-webinar.html)
### Saddle Up
This first-year required event prepares you for your UW journey. It’s designed to help you get acclimated with resources and connect with peers before classes start.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/saddle-up/index.html)
### Visit Us Your Way
As you prepare to start your journey at the University of Wyoming, we invite you to explore campus and start getting familiar with your new home. Visiting before the semester begins—whether in person or through our virtual tour—is a great way to build confidence, learn your way around and start picturing yourself as part of the UW community. This is your time to settle in, get excited and start making UW your own.
[Visit Campus](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/visit/index.html)
## Explore UW through student stories
The University of Wyoming student blogs offer an inside look into campus life through the eyes of current students. From academic advice to personal experiences, these blogs cover a variety of topics that can help you get a real feel for what it’s like to be a Cowboy. Whether it’s tips for navigating college or fun stories about living in Laramie, the student blogs are a great resource for incoming students to get excited and informed about their future at UW.
[UW Student Blogs](https://www.uwyo.edu/blog/index.html)

# Start at a Wyoming Community College
## Build a strong foundation for your academic career
Starting at a Wyoming community college before transferring to the University of Wyoming provides students with many benefits. Wyoming community colleges can help students save on tuition, receive personalized support in small classes and build a strong academic foundation. Then, thanks to the seamless transfer process and close partnership between UW and Wyoming community colleges, students who are interested in earning a bachelor’s degree can easily transfer to the University of Wyoming to continue their studies. This collaboration provides a smooth path to academic success while keeping students connected to their local communities.

### Wyoming Community College Benefits
Each student takes their own unique path through higher education and for many students choosing to start at a Wyoming community college is a strong first step on that path.  
  

Starting at a Wyoming community college allows you to:
  * Experience smaller class sizes.
  * Maintain [Hathaway eligibility](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/hathaway/transfer.html).
  * Save money on tuition.
  * Build a strong academic foundation.
  * Easily transfer to UW, when you are ready.


The University of Wyoming and our partner community colleges across the state are committed to supporting all students. We work together to create systems that promote success and allow each student to pursue their goals in the way that best fits them.
[Apply Now](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
## Steps to Transfer to UW
Wyoming community college students who are ready to transfer to UW have a few simple steps to follow.
  1. Complete a [Pre-Credit Transfer Evaluation](https://www.uwyo.edu/transfer/evaluation-tools/index.html).
  2. Fill out an [online application](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html).
  3. Contact your current college to submit your official transcripts to UW.


It’s as simple as that! Be sure to also explore the [scholarship opportunities](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html) available to transfer students.

# Transfer Student Admissions
## Your Next Step Starts at UW
Thinking about transferring to the University of Wyoming? We’re here to help make the process smooth and stress-free! At UW, you'll find a welcoming community, diverse academic opportunities and dedicated support to guide you every step of the way. Whether you're exploring programs, understanding transfer credits, or looking for financial aid options, we have the resources to ensure a successful transition. Start your journey today and discover what makes UW the perfect place to continue your education!

Next
### The UW Transfer Experience
At UW, we’re here to support your transfer journey! Our Office of Transfer Relations offers pre-transfer credit evaluations, personalized transfer plans and articulation agreements to make your transition smooth. We provide dedicated events, peer mentoring and financial aid resources to help you feel at home. With nearly half our students coming from other schools, you’ll find a welcoming community and the tools you need to succeed.
[Learn More](https://www.uwyo.edu/transfer/index.html)
## Admissions Requirements
We’re excited to welcome you to UW! Make sure to check admission requirements, as well as those for scholarships and financial aid. If you’ve earned at least 12 post-high school transfer credits, you may qualify for UW’s [transfer commitments](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html).
GPA Requirements
To transfer to UW, you’ll need a minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale. If your GPA meets this requirement, you’re on the right track! Keep in mind that some programs may have additional requirements. If you have questions or need guidance, we’re here to help make your transition to UW as smooth as possible!
Transferable Credits
To transfer to UW, you’ll need at least 12 transferable credit hours. If you have fewer than 12, don’t worry—you can still apply! You’ll just need to submit your high school transcript and if you’re under 21, ACT or SAT scores are also required. We’re here to help you through the process, so reach out with any questions as you take the next step toward becoming a Poke!

## Undergraduate Students
### Resident
Eligible Wyoming resident new first-time students (non-transfer) have several opportunities for scholarship support.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/residents/index.html)
### Non-Resident
Eligible non-resident new first-time students (non-transfer) have several opportunities for scholarship support.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/non-residents/index.html)
### International
Eligible new first-time international students (non-transfer) have scholarship opportunities at the University of Wyoming.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/international/index.html)
## Cards Carousel Slider
### Transfer
Students who transfer to the University of Wyoming - whether resident, non-resident, or international transfer students - may qualify for a scholarship.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/transfers/index.html)
### Non-Traditional
Non-traditional students who meet certain criteria may qualify for scholarship assistance through the Wyoming's Tomorrow Scholarship.
[More Info](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/wyomings-tomorrow-scholarship.html)
### External Scholarships
  
External scholarships are developed and funded by organizations external to UW. They’re available to the public and can potentially help students cover the costs of their education and education-related expenses. Student eligibility rules are created by the organization offering the scholarship and can depend on many factors. If you are a student who has been awarded an external scholarship or are a donor/organization that is funding an external scholarship, please review the [External Scholarships page](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/scholarships/external-scholarships.html) for more information.
* * *
### Emergency Scholarship
The University of Wyoming Emergency Scholarships are one-time only awards for UW students who experience unexpected emergent circumstances. Several criteria must be met to be eligible for this type of scholarship. Students must submit the [Emergency Scholarship Request](https://uwyo.sjc1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9Ev0eeaDAC8fa4u) to be considered.
## Contact Us

# FAQs
## Supporting You and Your Student
We know this is an exciting, sometimes overwhelming time for families. At the University of Wyoming, we partner with both students and families throughout the admissions journey, from applying and exploring scholarships to preparing for life on campus.
If you have questions beyond what you see here, our admissions team is ready to help. Connect with your student’s admissions representative, ask a question through our online form, or plan a campus visit together. We’re here to make sure both you and your student feel supported every step of the way.
[Get in Touch](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/contact.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[FAQs](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/family-resources/faqs.html)
## Common Questions from Parents and Families 
As your student takes the next step toward becoming a Cowboy, we know you may have questions along the way. These FAQs are designed to help parents and families better understand the admissions process, student life, and the many resources available to support your student at the University of Wyoming.
What is the Admissions/Application Process Like? 
  * Students [apply directly to UW](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) or through the Common App
  * $40 application fee
  * UW is test optional
  * Upload or submit unofficial transcript(s) to be reviewed
  * No essay or letter of recommendation required
  * Students with a 3.0 unweighted GPA or higher are assured admission; there are some additional ways to be reviewed for admission, so we encourage students to apply. 


What Financial Aid Options are Available? 
Our [financial aid ](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/index.html)options vary depending on the state your student is from. We offer different scholarships for in state and out of state students dependent on your student’s test score and GPA.
Any student can also fill out the FAFSA application to check eligibility for grants, loans, and work study eligibility. Students can also carry over outside scholarships as well.
What is the Average Cost of Attendance? 
Check out our [cost of attendance](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/cost-of-attendance/index.html) page for more personalized information on your cost of attendance! 
What is the Student to Faculty Ratio? 
The student-to- faculty ratio is currently 13-1 with an average class size of 30 students per class. 
What Types of Extracurricular Activities and Support Services are Available? 
Students at UW have countless ways to get involved and find their community. With more than 200 student clubs and organizations, 17 Division I athletic programs, 20 club sports, and over 50 intramural leagues, there’s something for every interest—from hobbies and leadership to professional development.
UW also offers a wide range of support services to help students thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. To explore all available resources—from tutoring and wellness to clubs and campus life—visit [Student Success](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html)
How does the University Support Students in Finding Internships and Jobs After Graduation? 
The University of Wyoming is dedicated to preparing students for success beyond the classroom. Our **[Advising, Career, and Exploratory Studies Center (ACES)](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/index.html)** helps students explore career paths, connect with internships, prepare résumés, and build professional skills through one-on-one advising and career events.
In addition, many UW colleges have their own career counseling and internship services built into their student success centers, offering specialized guidance tailored to each field of study. From day one, students have access to the people and resources that help them turn their education into a meaningful career.
What are the Campus Housing Options? 
We have a variety of [campus housing options](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/housing/index.html) for students. Freshmen are required to live on campus. We have our newest residence halls North and South along with our Legacy Hall White Hall. Students who elect to pursue the Honors college can also elect to pursue Honors housing in the Tobin house. Upperclassmen have the option to live in these halls as well. They also have the opportunity to apply for a UW apartment Bison Run, River Village, and Landmark Village. 
What is the Safety and Security Situation on Campus? 
Laramie and the University of Wyoming both provide safety and security for students. Campus residences offer locking doors that are unlocked only with the specific student ID for that residence. The largest crime in Laramie is bike theft, be sure to lock your bike!
How Easy is it to Access Outdoor Recreation? 
A lot of outdoor recreation is in our backyard. We are surrounded by 2.9 million acres of public land which allows our students to explore the great outdoors often. Hiking, biking, camping, fishing, skiing, snowboarding and plenty others all within 30-45 minutes! Check out the [Outdoor Program](https://www.uwyo.edu/rec/outdoor-program/index.html) for guided and group excursions.

## New at UW Casper: 100% Online Leadership Certificates
* * *
### GROW YOUR CAREER!
### The Organizational Leadership, Health Leadership, and Agribusiness Leadership Certificates are 100% online, asynchronous. Designed for working adults, these affordable certificates can be completed in as little as one year! With an emphasis on innovation, unique leadership styles, and communication, they are valuable tools for enhancing leadership skills. Graduates earn a standalone micro credential that can be applied toward a Bachelor degree if desired. While applicants are not required to have prior college credit or to be degree-seeking, the certificates are listed under our Degree-Seeking programs. Please [click here](https://www.uwyo.edu/uwcasper/degrees-programs/uwcasper-onlinecertificates.html) for instructions on how to apply. 
* * *
| 
## UW Casper has a podcast!
**Check out Leadership for Tomorrow: Starting Now on Apple Podcast or Spotify. Brought to you by the University of Wyoming at Casper, this podcast is your go-to resource for cultivating the leadership skills you need today to shape a brighter, more impactful tomorrow. Each episode features interviews with inspiring leaders from across Wyoming, sharing their stories, insights, and strategies for leadership and success. Whether you're a seasoned leader or just beginning to step into your potential, this podcast will empower you to lead with purpose, adapt to change, and make a lasting difference in your community and beyond.**  
---|---

# Campus Life
## Get involved at UW
Campus life at UW is full of ways to connect, get involved, and make the most of your first year. From student clubs and campus events to outdoor adventures and leadership programs, this is your guide to finding community and making UW feel like home.
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/fye)

# Returning Student Admissions
## Welcome Back to UW!
Welcome back to the University of Wyoming! There are a wide variety of reasons why students may choose to take a break from their academic journey, and the good news is that whenever you are ready to come back UW is here to welcome you with open arms! UW Office of Admissions is here to assist you every step of the way and has streamlined the process for re-enrollment, to make your transition back to UW as seamless as possible. Let’s get started!
[Returning Students Apply Here!](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html)
Navigation [ Main Page ](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions)
[High School Guests](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/high-school-guests.html)
[Returning Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/returning.html)
[Military & Veteran Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/veterans.html)
[Second Bachelor Degrees](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/second-bachelors.html)
Non-Degree Seeking Students
[LEARN MORE](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/index.html)[Undergraduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-undergraduate.html)[Graduate Students](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/additional-student-categories/non-degree/non-degree-graduate.html)
## Steps to Re-Enroll
The University of Wyoming is always excited to see returning students! The steps to re-enrollment for undergraduates and graduate level student are straightforward and the same.
If less than one academic year has passed, simply contact your advisor and register for classes via WyoWeb with their assistance.
If more than one academic year has passed, apply to UW via [online application.](https://www.uwyo.edu/admissions/apply.html) Be sure to indicate "Returning Student" when prompted in the application process.
## Resources for Returning Students
Resuming your academic journey is an exciting step, but we understand it can feel challenging at times. To make the process smoother, we’ve gathered all the resources you may need to help returning students successfully navigate re-enrollment.
Advising, Career, Exploratory Studies Center (ACES) 
Getting connected with your advisor is a key first step up re-enrollment. The [ACES](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/) team is here to help ensure you have everything in place to continue and thrive in your academic pursuits at UW.
Register for Classes 
Returning students will [register for classes](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/registering-for-class/index.html) via WyoWeb. If you attended any other academic institutions before returning to UW, be sure to submit transcripts for any transferable credits.
Reinstatement After Academic Suspension 
Students who left UW on academic suspension must submit a [Petition for Reinstatement through ACES](https://www.uwyo.edu/aces/academic-advising/students-seeking-reinstatement.html). To re-enroll, you will need to be admitted to UW and reinstated by your academic department.
Financial Aid and Scholarships 
Returning students will need to re-apply for [financial aid and scholarships](https://www.uwyo.edu/sfa/index.html).
UW Student Success and Graduation Hub 
The [Student Success and Graduation Hub](https://www.uwyo.edu/student-success/index.html) is a key resource for all UW students, offering support for a smooth return and ensuring long-term success in your academic journey.
Available Housing Options 
Returning students are not required to live in [university housing](https://www.uwyo.edu/living/index.html), but affordable and convenient on-campus options are available and worth considering.
UW Counseling Center 
The [UW Counseling Center](https://www.uwyo.edu/ucc/index.html) is here to support all UW students. Reaching out and connecting with the counseling staff can be a helpful tool as you re-integrate into student life.
UW Student Affairs 
[UW Student Affairs](https://www.uwyo.edu/studentaffairs/index.html) is your go-to hub for resources that support student success. We offer a wide range of services to help you throughout your academic journey and every aspect of UW life.
